 I mer än 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Vi gillar att samarbeta och uppmuntrar varandra att tänka och testa nytt. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Vi bryr oss om varandra och våra kunder och vi vill så klart också att alla tävlingshästar ska må bra. Hela vårt överskott går till hästnäringen – något som både känns och gör gott.
   

  

**Join the game!**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och kommer att göra en bakgrundskontroll för denna roll. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!
   

  

 Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
   

  

* Occupational pension
* Tjänstepension
* Work-life balance
* Personal trainer and gym facilities at the office
* Personlig tränare och gym på kontoret
* Wellness allowance
* Friskvård
* Fri parkering
* Free parking
* Hund på jobbet
* Dog at the office


 Om företaget
   

  

**Så här har vi det** 
 Hos oss är du del av en innovativ miljö och med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar du den bästa spelupplevelsen. Vi gillar att samarbeta och hos oss får du stort utrymme att påverka ditt arbetssätt. Här hittar du nyfikna, nytänkande medarbetare och ledare – viktiga egenskaper för att kunna utveckla och utvecklas. Liksom energi , mod och motivation.
   

  

 För att må bra är skrattmuskeln lika viktig att träna som alla andra muskler. Både den fysiska och den mentala hälsan skapar balans i livet. Hur vi har det på jobbet påverkar privatlivet- och vice versa. Vi ser det som en självklarhet att ge det stöd och de verktyg som behövs. Ditt val av arbetsplats och arbetssätt är flexibelt och vi lägger stor vikt på självledarskap.
   

  

 Vi bryr oss om varandra och respekterar varandras olikheter på ATG. Och vi vill att våra kunder ska må bra och ha roligt när de spelar. Vi bryr oss också om sportens välmående, dvs. idrottarna och hästarna - och samhället runt omkring oss. Vi drivs inte av privata vinstintressen utan allt överskott går tillbaka till våra ägare, svensk trav- och galoppsport, något som både känns och gör gott.

title: System Test Engineer to Excillum!
description:
Do you want to work with the company behind the world´s brightest X-ray source? Great, then you´ve come to the right place! Excillum is a leading company in the field of high-end microfocus and nanofocus X-ray sources and was founded in 2007 by researchers from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH). As a System Test Engineer at Excillum, you will be part of a company with a friendly and helpful work environment with humble and motivated colleagues, who all contribute to enable new science, improve medicine and enhance manufacturing by continuous development of state-of-the-art X-ray sources.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Excillum Aktiebolag
 



  

**City :**
 Kista
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 Excillum designs, develops, and manufactures X-ray sources with the world's highest brightness and with the world’s smallest spot depending on which product line you look at. The X-ray sources are used in a wide range of areas including quality assurance in semiconductors, electronics, and battery manufacturing. Other application areas are in the development of new medicine and research for example in biology, medicine, and material science. Since the start in 2007, Excillum has grown and today we are around 80 employees in Stockholm. You will be part of a growing international company with customers all over the world and you will play an important role in the work verifying our sources. Excillum is characterized by a strong engineering culture and except from your team, you will collaborate with experts in, for example, electronics, software, research, production and sales. Excillum site is in Kista with both lab and production in-house, which means that you will work close to the products you are developing.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* The opportunity to grow with the company
  
* The opportunity to influence working methods and share your knowledge
  
* A company with a friendly and helpful work culture where we listen to each other
  

  


**Work tasks**

 You will part of the newly established System & Test group at Excillum, meaning you will play an important role in building up this position and help Excillum create a vision and strategy for their testing. The goal of the role is dual; both to ensure the design of new products and that they can be tested systematically in production. This includes understanding customer demands, the current test set-up and identifying a strategy to meet customer expectations. As Excillum is a small company this is a broad role where you are encouraged to take overall responsibility and dive into a range of tasks which could include different types of test, review of manuals or customer interactions.
 


  


 You will for example...
 


  

  
* Work in cross-functional projects collaborating with different engineering disciplines as well as product management, service and production.
  
* Conduct hands-on testing, analyze results and together with the team come up with improvements.
  
* Create and implement the production line with appropriate tests.
  

  


**We are looking for**

 For this position, and at Excillum in general, we attach great importance to you as a person and your interest for the position and the company. We believe in the right attitude!
 


  


 Since this is an important role at Excillum, you also need…
 


  

  
* A bachelor or master’s degree within electronics, mechatronics, physics or similar
  
* Several years of work experience with test of industrial products containing both hardware and software
  
* Knowledge in different types of tests
  
* Experience of automated testing. Able to set up automatic test environment and write tests
  
* Experience from production test
  
* Strong knowledge in English
  


  


  

**Other information**



  

  
* Start: Immediate, but an eventual notice period or other circumstances will be considered
  
* Work extent: Fulltime
  
* Location: Kista in Stockholm, Sweden
  
* This recruitment process is conducted by Academic Work. It is a request from Excillum that all questions regarding the position are handled by Academic Work.
  
* Contact information: Recruitment Consultant Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  
* Our selection process is ongoing and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Excillum Aktiebolag**

 Read more about Excillum on their website: https://www.excillum.com/
   




**Get directly recruited to Excillum Aktiebolag**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Johanna Sörell or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv3@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106268

title: Azurearkitekt
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 300 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på sex kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn och Oslo.*
**Vi är öppna – är du?**
 Är du redo att vara en del av framtidens molnlösningar? Vår verksamhet inom Azure Services växer, och vi söker nu efter fler underbara kollegor som brinner för att utveckla, designa och implementera systemlösningar i Azure!
   

  

 Som Azurearkitekt hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med både publika och privata molnlösningar där du kommer att ansvara för att utveckla lösningar på Azure-stacken. Arbetet kommer variera mellan olika plattformarna där integration kommer vara en återkommande del. På Redpill Linpro värdesätter vi samarbete och du kommer att arbeta nära andra kollegor för att göra en verklig skillnad för samhället, tillsammans med våra kunder.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen känner du dig bekväm med att designa system som tar hänsyn till framtida förändringar. Du tänker proaktivt och har förståelse för att affärsprocesser ska tas hänsyn till innan du ger dig på tekniken. Vidare förstår du skillnaden mellan att jobba ”agilt” och att designa ett "agilt" system. Du vill lära dig nya saker och är bekväm med att ifrågasätta dina egna lösningar. Du frågar inte efter en färdig kravspecifikation men är villig att ta fram denna tillsammans med kunden.
   

  

**Som Azurearkitekt hos oss kommer du att arbeta med:**
* Ta fram krav tillsammans med kunden
* Identifiera ”core use-cases” utifrån framtagna krav
* Ta fram arkitektur på en konceptuell nivå och föreslå dens möjliga realiseringar
* Ta fram kostnadskalkyler och motivera val av tekniker
* Serverless teknologier
* Container lösningar
* Meddelandebaserade kommunikationsteknologier (ServiceBus, EventHub, etc)
* Diverse storage lösningar (SQL, Cosmos, Blob etc.)
* API design och livscykel
* DevOps
* C#, .NET, Typescript, Javascript eller Java


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är det viktigt att du har ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utveckla dig inom nya områden och ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och delar värderingen att samarbete är det som tar oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver detta ser vi att du uppfyller följande:**
* Har några års erfarenhet av utveckling, arkitektur eller liknande arbete
* Har goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Du har varit med/ansvarat för kommunikationen med affärssidan för att förstå vad det är för system man bygger och vem man bygger det för


**Meriter:**
* Du har gått kurser som ges av iDesign eller Barry O'Reilly på DF Kompetens.
* Du är certifierad arkitekt
* Du har tidigare suttit med konsultarbete eller tagit fram kravställning hos kunder


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Karlstad Linköping, Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Trondheim with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: IT-Arkitekt till Reitan Convenience Sweden
description:
Som IT-Arkitekt hos Reitan Convenience Sweden (RCS) har du en nyckelroll i att leda arbetet med IT-arkitektur hos de två största varumärkena i koncernen, vilka är Pressbyrån och 7-Eleven. RCS är franchisegivare för cirka 400 butiker som drivs av framgångsrika köpmän där din roll är att vidareutveckla IT-arkitekturen och se till så att den stödjer verksamhetens tekniska behov nu och i framtiden. Ta chansen och sök, urval görs löpande!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Reitan Convenience Sweden AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Teknik
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 På Reitan Convenience Sveriges servicekontor gör vi allt för att underlätta för franchisetagarna i deras arbete ute i våra butiker. Vi är starkt värderingsstyrda där omtänksamhet och att bry som om varandra är en självklarhet för oss. På vårt nybyggda servicekontor är vi ca 115 medarbetare uppdelade på avdelningarna: Sälj, Marknad & Inköp, HR & Hållbarhet, IT, Bygg & Etablering, Ekonomi, Affärsutveckling och Data Analys. Vi är stolta över vårt hållbarhetsarbete som du kan läsa mer om här .
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Att vara
   

**en viktig spelare i företagets förändringsresa**
 mot att använda teknologi för att förbättra affären, där du får stor frihet att förverkliga dina idéer och driva din agenda framåt, på det sätt du tror blir bäst.
  
* Goda
   

**möjligheter att påverka**
 i en bred och platt organisation.
  
* Goda förmåner och ett arbete där
   

**balans mellan arbete och privatliv**
 värdesätts. Exempelvis genom sommartid maj- september, friskvårdsbidrag, friskvårdstimme samt andra förmåner.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Äga ansvaret för den övergripande arkitekturen och de ändringar som behövs för att optimera arkitekturen utifrån verksamhetens behov
  
* Guida och styra interna utvecklingsteam i att arbeta i enlighet med övergripande arkitektur
  
* Agera rådgivare avseende arkitektur till övriga IT- och affärsfunktioner
  
* Samarbeta med övriga delar inom Reitan Retail
  
* Dela med dig av nya utvecklingsinitiativ, planera och estimera resurser, samt stötta projekt för att genomföra dessa initiativ
  
* Hantera teknisk roadmap för olika verksamhetsområden
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom applikationsutveckling
  
* Har erfarenhet av att leda och stötta utvecklare
  
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet från att designa och implementera teknisk arkitektur utifrån verksamhetsbehov
  
* Har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom områden som systemutveckling, datorteknik eller motsvarande
  
* Har erfarenhet av att jobba med Google Cloud Platform eller annan liknande molnplattform
  
* Har bred förståelse av att jobba agilt, exempelvis enligt DevOps metodik
  
* Har erfarenhet från retailbolag och en förståelse för affärsområdet
  
* Talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska då du använder båda språken i ditt dagliga arbete
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**
  
* Strukturerad
  
* Problemlösande
  
* Affärsinriktad
  


  


  

**Information om rekryteringsprocessen:**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Personlighets- och problemlösningstester
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work
  
* Intervjuer + case med RCS
  
* Bakgrundskontroll och referenstagning
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work och ansvarig rekryterare Jessica Billquist, jessica.billquist@academicwork.se eller rekryteringskoordinator Minna Loosaar, minna.loosaar@academicwork.se.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Reitan Convenience Sweden AB**

 Läs mer om RCS här !
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Reitan Convenience Sweden AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15100365

title: Global Head of Development
description:
Are you ready to drive the green transition and make a significant impact in the energy sector? Do you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your contributions lead to meaningful change? If this resonates with you, then this opportunity might be your perfect match.
 



  





**Join Us to Facilitate the Green Transition** 




 Electrification and the shift to fossil-free energy create incredible opportunities for individuals, companies, and society. However, these changes also pose challenges, particularly for our energy system. Ingrid Capacity, an energy tech company founded in 2022, is committed to overcoming some of the toughest challenges in the green transition through innovative technology and pioneering software development. We develop and optimize flexible energy assets, such as large-scale battery energy storage, to store electricity when there is a surplus and return it when there is a shortage. This ensures grid stability, increases the adoption of renewable energy sources like wind and solar, and maximizes grid utilization cost-effectively.
 



 Currently, Ingrid Capacity is in a rapid growth phase, with a historic expansion of energy storage in Sweden and international expansion on the horizon. We have approximately 200 MW under construction, over 200 MW entering the construction phase, and a development pipeline exceeding 7 GW across Europe. Our headquarters are located in Stockholm, Sweden.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As the Global Head of Development, you will play a pivotal role in Ingrid Capacity’s growth across Europe. You will manage the development of renewable energy assets, overseeing the entire process from market entry to the development of ready-to-build projects.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Business Origination:** 
 Own, build, and manage Ingrid’s pipeline and development process across all target markets.
* **Team Leadership:** 
 Lead the European development team, prioritize actions, and recruit key resources.
* **Project Development:** 
 Guide the team from site identification to Ready to Build (RTB).
* **Coordination:** 
 Ensure seamless collaboration across internal functions and with external parties.
* **Risk Management:** 
 Own the risk matrix throughout the development pipeline.
* **Partnerships:** 
 Source and manage new partnerships in target markets.
* **M&A Support:** 
 Assist in coordinating M&A activities, including project and asset valuation.
* **Strategy Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with Ingrid’s strategy team on market entry strategies.
* **Stakeholder Relationships:** 
 Maintain and nurture strong relationships with key stakeholders across target markets.



  





**Your Experience and Skills:** 



* Over 10 years of experience in the development of energy projects.
* Proven track record of effectively leading development teams in Europe.
* Fluent in English, both verbal and written.
* University degree in a relevant field such as finance, business, engineering, or management.



  





**Personal Attributes:** 



* Highly driven and results-oriented, with the ability to prioritize across timelines and markets.
* Strong leadership abilities, comfortable working across cultures.
* Structured mindset, ensuring development processes and procedures are followed and improved.
* A generalist with a comprehensive understanding of project development facets, from identification and licensing to legal, finance, and tax aspects.



  





**What We Offer** 




 At Ingrid Capacity, we are not just employees; we are pioneers, visionaries, and catalysts for change. We stand at the forefront of the global energy transition, committed to shaping the future of power generation. Our company is more than a workplace; it is a platform for innovation where bold ideas are turned into reality.
 



 We believe that the foundation of a successful company lies in its culture. At Ingrid Capacity, we understand that building a thriving organization requires more than technology and innovation; it requires a culture rooted in trust, growth, and learning from mistakes. We are dedicated to the well-being of our colleagues, offering regular social activities and group training classes to create a workplace where everyone can truly thrive.
 



  





**Application** 




 Does this sound like a match? We welcome you to apply! Selections will be made on an ongoing basis, and we will finalize the recruitment once we find the perfect match. Please do not wait to submit your application.
 



 Our recruitment partner, Green Recruitment Company, is managing the process, and the lead recruiter is Nathan Quinn (nathan@greenrecruitmentcompany.com). Please note that applications are only accepted through the link provided.
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



 /Team Ingrid Capacity

title: (Senior) Integration Solution Architect – based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

 The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Platforms & Services Department (P&S), Integration Division (INT) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **(Senior) Integration Solution Architect** 
**\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
*\*Internal benchmark (Senior) Officer IT Applications*
***Panel interviews are anticipated for May 2024***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will join our dynamic team to design and implement cutting-edge integration solutions. In this role, you will be the Architect of innovation, weaving together complex systems into seamless, efficient, and effective solutions, while evolving our Integration platforms to meet the highest architectural standards and best practices.
   

  

 Look no further – your next career opportunity awaits!
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The primary role of the Integration Division is to provide well-designed and well-run integration platforms, working as a force multiplier for application teams and citizen developers, delivering standards, well-proven practices, services and solutions, enabling application teams and citizen developers to do the right things in the right way with substantial autonomy.
   

  

 As an Integration Solution Architect, you will be responsible for designing and implementing integration solutions that connect disparate systems, applications, and data sources. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, assess existing architectures, and develop comprehensive integration strategies. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and excellent communication skills.
   

  

 This is a pivotal role directly reporting to the Head of Division.
   

  

 You will work in close collaboration with various IT teams and internal stakeholders. You will have privilege connections with the Enterprise Architecture Team.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Design end-to-end Integration solutions to meet specific user needs and ensure compliance with the Enterprise Architecture Standards, IT Security Policies, and industry best practices.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and analyze integration requirements.
* Assess existing systems and identify opportunities for integration and improvement.
* Develop architectural designs, data models, and integration patterns.
* Define, together with Enterprise Architecture, standards, guidelines and best practices for integration development.
* Provide guidance and support to application teams throughout the integration lifecycle.
* Evolve the Integration Platforms in accordance with Enterprise Architecture guidelines and industry standards to ensure its long-term cost-effectiveness, Business value, usability, efficiency, maintainability, and scalability.
* Communicate the solution architecture vision to the team and provide supervision and guidance throughout the development process to ensure high-quality solutions.
* Conduct presentations and coaching for other IT Teams to facilitate adoption and efficient use of new Integration standards and technologies.
* Follow new market trends and propose innovative approaches to maximise IT’s contribution to the Business, initiating and contributing to IT-wide initiatives in the field of Integration.
* Manage projects to ensure solution delivery within the set schedule, budget and quality objectives, as also keep the stakeholders informed on the progress, timing and budget of the projects.
* Coordinate with other IT teams in the context of their IT projects, provide effort and cost estimates for IT Integration contribution to the projects and supervise the execution of tasks assigned to IT Integration.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Engineering, Information Technology, Information Management or related field.
* Proven experience as an Integration Solution Architect or similar role.
* At least 5 years’ relevant professional experience of design and implementation of software Solutions.
* Proven experience and excellent technical knowledge of the tools and architecture of the Integration stack, including API Management, Event Streaming, Enterprise Service Bus. Data Virtualization, message-oriented middleware, SOA and microservice enabling technologies would be an asset.
* Broad and deep experience working in varied software development platforms and environments such as Java, Python, JavaScript, vendor packages, and Tomcat/JBoss.
* Hands-on experience with web services, RESTful APIs, XML, JSON, and other integration protocols
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Knowledge of security aspects of integrated system design and associated protocols, including token-based authorization and encryption.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

**This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.**

title: Head of Security
description:
Nordnet redefined the financial world as the first digital bank in Europe. Now we are about to do it again and the aim is to create the next generation of bank, in the cloud. We know this requires great people, great teams, great leadership, and great security. Do you want to build the most secure banking platform in the Nordics? We are seeking a Head of Security to join the management team for Tech and drive our security strategy forward, while building a high-performing technology department.
   

  

**Overview**
 We are a technology company operating in a trust business with high expectations on user experience. Our success is as dependent on rapid innovation as it is on protecting our customers' data and assets. Key to our success is turning innovation and security into everyone's responsibility. This is the rationale behind our 'shift-left' approach to security, which engages our entire 250-person Tech department in actively contributing to protecting our platform. We are undergoing a technical transformation, rebuilding our entire platform in the cloud to enhance innovation capabilities, security, and scalability. As part of this transformation, it is vital to develop a security strategy that ensures we secure our platform throughout this transition. We are searching for a visionary leader who can create and implement a security strategy that aligns with our 'shift-left' approach, protecting our platform during this transition as well as balancing our need for high-paced innovation with the necessary controls and security associated with running a licensed business.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute a security strategy that balances team autonomy and alignment with Nordnet's security objectives
* Lead and support the security team and promote a culture of continuous improvement and collaboration
* Evolve and uphold Nordnet's capability to monitor threats and vulnerabilities as well as detect, investigate, respond to and recover from incidents
* Collaborate with leaders across the organization to embed security considerations in all Tech teams and departments
* Promote a culture of security awareness throughout the organization
* Stay ahead of emerging security trends, regulations, and technologies to continuously enhance our security posture


**What We Believe In**
 We take great pride in our culture, valuing collaboration, self-leadership and ownership. We believe motivated teams solving tough problems together are an even more important key to company success than the best strategy can ever offer. This is something we expect you to embody in your daily work. Central to our approach are empowered teams and individuals who are continuously striving for improvement. We prefer learning through hands-on experience and experiments, and we embrace diversity and inclusion in all aspects of our work. We strive to use data to create clarity and support decisions, ensuring that we remain adaptable and forward-thinking.
   

  

**This Is You**
* Experienced in managing security teams within dynamic, tech-driven environments.
* Seasoned in pragmatic application of security frameworks such as NIST
* Proficient in designing and implementing comprehensive security frameworks, policies, and practices.
* Skilled in crisis management, with the ability to lead effectively during security incidents.
* Strong communicator and capable of facilitating collaboration across departments.
* Passionate about developing teams, promoting security awareness, and driving cultural change.
* Experience with cloud security and infrastructure is desirable.
* Experience as Information/IT Security specialists, Security Engineer or similar positions within tech-driven environments
* Formal education in a relevant field


**What We Offer**
 We offer you the opportunity to work in a Nordic environment with a strong focus on delivery, product development and technology. Our ambitions are high and you will embark on a fast and challenging journey together with a skillful team of sharp and committed colleagues.
   

  

 Culture is built and cared for, each day by everyone. We’re proud of ours. Having a flat organization where anyone can talk to anyone creates a warm and friendly atmosphere worth protecting. We believe in a culture where every effort counts and where everyone is being recognized. A culture embracing our core values – passion, simplicity and transparency on all levels, no matter who you are or what you do.
   

  

 We are over 900 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen.
   

  

 Visit us on: www.nordnetab.com and https://career.nordnetab.com
   

  

**Questions & applications**
 If you have questions, please contact Head of Talent Acquisition, Heidi Ershult, heidi.ershult@nordnet.se.
   

  

 Apply today – please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.
   

  

 We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts mandatory credit and background checks, as well as drug testing as a part of our recruitment process.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Deputy Station Manager
description:
Join our team as a Deputy Station Manager and be responsible for ensuring safe, secure, and customer-oriented service delivery at the station. Take charge of creating a welcoming atmosphere and strive for consistent service improvement.
   

  

 If you're ready to ensure top-notch ground handling operations, apply now!
   

  

**Tasks**
 The
 **Deputy Station Manager** 
 is responsible for
   

  

* Building strong connections with high-value customers and ensuring they receive top-notch service
* Serving as the face of customer care when designated by the Station Manager
* Upholding the company's product philosophy and values among staff
* Monitoring staff appearance and attitude to maintain high standards
* Leading daily flight briefings to keep personnel informed and prepared
* Overseeing the performance of all suppliers involved
* Playing a role in developing and updating procedures
* Collaborating on handling processes for alternate airports
* Acting as the Station Manager's right-hand person in all station matters
* Ensuring compliance with operator's manuals and local interface agreements


**Requirements**
 The ideal
 **Deputy Station Manager** 
 should meet the following requirements:
   

  

* High school diploma/GED required
* Bachelor's degree desirable
* 3-5 years of work experience in the airline industry
* 2-3 years of work experience in ground handling
* Leadership experience desired
* He/she has a passion for excellent service and promotes its delivery on a sustainable basis
* Excellent written and spoken English language skills required
* Knowledge of German and/or Swedish language desirable
* Knowledge of airport procedures and processes
* Successful completion of Training in Passenger Service and/or Aircraft Handling (including but not limited to DCS systems)
* PC and aviation specific supported software /tools (including all MS Office programs) skills required
* Project management and strategic thinking desirable
* Must possess permit to work in Sweden
* Willingness to travel
* Must possess a valid driver’s license
* Must be willing to work shifts
* This position is available at 80%-100% FTE, depending on the candidate's availability and preference


**Company**
 The Lufthansa Group is an aviation group with operations worldwide. It plays a leading role in its European home market. It plays a leading role in its European home market. With 96,677 employees, the Lufthansa Group generated revenue of EUR 35,442m in the financial year 2023. Deutsche Lufthansa AG is organized into the business segments Network Airlines, Point-to-Point Airlines, the Aviation Services segment with the business segments Logistics, MRO and the other companies and Group functions.

title: Commercial Account Executive
description:
Pocketlaw is seeking a motivated and dynamic Commercial Account Executive to join our growing sales team. This role is perfect for someone early in their sales career, with 0-2 years of experience in B2B sales preferable. As a Commercial Account Executive, you will play a key role in driving Pocketlaw’s growth by engaging with potential clients, understanding their needs, and presenting our innovative AI solution.
   

  

 This position reports directly to the VP of GTM and offers significant opportunities for professional development within a fast-paced, expanding company.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead Generation: Identify and engage potential clients through various channels, including outbound prospecting, email campaigns, and social selling.
* Product Demonstrations: Present and demonstrate Pocketlaw’s solutions to prospective clients, highlighting how our tools can meet their business needs.
* Relationship Building: Develop strong relationships with clients by understanding their challenges and delivering solutions that add value.
* Pipeline Management: Manage and track your sales pipeline to ensure a consistent flow of opportunities and effective follow-up.


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field is preferred.
* 0-2 years of experience in B2B sales, with a preference for SaaS experience.
* Intelligent, strong communicator with strong interpersonal skills.
* Ability to learn quickly and adapt to a fast-paced environment.
* Driven, self-motivated, and eager to achieve and exceed sales targets.
* Fluency in Swedish and English required


**Key Competencies**
* Proactive: Takes initiative and works independently to drive sales outcomes.
* Results-Oriented: Focused on achieving and exceeding sales targets.
* Team Player: Works well within a team, contributing to collective goals.
* Strong Communicator: Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


**Salary & Location**
* 35,000 SEK base salary per month, with double OTE commission structure.
* Stockholm office


**About Pocketlaw**
 Pocketlaw is an AI legal tech company reimagining legal work for every team. We enable companies to centralise legal processes and automate contract management through intuitive tools, automation, and AI. Headquartered in Stockholm, with offices in London, Pocketlaw is rapidly expanding after continued revenue growth.
   

  

****Join us at Pocketlaw and be a part of the future of legal tech!****
 Pocketlaw helps companies solve their everyday legal needs - empowering every team in the organisation to create contracts and manage legal with efficiency, ease and confidence. Pocketlaw is transforming legal for businesses; turning it from a business blocker into a business enabler - with the end goal of giving every company in the world legal peace of mind.

title: Business Analyst within Card Simplification Programme to big bank!
description:
Join a pioneering Card Simplification Programme (CSP) and drive the future of card payments across the Nordics. We're seeking a seasoned Business Analyst with deep expertise in card domains to harmonize product services and streamline operations. Welcome with your application!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 September
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Senior Business Analyst within the Nordic Product Harmonization team, you will lead investigations and resolve discrepancies across card product offerings in the Nordic region. You'll collaborate closely with stakeholders to define and document business requirements, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives. This role offers an opportunity to influence the next generation of card management solutions, enhancing efficiency and customer experience.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Investigate, analyze, articulate and process rather complex business requirements and solutions
  
* Create requirement documentation for stakeholders in the form of epics, user features, process and service descriptions
  
* Prepare decision materials for senior management
  
* Drive analysis as part of a small team of Business Analysts
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in Card domain (preferably cards issuing from the business/product side). Past positions could be as a Product manager, SME, Process/Service manager, PO, development manager or alike
  
* Preferably experience from Nordic co-operation/International teams
  
* Generalist background with understanding of the whole cards value chain
  
* Ability to understand bot IT and Business and to be able to interact in both domains
  
* Strong Stakeholder management skills and self-drive
  
* Basic understanding of agile methodologies and tools like Jira and Confluence is a must
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Detailed end-to-end understanding of functionality and processes related to one or two cards areas like PIN mgnt, transactions flow incl 3DS or more
  
* Basic understanding of scheme rules and legislation as well as ability to define product strategy and roadmap
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Molly Rytter or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stw06@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105764

title: Internal Communications Manager to Academic Work Group
description:
We are excited to welcome a new team member who is ready to make a significant impact on our internal communications. Apply today and be part of our journey towards excellence in communication!
 


 Apply here on other site
 
  

**Company :**
 Academic Work Group AB
 



  

**City :**
 Stockholm, Torsplan
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Marketing / Information / Media
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 At Academic Work, we have high ambitions. We want to be the best at what we do, reaching new heights together with our colleagues while having fun along the way. With a clear goal of expanding our business in the next couple of years, we are now entering a thrilling phase of growth and the importance of engaging communication to our coworkers is greater than ever.
 


  


 We are now looking for an Internal Communications Manager to join our People & Performance team and help us achieve our ambitious goals. In this new role, you will have the opportunity to shape our internal communication strategy and play a pivotal role in securing a shared vision within Academic Work, directly influencing and strengthening our company culture and employee engagement.
 


  

  

**What you will be doing:**
  


 As Internal Communications Manager at Academic Work, you will play a crucial role in creating, supporting and executing our internal communication strategy to align seamlessly with our overall company vision. Your responsibilities will include setting and managing an annual internal communication plan, defining key messages, and outlining detailed execution plans that specify why, how, when, and to whom these messages should be communicated. You will produce high-quality communication materials across various methods and channels, supporting Group Management with communication activities related to change management and other significant company events. Your proactive approach will help identify and suggest innovative communication activities, ensuring an efficient and timely information flow to all stakeholders.
 


  


 At first, your main focus will be on the annual internal communication plan and producing communication material. In time, you will also work to ensure that the right internal communication processes, tools, and platforms are in place, continuously developing and improving the internal communication processes. In this role, you will establish and maintain governance for our communication platforms, ensuring a strategic approach to internal communications. Your expert knowledge will contribute to shaping the future of our organization by creating a unified and engaging internal communications environment to help drive our culture, employee engagement and support our ambitious goals.
 


  


 Having engaged coworkers is one of our top priorities at Academic Work, and as part of the Group People & Performance team, you will be our internal communications expert. By supporting, challenging, and developing our different markets in internal communications, our goal is to reach even higher levels of engagement. You will create a baseline of knowledge to implement and execute processes locally, maintaining a consistent and engaging tone of voice that aligns with our values.
   




**Work tasks**

 Your main responsibility will be developing and executing our internal communication strategy, including:
 


  

  
* Setting a yearly internal communication plan.
  
* Producing communication material.
  
* Proactively identifying needs for communication activities.
  
* Managing communication flows.
  
* Ensuring clarity and a coherent tone of voice in company communication.
  
* Ensuring the right internal communications processes, tools, and platforms.
  
* Supporting, challenging, and developing our markets
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Experience in internal communications or related field, with a strong interest in internal communications.
  
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English. Proficiency in Swedish is a plus.
  
* Familiarity with content management systems, video production, and editing software.
  


  


 To be successful in the role of Internal Communications Manager, we believe you are:
 


  

  
* An excellent communicator who can convey the message effectively, both verbally and in writing.
  
* A creative writer with the ability to translate business information into persuasive texts.
  
* A goal-oriented person with a proactive approach and a good sense of structure.
  
* An inquisitive mind that likes to use knowledge creatively and is passionate about understanding and learning.
  


  

  

**Additional Information**
  


  

**Location:**
 Stockholm, Torsplan
 


  


  

**Start date:**
 According to agreement
 


  


  

**Last day to apply:**
 September 8th
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 The first step in the recruitment process is to complete two tests by Alva Labs. One is a personality mapping which takes 15-20 minutes to complete, the other a cognitive ability test which takes 10-15 minutes to complete. The reason we use tests is to ensure a solid and fair recruitment process focusing on potential for the position we are hiring for rather than your CV. If you proceed, the next step is a phone interview followed by a behavioral descriptive interview with Lisette Lind, Group Talent Acquisition Manager. The final step is an interview with Caroline Ehnsiö, Chief People & Performance Officer, together with a member from the People & Performance team. Before the final interview, you might be asked to provide a work sample such as a text or video you have produced for internal communication purposes.
   




**Academic Work Group AB**

 ACADEMIC WORK - HOME OF THE YOUNG PROFESSIONALS. We specialize in the placement of young professionals and offer career opportunities for students and academics with up to five years of professional experience.
 


  


 We reward ambition - Our focus as an employer is to create a positive environment and a culture in which our employees can mutually motivate and develop each other - professionally as well as personally. And with self-confidence, we can say that we are particularly good at it. Find out more about our promise to you as an employee here.
 


  


 Career-site
 


  


 Instagram
 


  


 Facebook
 


  


 Academic Work - We make people grow - YouTube
 


  

  

**Benefits:**
  


 At Academic Work we offer a wide range of benefits. In addition to of course having collective agreements and several insurances, examples of benefits include;
 


  

  
* 30 vacation days per year, an added 3 days after 3 years of employment and a further 2 days after 5 years.
  
* Wellness is something we highly value, besides the wellness grant of 4000 SEK per year, we offer discounted massages and the opportunity to participate in one training session per day at our Stockholm office or 30 minutes per day to use for another wellness activity of your choosing.
  
* Our flexibility policy means that we work from our new office at Torsplan approx. 2-3 days a week, while the rest of the time you decide for yourself what suits you the best.
  
* Laptop (are you team PC or Mac? You get to choose!) and iPhone 12 with unlimited data.
  
* Great focus on your professional development.
  
* Free breakfast, regular events and conferences.
  

  


**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Lisette Lind or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on lisette.lind@academicwork.com Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106389

title: Senior IAM-arkitekt
description:
**Vem är du?**
 Du vill vara med och bygga framtidens IAM-lösningar? Du tycker att identiteter och behörigheter är det roligaste som finns? Du vill som senior IAM-arkitekt skapa en säker digital värld där alla känner sig trygga? Du vill i din roll som senior IAM-arkitekt arbeta inom spännande branscher som energisektorn, bank & finans, eHälsa och samhällskritisk IT-infrastruktur och ha det som en naturlig del i din vardag? Du vill arbeta i ett väletablerat IAM-team med 11 IAM-specialister, och även arbeta tillsammans med 150 likasinnade, dedikerade specialister inom området Cybersäkerhet och Juridik? Välkommen till Knowit!
   

  

**Din erfarenhet?**
 Vi tror att du har en relevant högskoleutbildning och minst 3 års konsulterfarenhet från att jobba som IAM-arkitekt. Du har arbetat med olika IAM-verktyg och teknologier och har en djupgående kunskap om IAM-lösningar. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med och implementera lösningar inom olika områden som t.ex. IGA och PAM. Du är en person som har arbetat med analys och modellering av behörighetsroller samt informations- eller datamodellering. Vi söker dig som har ett driv och engagemang utöver det vanliga och gillar att ta dig an uppgifter som verkligen sätter dina kunskaper på prov. Du är en person som har förmågan att se såväl helheten som detaljer i ställda krav samt är kreativ och tänker utanför ramarna. Vi tror att du har en stark problemlösarförmåga och gillar att arbeta både självständigt och i grupp.
   

  

 Du har lätt att sätta dig in i kundens verksamhet, och har arbetat med organisationer och företag av olika storlekar. Du känner dig bekväm med, och har lätt för att i dialog med kunden skapa dig en uppfattning av kundens behov, för att sedan med din erfarenhet och kunskap omvandla det till praktiska lösningar. Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av diskussioner och rådgivning på alla nivåer inom en organisation.
   

  

**Vad kommer du att arbeta med?**
 Som IAM-arkitekt stödjer du våra projekt genom att analysera krav och specificera lösningar som uppfyller våra kunders behov, både på kort och lång sikt. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar funktionell och teknisk kravanalys, design av lösningsarkitektur, val av systemkomponenter, specifikation av integrationsbehov och estimering av utvecklingstid.
   

  

 Som IAM-arkitekt hos oss kommer du att vara delaktig i och leda kundprojekt tillsammans med dina kollegor för att driva och utveckla våra kunders förmåga inom IAM. Du är en person som dina kollegor och kunder vänder sig till med frågor då du både besitter bred och djup kompetens men också då du är öppensinnad och älskar att dela med dig av dina erfarenheter. Du tar även en aktiv roll i att kvalitetssäkra slutresultat för att uppnå en hög kundnöjdhet.
   

  

 För oss är din möjlighet att utvecklas och må bra viktigt. Att hitta en balans mellan privatliv och arbetsliv är en del i det. Likaså möjligheten till personlig utveckling, roliga och spännande uppdrag samt att alla bidrar till vår härliga företagskultur. Knowit är stolt över att vara en arbetsplats som främjar mångfald, jämlikhet, och inkludering. Vi har en förmånlig föräldrauppfyllnad samt bra pensions- och försäkringsvillkor.
   

  

**Vilka är vi?**
 Säkerhet i AI, självkörande fordon och samhällskritisk IT-infrastruktur i kombination med den juridiska komplexitet som digitalisering medför, är en naturlig del i vår vardag. Vi är 150 dedikerade specialister inom området cybersäkerhet och juridik och vi finns på fem orter i Norden; Göteborg, Karlskrona, Linköping, Oslo och Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi besitter en mycket hög spetskompetens inom IAM områdets alla delar, med en bra blandning av kompetenser med allt ifrån arkitekter, processpecialister eller duktiga utvecklare. I vår IAM grupp har vi en fantastisk gemenskap och fokuserar verkligen på vad varje enskild individ vill göra. Vi brinner för att utveckla, hjälpa och stödja varandra och våra kunder att nå nya nivåer inom IAM området. Nu vill vi bygga vidare på vår IAM-affär och söker därför fler drivna seniora IAM-arkitekter.
   

  

 För oss är det viktigt att alla medarbetare utvecklas och mår bra. Att hitta en balans mellan privatliv och arbetsliv är en del i det. Likaså möjligheten till personlig utveckling, roliga och spännande uppdrag samt att alla bidrar till vår härliga företagskultur. Vi har en förmånlig föräldrauppfyllnad samt bra pensions- och försäkringsvillkor. Förhoppningsvis gillar du sjuk humor och har någon konstig hobby - då kommer du att trivas hos oss!
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Vi använder oss av löpande urval, skicka därför gärna in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Frågor om tjänsten hanteras av Carlos Marjasin som du kan kontakta på e-post carlos.marjasin@knowit.se alt. mobilnr: 076-812 01 09, eller Mikael Hermansson på e-post mikael.hermansson@knowit.se alt mobilnr: 070-234 38 22.
   

  

 För denna tjänst kommer kapacitets- och personlighetstester genomföras på alla sökanden, samt bakgrundskontroll på slutkandidat.
   

  

 Vissa av våra kunduppdrag kräver svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

*Knowit Insight är med sina nästan 500 medarbetare en av de starkare digitala managementkonsulterna i Norden. Vi är specialiserade på att hjälpa våra kunder utveckla och förstärka de förmågor som krävs av framgångsrika organisationer i framtiden.*

title: HR Generalist
description:
**Join Hazelight Studios as an HR Generalist! Shape our workplace, manage key HR functions, and support our award-winning game development team. Make an impact!** 




  





 We are looking for an experienced HR Generalist to join our Operations team. This role will cover a broad range of HR responsibilities, with a particular focus on enhancing our work environment, strengthening employee relations, promoting diversity and inclusion, and managing compensation programs. If you're passionate about HR and committed to building a great workplace culture, we'd love to hear from you.
 



  





**About Us:** 




 Hazelight is a renowned video game development studio known for creating innovative and engaging gaming experiences. Led by the visionary director Josef Fares, we are the creators of the critically acclaimed titles "It Takes Two" (Game of the Year 2021), "A Way Out," and "Brothers: A Tale of Two Sons." Our mission is to push the boundaries of interactive storytelling and deliver exceptional entertainment to players worldwide. We value creativity, collaboration, and continuously striving to create games that resonate deeply with our audience.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Develop and implement initiatives to create a positive and inclusive work environment.
* Handle employee relations issues, facilitate open communication, and ensure compliance with company policies and legal requirements.
* Own compensation programs and payroll management.
* Conduct market research to ensure competitive and equitable practices, and provide guidance on compensation-related matters.
* Support change management processes, ensuring smooth transitions and alignment with organizational goals.



  





**What we are looking for:** 



* We value a down-to-earth and collaborative ‘prestigelös’ attitude, where no task is too small for anyone on the team.
* Proactive and willing to engage in various HR areas, demonstrating flexibility and adaptability.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
* Strong understanding of Swedish employment law and compensation benchmarks.
* Fluency in both English and Swedish.
* Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects independently and efficiently.
* 3+ years of experience in HR
* Previous experience in the gaming industry is a plus.



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Hybrid work with 3 days per week at the office.
* 30 days vacation.
* Max-allowance of Friskvårdbidrag.
* A very competitive yearly profit share bonus.
* A fun and dynamic work environment.



  





 Join us and be part of a team committed to making a difference in our workplace. If you like what you read please send your cover letter and CV in English.

title: FP&A Manager, EMEA
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences that truly revolve around their customers - no matter the channels they use. More than 150,000 businesses - including many of the world's largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
   

  

 We dream big - for our company, our customers and our employees - and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries - probably somewhere near you!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a FP&A Manager, EMEA, you will support and challenge managers and their organizations to achieve financial goals, offer strategic insights and lead reporting and budgeting process. You will support Revenue growth, OPEX control and cost optimization through proactive business follow-up.
   

  

 This role is based at our HQ in Stockholm, Sweden but we are open to other major Sinch European locations as well. The role reports to VP, EMEA FP&A.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Partner with Regional senior leadership to drive achievement of financial and operational targets
* Drive full P&L development for the Enterprise or Mid-Market Sales organization
* Provide insight and recommendations to strategic decision making; including but not limited to profitability/ROI analysis, business plan review, cost optimization
* Setup frameworks from a finance perspective to enable commercial success; including but not limited to Sales KPI steering and cost allocation models
* Drive process towards creating a full regional P&L including allocated cost
* Build and manage Regional Business reporting packages, including but not limited to P&L, BS and CF-reporting. Measure, report and challenge business performance.
* In accordance with process guidance from Corporate Control lead budgeting, forecasting and long-range planning processes for the Functions
* Interface with central Financial Operations to ensure accurate and timely reporting
* Support Sinch-wide Finance harmonization initiatives (e.g. ERP implementation)


**About You**
 To be successful in the role you have visionary and strategic mindset yet with strong hands-on ability, willingness to deep dive into details when required. You are a strong communicator that is clear, concise, engaging and persuasive across stakeholder groups, adapting the content & language to the audience. You have a commercial and business focused approach and are able to structure and process qualitative or quantitative data and draw conclusions. Last but not least, you love Excel and is fierce at PowerPoint and have the ability to simplify complex data.
   

  

* Proven experience of Business Controlling or equivalent in a large and international company
* Experience of Accounting or Financial control
* Proven experience from driving financial process transformation and process excellence
* Experience in setting up frameworks for commercial enablement (customer pricing, product costing, market research, etc) and supporting contract negotiations etc.
* Experience in the following systems is a plus: Aaro, Tableau, Salesforce, SAP by Design, Great Plains, Netsuite
* Fluency in English is required


**Our Values**
 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple" and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation for fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results.
   

  

**Bring your authentic self to Sinch**
 Here at Sinch we embrace diversity and work to create an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.
   

  

 We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high performing teams.
   

  

 Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.
   

  

 If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/

title: Senior .NET Utvecklare | Nordiska Galleriet Group
description:
Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär? Med nya ansvarsområden, ökad självständighet och möjlighet att påverkan en av de största industrierna.
 







**Om bolaget** 




*Kommer du ihåg musikvärlden före Spotify, näthandeln före Klarna eller nätbanking före BankID? Nordiska Galleriet är på väg att digitalisera och förändra inrednings- och möbelbranschen – en av världens största och mest traditionella industrier. Vi har som mål att bli den bästa premium möbelåterförsäljaren i världen.*
 Nordiska Galleriet grundades 1912 och blev den självklara destinationen för exklusiva möbler och modern design. År 2016 fick företaget nya ägare, vilket markerade början på en ny expansiv era. Idag är vi över 200 anställda inom en koncern som omsätter 1 miljard SEK.
 



 Ambitionerna är höga och vi ser nu fram emot att expandera vår verksamhet till nya marknader i Europa och världen. NO GA drivs av en företagsamhetskultur och befinner sig i en mycket spännande fas, där du har möjlighet att vara med. Koncernen inkluderar också Länna Möbler, Olsson & Gerthel, YLLW och Dusty Deco.
 



**Om tjänsten** 








 Som mjukvaruingenjör på NO GA kommer du att forma framtiden för handel av inredning. Genom att integrera marknadens bästa verktyg med vår plattformslösning löser vi dem komplexa problemen som är förknippade med att sälja, köpa och leverera designmöbler till våra hundratusentals kunder. Med en modern, legacy-fri, molnbaserad plattform tror vi att vi kan skapa de bästa verktygen och möjliggöra en världsklassupplevelse för både kunder och kollegor.
 



 Du kommer att ha en nyckelroll i kärnutvecklingsteamet och din röst kommer att påverka tekniska beslut, interna processer och teamkultur.
   

  

 Tech stack: 
 


* .NET 8 (snart 9)
* Next.js 14
* ReactJS
* Azure Cloud
* API:er (REST och GraphQL)
* Azure DevOps/GitHub
* Arbeta med fysiska produkter som i sig är konst.







**Erfarenhet och kvalifikationer** 








 Så här ser vi på vår framtida kollega:
 


* Kommunikativ, självgående person
* Ödmjuk och med en tillväxtinriktad inställning
* 8+ års erfarenhet inom Microsoft-ekosystemet
* Erfarenhet av att bygga underhållbara och skalbara lösningar
* Erfarenhet av att bygga lösningar med flera externa integrationer
* God förståelse för verktyg och processer relaterade till god mjukvarukvalitet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift – nästan all intern kommunikation sker på svenska för närvarande

 Det är bra om du också har erfarenhet av:
 

+ E-handel och/eller detaljhandelsbranschen
+ Molnbaserad utveckling
+ Fullstack-utveckling



  









**Om Senterprise**
*Senterprise Sverige AB är ett ledande nischat IT-rekryteringsbolag med expertis inom rekrytering av erfarna systemutvecklare. Vi hjälper idag några av Sverige mest attraktiva arbetsgivare med IT-rekrytering, uthyrning av rekryteringskonsulter samt IT-konsulter.*
*Läs vidare på* 
*www.senterprise.se*

title: Senior Management Consultant
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.
   

  

**The Team:**
 As a Senior Value Consultant you'll be joining our Nordics Value Engineering function, based in Copenhagen. This function is part of the wider Value Engineering organisation at Celonis. The position of Value Engineer is a trusted advisor helping customers achieve their strategic goals and realise significant value using the Celonis Execution Management System. A Value Engineer has full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers – landing, expanding, adopting and renewing. Responsibilities include translating customers’ objectives into value assessments or proof-of-value projects, building specific Celonis business cases and demos, running value workshops, and engaging with multiple senior stakeholders to deliver value driven results and secure long term partnership agreements.
   

  

**The Role:**
 As a Senior Value Consultant you are spearheading our mission of data-driven business transformation with our customers. You will work in partnership with the Celonis Sales Teams and have full responsibility for the end-to-end value journey of our customers. You are our customers trusted advisor and help them achieve their strategic goals and realize significant value using Celonis EMS. In collaboration with our partners and Celonis Services, you will drive measurable business impact across various processes and industries and accelerate the adoption of our platform. You will blend deep process and industry expertise with a proven consulting skill set with strong analytical skills at the forefront of one of the fastest-growing tech companies worldwide.
   

  

**The work you’ll do:**
**Identify & Frame Value**
* Discover and translate customers’ strategic priorities into high-impact Celonis use cases
* Build demos and business cases, leveraging industry benchmarks and best practices in order to win new customers
* Undertake Value Assessments or Proof-of-Value Projects and communicate the value opportunity and strategic roadmap to C-Level executives


**Realize Value**
* Facilitate business value workshops and use Celonis to identify and qualify opportunities for process enhancement
* Derive improvement measures in core business functions and initiate improvement actions and enterprise-wide change initiatives
* Present results and realized value to senior management and C-level executives


**Scale Value**
* Responsible for the end-to-end customer value journey, landing, expanding, adoption and renewing
* Build a strategic expansion roadmap for customers embedding Celonis EMS as a strategic business transformation platform in their organization and therefore drive adoption and expansion
* Provide feedback to our product development teams to enhance the Celonis platform and Apps based on new use cases


**The qualifications you need:**
* Live for Customer Value: Several years experience in an analytical role with the objective to demonstrate or secure value through business data analysis / analytics, business process improvement and respective Software deployment . Ideally in a customer-facing role in Solution Consulting, Sales Engineering or IT/Management Consulting with a Software provider or a Consultancy. Alternatively in an inhouse role (e.g. Center of Excellence for Data Mining / Analytics / Intelligence) within an Enterprise
* Data, Analytics, Applications & IT: Good knowledge of Business Software applications and experience in using and/ or building dashboards, Apps and Action Flows. Experience in collaborating with IT teams Process Improvement & Value Realization: Experience in identifying use cases for business process improvement and deploying improvement measures, being a change agent and training users/process owners to realize value
* Project Management: Experience in planning and managing project scopes, expectations and timelines. You will manage multiple projects across your aligned accounts that will be at different parts of the value journey. Also, you will leverage partners from the Celonis Ecosystem wherever possible
* Executive Stakeholder Management: Experience in preparing and communicating (value) roadmaps and results to stakeholders and management, both internally and externally. Excellent communication and presentation skills in English and Danish
* Business Domain Expertise: Deep understanding of the Finance and/or Supply Chain domain as well as strategic transformation initiatives (e.g. Shared Services Transformation or System Transformation)
* Industry Expertise: Expertise in one or more industries (e.g. Manufacturing, Automotive, Consumer, Retail, Pharmaceuticals, Chemicals) and the ability to develop a deep understanding of industry trends and strategic opportunities
* Degree: in Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program


**What Celonis can offer you:**
* The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
* Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
* Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
* Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
* A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
* An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
* Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
* A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


**About Us**
 Since 2011, Celonis has helped thousands of the world's largest and most valued companies deliver immediate cash impact, radically improve customer experience and reduce carbon emissions. Its Process Intelligence platform uses industry-leading process mining technology and AI to present companies with a living digital twin of their end-to-end processes. For the first time, everyone in an organisation has a common language about how the business works, visibility into where value is hidden and the ability to capture it. Celonis is headquartered in Munich (Germany) and New York (USA) and has more than 20 offices worldwide.
   

  

 Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.
   

  

 Join us as we make processes work for people, companies and the planet.
   

  

 Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better.
   

  

 Accessibility and Candidate Notices

title: Senior Analytics & Performance Management Manager
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming businesses and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Do you know how to bring value out of data?
   

  

 If Yes, bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career! You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!
   

  

**About Our Nordic SAP Business Group**
 As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major transformation programs.
   

  

 Within our Nordic community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4, SAP BTP, Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, HANA, BW/4, and SAP RISE.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking at candidates for several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**What’s in it for you:**
- Work with some of the largest enterprises in the Nordics and support them in their global transformation journeys

- Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP Analytics group and contribute to thought leadership, competence development and sales initiatives.

- Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career; functional, technical and as a leader.

- A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.

- Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.

- Competitive compensation and benefits.

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert networks and benchmarks.

**As a senior Analytics professional in Accenture, you will:**
- Advise clients about best solutions in regards to Analytics and Data depending on their current situation and unique characteristics

- Lead a team that works closely together with clients to help them get real value out of their data by embedding analytics into their business processes.

- Advice and deliver analytics implementations based on S/4 Analytics extensibility, data warehouse solutions like Datasphere and BW/4HANA, hybrid scenarios leveraging data lake/lakehouse solutions, planning and frontend development in solutions like SAP Analytics Cloud.

- Be able to grow your professional skills within analytics, big data and AI.

- Help clients’ sustainability agenda through cutting-edge analytics.

- Work on selling Analytics projects to clients through RFP processes as well as part of daily work together with our clients.

**Required Qualifications**
- Extensive experience in defining and implementing analytics and planning solutions

- Deep functional knowledge within at least one area of Finance, Sales, Manufacturing or Logistics

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team player

- Passionate about innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English and a Nordic language

- Experience working with sales of Analytics solutions

- M.Sc. or B.Sc. in Business or Engineering, such as Computer Science or Mathematics/Statistics

- Hands-on experience with SAP Analytics technologies such as S/4 Analytics Extensibility, SAP Analytics Cloud (reporting & planning), Datasphere, BW/4 or HANA.

**Preferred Qualifications**
- Experience with data lake/lakehouse solutions

- Experience with enhancing Analytical solutions through AI

**Location**
 Stockholm
   

  

 Pleasenote that due to the summer season, our hiring process may be slower than usual. We apologize for any delay in responding to your applications. Rest assured, we are committed to reviewing each application thoroughly. We appreciate your patience during this time.

title: Internationell B2B Business Developer Praktikant
description:
**Sammanfattning** 




  




* **Färdigheter:** 

 Affärsutveckling, Försäljning och Digital marknadsföring
* **Språk:** 

 Flytande svenska och engelska i både muntlig och skriftlig kommunikation
* **Period:** 

 Startar i mitten eller slutet av september 2024. Minst 5 till 6 månader.
* **Tillväxt:** 

 Exalterad över att lära och växa inom ett företag som är redo för snabb expansion. Denna praktik är avsedd att övergå till en fast tjänst.
* **Företag:** 

 Etablerat sedan 2015. B2B- och B2C-kunder i 10 länder.
* **Produkter:**
