 You are the key lead in driving the collaboration together with our KAM-s and Product Managers to deliver sell out plans. Your most important job is to take our marketing strategy and turn it in to opportunities and activities with both new channels and customers. You are driven by the wish to maximize impact of all our campaigns, ensuring we are leading the visibility and reach in the market. Digital is your middle name, you thrive on turning strategy in to action, maximizing digital presence and visibility in all touch points. With you in the lead, all products within the Samsung IT B2B range will for sure be seen by the engagement you create with our customers.
   

  

**Job scope and key deliverables:**
* Implement and drive the marketing plan together with Sales teams and Product Managers to maximize impact of B2B products
* Set up and deliver digital engagement, campaigns and presence together with the external partners and channels
* Deliver best in class digital experience on partner sites – maximizing Samsungs visibility
* Manage the development and communication of B2B product toolkits
* Responsible for setting objective and KPIs, execution and follow-up of the activities carried out
* Briefing and project management of creative-, media- and action marketing agencies within Samsung’s network and follow-up on the activities and investments on a regular basis


**About you - what we think you need to be successful:**
 You are a person that communicates and networks effectively, is open to new ideas and experiences and plans ahead and works in a systematic and organised way.
   

  

 We believe you have the following experience:
   

  

* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Proven track record of setting plans based on overall marketing strategy and executing the plans in successful ways
* Strong experience with and understanding of developing integrated digital marketing plans and activities
* Proven track record of identifying and applying consumer insights successfully
* Solid experience in customer channel integration & sales maximization (omni-channel perspective, websites, ATL, activation)
* Experience from working with customers or external partners (trade marketing or channel/customer marketing roles)
* Confident and skilled at marketing project management or lead
* Experience in working with campaign analytics
* Strong business acumen and experience in working closely with sales teams to grow market position and drive sales
* Creative problem-solver with a natural drive to see solutions instead of problems, who will live our brand ethos of Do what you can’t
* A bold and ambitious but humble marketer who thrives in a fast-paced, highly changeable environment without losing motivation or focus on the end-goal


**Most relevant qualifications, education and training:**
* University degree within marketing and communication
* Minimum 3 years’ of experience within Customer/Channel Marketing roles measured on sell-out growth
* Preferably experience from consumer electronics business
* Experience from working with retailers


**About The Assignment**
 For this assignment you will be hired as a full-time consultant by Digitalenta. We offer our consultants a generous package including healthcare allowance, insurance policy, paid vacation days and pension savings. In addition, you'll also have a dedicated consultant manager available throughout your employment with us, in addition to optional networking activities with our network of consultants.
   

  

 The assignment is full-time and starting in October 2024 until January 2026.

title: Finnish Sales Development Representative
description:
****JOB DESCRIPTION****
**Job Title: Oracle NetSuite Finnish** 
**speaking Sales Development Representative, New Business**
**Finnish + English**
**Location: Solna**
**Why Oracle NetSuite**
 Founded in 1998, Oracle NetSuite was the first cloud company – ushering in the new era of cloud computing. NetSuite’s mission is to deliver one system, the suite, that gives leaders a complete view into their business.
   

  

 As the industry leading cloud business system recognised in Gartner’s Magic Quadrants, NetSuite includes financials, inventory management, HR, professional services automation, commerce, and more. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world trust NetSuite to give their businesses the visibility, agility, and control needed to make data-informed decisions quickly.
   

  

 NetSuite is a place where you can build a career and have fun while doing so! We’re invested in our people, our customers, and the community. And as part of Oracle, our benefits are second to none. Joining our passionate team means that you’re ready to take your career to the next level. With priceless learning opportunities, strong support, incredible innovation, and volunteer opportunities, NetSuite is committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels empowered and set up for success.
   

  

  

  

**The Oracle NetSuite Sales Development Representative (SDR) Role**
 The SDR role provides a hands-on experience, sourcing and qualifying leads while building product knowledge and developing fundamental sales skills. We are looking to hire our next superstar sales representative to help us continue to accelerate our YoY growth through revenue generation. Within this role, you will get the best of both worlds – training and autonomy. The SDR role provides an unmissable, hands-on learning opportunity that will allow you to contribute to our ongoing success.
   

  

**Want to know more? Check out these resources.**
* NetSuite Instagram
* Netsuite Website
* Netsuite Customer Testimonials
* Netsuite LinkedIn Page
* Netsuite YouTube Channel


****Your Responsibilities****
* Analyze and understand prospective customer needs, personas, processes, projects and requirements in order to ascertain potential solutions.
* Perform outbound prospecting through cold-calling, emails and social media to generate high quality, BANT qualified leads that can be promoted to sales.
* Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of Oracle Netsuite solutions and our value proposition so that you can speak around value and return on investment vs technical functionalities.
* Maintain a high volume of tailored, strategic, multi-channel outreach for your target accounts.
* Confidently interact with and influence key personnel up to and including Executives at the highest levels of an organization
* Build strong relationships and collaborate effectively with the Account Executives that you support.
* Prioritise your time and accounts effectively to ensure success


****Minimum Qualifications****
* Native level of Finnish + fluency in English (additional languages advantageous)
* BS/BA degree in Business Management, Finance or Economics
* Minimum 12 months of professional sales experience involving researching, prospecting, cold-calling and consistent achievement of quota attainment
* Adaptable, resilient, self-starter with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and a desire to succeed
* Excellent communication (verbal, written, and presentation) and interpersonal skills


**Life at Oracle and Equal Opportunity:**
 An Oracle career can span industries, roles, countries, and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.
   

  

 In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.
   

  

 Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.
   

  

 At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles to perform crucial job functions. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
   

  

 Disclaimer: Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

 Career Level - IC1
   

  

****RESPONSIBILITIES****
**Job Title: Oracle NetSuite Finnish speaking Sales Development Representative, New Business**
**Finnish + English**
**Location: Solna**
**Why Oracle NetSuite**
 Founded in 1998, Oracle NetSuite was the first cloud company – ushering in the new era of cloud computing. NetSuite’s mission is to deliver one system, the suite, that gives leaders a complete view into their business.
   

  

 As the industry leading cloud business system recognised in Gartner’s Magic Quadrants, NetSuite includes financials, inventory management, HR, professional services automation, commerce, and more. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world trust NetSuite to give their businesses the visibility, agility, and control needed to make data-informed decisions quickly.
   

  

 NetSuite is a place where you can build a career and have fun while doing so! We’re invested in our people, our customers, and the community. And as part of Oracle, our benefits are second to none. Joining our passionate team means that you’re ready to take your career to the next level. With priceless learning opportunities, strong support, incredible innovation, and volunteer opportunities, NetSuite is committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels empowered and set up for success.
   

  

  

  

**The Oracle NetSuite Sales Development Representative (SDR) Role**
 The SDR role provides a hands-on experience, sourcing and qualifying leads while building product knowledge and developing fundamental sales skills. We are looking to hire our next superstar sales representative to help us continue to accelerate our YoY growth through revenue generation. Within this role, you will get the best of both worlds – training and autonomy. The SDR role provides an unmissable, hands-on learning opportunity that will allow you to contribute to our ongoing success.
   

  

**Want to know more? Check out these resources.**
* NetSuite Instagram
* Netsuite Website
* Netsuite Customer Testimonials
* Netsuite LinkedIn Page
* Netsuite YouTube Channel


****Your Responsibilities****
* Analyze and understand prospective customer needs, personas, processes, projects and requirements in order to ascertain potential solutions.
* Perform outbound prospecting through cold-calling, emails and social media to generate high quality, BANT qualified leads that can be promoted to sales.
* Acquire and maintain a working knowledge of Oracle Netsuite solutions and our value proposition so that you can speak around value and return on investment vs technical functionalities.
* Maintain a high volume of tailored, strategic, multi-channel outreach for your target accounts.
* Confidently interact with and influence key personnel up to and including Executives at the highest levels of an organization
* Build strong relationships and collaborate effectively with the Account Executives that you support.
* Prioritise your time and accounts effectively to ensure success


****Minimum Qualifications****
* Native level of Finnish + fluency in English (additional languages advantageous)
* BS/BA degree in Business Management, Finance or Economics
* Minimum 12 months of professional sales experience involving researching, prospecting, cold-calling and consistent achievement of quota attainment
* Adaptable, resilient, self-starter with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and a desire to succeed
* Excellent communication (verbal, written, and presentation) and interpersonal skills


**Life at Oracle and Equal Opportunity:**
 An Oracle career can span industries, roles, countries, and cultures, giving you the opportunity to flourish in new roles and innovate, while blending work life in. Oracle has thrived through 40+ years of change by innovating and operating with integrity while delivering for the top companies in almost every industry.
   

  

 In order to nurture the talent that makes this happen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that celebrates and values diverse insights and perspectives, a workforce that inspires thought leadership and innovation.
   

  

 Oracle offers a highly competitive suite of Employee Benefits designed on the principles of parity, consistency, and affordability. The overall package includes certain core elements such as Medical, Life Insurance, access to Retirement Planning, and much more. We also encourage our employees to engage in the culture of giving back to the communities where we live and do business.
   

  

 At Oracle, we believe that innovation starts with diversity and inclusion and to create the future we need talent from various backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to successfully participate in the job application, interview process, and in potential roles to perform crucial job functions. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workforce where all individuals can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before.
   

  

 Disclaimer: Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*.  As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.

title: Prominent fashion company is looking for an IT-student!
description:
Here comes an incredible opportunity for you who are a student and have a passion for IT. Our innovative and well-established client now requires a part-time IT support and this is your chance to take the first step into the The IT industry. Here you will grow, gain valuable experience and have the opportunity to excel your resume. Does this sound like something for you? Apply today, we will interview candidates continuously!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Part time
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible.
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Our client is looking for a student who have a flexible schedule and can work approximately 2-3 days a week, and possibly more during school breaks, although the work load may vary from week to week. The position offers a great variety of tasks and excellent opportunities for personal development. Working hours: 08:00-17:00 or 09:00-18:00. Occasional work on evenings or weekends may occur.
 


  


 As a consultant at Academic Work, you will be offered a great opportunity to grow professionally, extend your network and establish valuable contacts for the future.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* You will mainly work with providing technical support and assisting colleagues worldwide with hardware and software solutions through phone, email or onsite.
  
* Installing and reinstalling computers.
  
* Troubleshooting and resolving issues that are within your area of expertise (1st line support), and send more complex cases forward to 2nd line.
  
* Be a part of the on- and offboarding for employees and ensure that they're having right equipment.
  
* Administration within Active Directory.
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* We assume you have previous experience from IT-support.
  
* Excellent English communication skills – verbal and written.
  
* Knowledge of Office 365.
  
* A great interest and good knowledge in IT and computers.
   

 As a person, you are self-motivated with a strong ability to take initiative to solve issues. You are social and outgoing with the ability and interest to collaborate and create relations with team-members.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Work experience from retail stores.
  
* Knowledge of ITIL and ServiceNow (or other similar ticket management tool)
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Filippa Danell Karlberg or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106509

title: SoMe Intern
description:
**Company Description** 




 SLOWFASHION is a rapidly growing startup that launched in April 2024. We are an innovative app that enables users to buy and sell premium fashion items, including high-end clothes, shoes, bags, and jewelry. Our mission is to inspire a movement around circular fashion, encouraging sustainable practices in the fashion industry. By providing a seamless platform and multiple compensation opportunities, we aim to keep luxury fashion in circulation longer.
 



  





  





  





**Role Description** 




 We are looking for a dedicated and creative SoMe Intern to join our team. This is a hybrid internship role, primarily remote but requiring in-person collaboration once a week in Stockholm. The intern will work closely with our CMO and Copywriter to manage and enhance our social media presence, engage with our community, and support our marketing efforts through content creation and event participation.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





*Social Media Management:* 



* Post 3 reels or posts per week on Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Pinterest in collaboration with our Copywriter and CMO.
* Engage with our community by commenting on and liking photos from people and brands we follow to maintain an active presence.
* Answer direct messages and comments on Instagram and other social platforms.



   
 



*Influencer Collaboration:* 



* Support outreach efforts to influencers for potential collaborations.



   
 



*Event Support:* 



* Assist in organising and running monthly events, primarily pop-ups in Stockholm.



   
 



*Content Creation:* 



* Film and photograph content for social media, ensuring it aligns with current trends while maintaining our brand’s unique voice.



   
 



*Trend Analysis:* 



* Monitor social media trends and propose innovative ideas that balance trendiness with our brand ethos.



  





  





**Details** 



* Compensation:
 
**This is an unpaid internship** 

 , with the potential for a paid position for the right candidate after the internship period.
* Location: Must be based in Stockholm as we prioritise local candidates for in-person events and weekly meetings.
* Commitment: Full-time internship with an expected input of 30+ hours per week.
* Collaboration: You will work closely with the CMO and other team members, reporting directly to the CMO.
* Environment: We have a hybrid working model, combining remote work with in-person meetings in Stockholm once a week to maintain team spirit and collaboration.



  





  





**Skills Required** 



* Excellent Written Communication: Ability to write engaging content for social media.
* Community Engagement: Ability to actively engage with followers and the broader community.
* Content Creation: Proficiency in filming and photographing high-quality content.
* Trend Awareness: Ability to identify and leverage social media trends while staying true to our brand.
* Proactiveness and Adaptability: A self-starter who is eager to learn and adapt in a fast-paced startup environment.



  





 If you are passionate about sustainable fashion, have a knack for social media, and want to be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making the world a more beautiful place, we would love to hear from you!
 



  





  





**To Apply** 




 Please send your resume and a cover letter explaining why you are a perfect fit for SLOWFASHION to: ludvig@slowfashion.se. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: KKR Real Estate Equity Intern
description:
**Company Overview**
 KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKR’s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group.
   

  

 As a firm we manage investments across multiple asset classes and as individuals we are encouraged to think creatively to solve problems, explore opportunities, take on new responsibilities and challenges, put our clients first and contribute to our communities. We often measure success over years, not quarters. We value integrity in all that we do, whether it’s presenting numbers accurately or being open and honest with a portfolio company executive. People want to do business with those they like and trust. It’s a mantra instilled in all of us from the top down.
   

  

 At KKR, we believe that diverse teams increase performance and produce better results. Teams consisting of employees with varied backgrounds and perspectives will help strengthen our Firm and our investment decisions. Therefore, in an effort to enhance the diversity of our organization, we are particularly focused on recruiting talent that will bring different experiences, capabilities, skills and viewpoints to our organization.
   

  

**Overview:**
 Real Estate has been a part of the firm’s strategy since 1981 when we first began pursuing real estate opportunities through our private equity strategy. In 2011, we made a decision to form a dedicated real estate platform. As of June 30, 2024, our team consists of 165+ dedicated investment and asset management professionals across 11 countries, with +$70 billion of assets under management (including proprietary investments).
   

  

 KKR’s Stockholm office was opened in 2021 and currently has 10 employees. The Stockholm real estate private equity team currently consists of two executives covering the Nordics, with the intention to grow its presence in the region. The team sits under the EMEA Real Estate Private Equity group, headquartered in London.
   

  

**Role and Responsibilities:**
 KKR Real Estate is looking for a motivated Intern to join the investment team in Stockholm for six months (flexible). An Internship with KKR will provide an excellent real estate private equity experience with outstanding learning opportunities and where you will be highly engaged in all parts of the investment process. It will also provide great access to liaise with teams throughout KKR, senior management of companies and other external market participants (e.g. bankers, traders, advisers, private equity funds and other buyside investors). The team is lean and hence exposure to various investments will be unparalleled.
   

  

**Role Summary:**
 The role will be varied, challenging and highly rewarding. Typical day to day responsibilities will involve the following:
   

  

* Excel modelling
* Drafting of memoranda for internal and external use
* Market research
* Development of presentations
* Performing various analyses to assist in making investment decisions
* Real estate and public company valuation analysis
* Assisting with due diligence and execution of transactions
* Assisting in management of data, existing investments and fund models
* Involvement with management of external parties such as operating partners and external service providers
* Preparation of quarterly investment valuations and investor reporting


**Selection Criteria / Required Skills:**
* Excellent written and oral communication in English and a Nordic language is required (multiple Nordic languages a plus)
* Strong academic track record, either graduated or in the final stages of studies
* Interest in Real Estate
* Strong financial modelling skills
* Positive and eager attitude with a willingness and curiosity to learn
* Ability to learn quickly, take initiative and demonstrate proactivity in approach to work
* Strong interpersonal skills with capacity to interact with all stakeholders
* Dedicated team player with a strong sense of ownership
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, challenging work environment making time management and work prioritization essential skills


**Internship Start Date:** 
 January 2025 – (can be somewhat flexible)
   

  

**Internship Duration:** 
 6 months (flexible)
   

  

**Job Location:** 
 KKR, Birger Jarlsgatan 15, 111 45 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Hours:** 
 Monday to Friday 9.00-18.00, flexibility required
   

  

**Application Process:** 
 CV (one-page) and cover letter (one-page) are required. The CV should indicate your earliest possible start date. The cover letter should address your motivation for applying, reasons why you could be a good fit for the real estate team at KKR, and briefly elaborate on your interest in real estate.
   

  

**Deadline for Applications:** 
 6 September 2024 (early applications are encouraged as applications are reviewed on a rolling basis)
   

  

*KKR is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.*

title: Marketing Intern / LIA-praktik
description:
**About Improvin’**
 Do you want to make a significant contribution to the food industry’s sustainability and help reverse the climate crisis?
   

  

 Improvin’ exists to solve one of the world's largest problems: how to produce more food, more sustainably, at the same time. Our solution focuses on primary production, the source of >70% of the food industry’s emissions. We help food brands and processors measure, report and reduce the climate impact of their value chains.
   

  

 Our mission is vital and urgent; the change you’ll drive is demanded by consumers, the Paris Agreement, IPCC regulations, EU legislation (CSRD), and ambitious corporate goals set with the Science Based Targets Initiative and Greenhouse Gas Protocol.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Marketing Intern at Improvin’, you will work closely with our Marketing Lead and the wider Commercial team gaining hands-on experience in B2B marketing and sales enablement. As part of the Improvin’ team, you will have the opportunity to learn from professionals across various domains, including sustainability solutions, business development, data science, engineering and machine learning.
   

  

 How you can have an impact
   

  

**Content Production & Publishing.**
* Support the team in ideating, creating, and publishing content across various channels (blog posts, newsletters, LinkedIn posts, infographics).
* Develop and manage a process for collecting knowledge and information from the team.
* Create and maintain a library of reusable content.


**Actionable Insights.**
* Gather insights and share relevant news on agri-food sustainability from our competitors and the wider industry.
* Support in analyzing the performance of our marketing efforts and share insights with the team.


**Event Mapping.**
* Research and prioritize relevant industry events and keep our event database up-to-date.


 We believe you are
   

  

* Currently pursuing a degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Sustainability, or related field.
* Passionate about sustainability and interested in the agri-food industry.
* Eager to learn and apply academic knowledge to real-world challenges.
* Based in Stockholm and able to join the team at the office weekly.


 We believe you have
   

  

* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Strong interest in B2B marketing and some experience with it via e.g. school projects or previous internships.
* Good writing skills and the ability to capture your audience's attention across channels, both visually and through copy.
* Professional command of English and preferably another European language.
* Experience with design programs (such as Canva), web hosting tools (such as Squarespace), or CRM systems (such as HubSpot) is a plus.


 How we will support you
   

  

* We understand that an internship is a learning experience and are committed to supporting your professional growth.
* We will provide mentorship, feedback and opportunities to expand your skills.
* You will have access to a diverse team of professionals and gain a deep understanding of how technology can be leveraged to produce food more sustainably.


**About The Team.**
 We are an international team of nine nationalities using English as our working language. We foster an inclusive, encouraging and engaging culture, believing everyone has much to contribute. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued, respected and supported, regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, age or disability.
   

  

 Practicalities.
   

  

 The internship would start in September and run for a minimum of 4 months. As the internship should be incorporated into academic studies, it is unpaid. We are open to both full-time and part-time applicants.

title: SCRUM MASTER
description:
### **Arbetsuppgifter**


Vi söker en erfaren Scrum Master eller Agil Projektledare för ett uppdrag hos vår kund inom energisektorn. Uppdraget innebär att driva och strukturera arbetet både inom ett projekt som fokuserar på utvecklingen av en ny anläggningsstruktur och inom ett förvaltningsteam. Du kommer att vara en central figur i att säkerställa att arbetet går framåt genom att stötta teamen, som består av representanter från både IT och verksamheten.


Som Scrum Master/Agil Projektledare kommer du att:

* Sätta upp och anpassa strukturen i Azure DevOps, inklusive att skapa och hantera Kanbantavlan.
* Säkerställa att korrekta och tillräckligt detaljerade kort finns på Kanbantavlan för varje sprint.
* Leda dagliga stand-up möten och följa upp arbetet på Kanbantavlan.
* Planera och leda sprintar genom backlog refinement.
* Förbereda och genomföra demos samt leda retrospektiv tillsammans med projekt- och förvaltningsteamet.
* Facilitera och delta i andra möten efter behov.

### 
**Kvalifikationer**

* Du ska tala och skriva svenska och engelska obehindrat.


* Högskole-/universitetsexamen minst 120p/180 hp inom systemvetenskap eller motsvarande kompetens genom minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.


* Certifierad Scrum Master.


* Utbildning i och erfarenhet av Azure DevOps.


* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda, planera och följa upp projekt eller arbete inom IT-system eller digitala tjänster med agila metoder som Kanban, Scrum eller SAFe.


Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure DevOps.  

* 


**Meriterande erfarenheter**

* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från arbete med affärssystem/ERP/asset management, exempelvis IFS.
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet av arbete med anläggningsförvaltning, till exempel hos leverantör, entreprenör eller inom projektstöd.


### **Personliga egenskaper**


För att lyckas i rollen som Scrum Master/Agil Projektledare ser vi gärna att du:

* Har god samarbetsförmåga och tar initiativ för att driva arbetet framåt.
* Är flexibel och anpassningsbar efter arbetsbelastning.
* Är utåtriktad och tydlig i din kommunikation, med en ödmjuk attityd som gör att du lätt skapar förtroende.
* Arbetar självständigt och målinriktat, med en fallenhet för administrativa uppgifter.
* Har förmåga att arbeta effektivt både självständigt och i grupp.

### **Företagspresentation**


Vår kund är ett statligt affärsverk som förvaltar stamnätet för elkraften i Sverige. De bedriver även forskning- och utvecklingsprojekt på många områden för att främja ny teknik. Huvudkontoret finns i Stockholm och här behöver man som konsult säkerhetsprövas för de flesta uppdrag.### **Om oss**


JobBusters är ett auktoriserat personaluthyrnings- och rekryteringsföretag som är inriktade mot tjänstemän och har funnits sen 2011. Vi på JobBusters bryr oss om våra konsulter och vårt mål är alltid att bygga långsiktiga relationer med både konsult och kund. Vårt mål är alltid att matcha våra kunders drömkandidat med våra kandidaters drömjobb!

### **När du blir en av oss**


Som konsult hos JobBusters kan du känna dig trygg med ett kollektivavtal i ryggen, tillgängliga konsultchefer och engagerade rekryterare. Du som konsult får även tillgång till vårt nätverk av spännande företag och uppdragsgivare! För oss är det viktigt att du som konsult trivs, känner en trygghet och gemenskap till oss som arbetsgivare. Vi erbjuder tjänstepension, löneväxling och möjlighet till flexpension. Du får även tillgång till vår förmånsportal, där du utöver friskvårdsbidrag har tillgång till mängder av rabatter och erbjudanden inom hälsa, hem och fritid, transport, sjukvård och mycket mer! Ditt välmående är av högsta prioritet för oss och vi erbjuder därför dig som anställd Företagshälsovård för att hantera vardagens alla utmaningar, både på jobbet och i privatlivet.

### **Lön**


Enligt överenskommelse.

### **Tillträde och ansökan**


Heltid, kontorstider. Vår kund önskar start 2024-11-01 och uppdraget förväntas löpa t.o.m. 2025-10.30 med möjlighet till förlängning. Du kommer att vara anställd av JobBusters som konsult hos vår spännande kund. Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande och i konsultvärlden går processerna oftast snabbt. Rollen kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan (gärna i Word-format). Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-09-03.

title: Experienced Tech Lead for the Tracking Information Team
description:
*Are you a passionate developer who wants to make a difference in people's everyday lives?*  

*PostNord is now looking for a key player to one of our teams within Customer Solutions where we develop innovative consumer services for a smoother delivery experience. Our services are used by millions of customers daily via PostNord’s web and app.*


With us, you are met by an open and warm work environment, here we are constantly working to learn and improve. We work agile in a DevOps culture. The teams are the backbone of our organization and are self-governing, which means great opportunities to influence technology choices and working methods.

**We as a team**
----------------


We are a close-knit team that values collaboration and continuous learning. By using Kanban to manage our workflow, we prioritize transparency and communication. Daily stand-ups keep us aligned, while regular retrospectives ensure continuous improvement. We thrive on collective problem-solving through pair programming, weekly MOB sessions, and knowledge-sharing events. Our team-building activities, from digital coffee breaks to games, foster a strong bond among all team members.

* We are a distributed team with members in the Philippines and Sweden
* We use Confluence for documentation and Bitbucket for code management
* We work at least three days a week at the office in Solna

**Your Responsibilities**
-------------------------


We are looking for a seasoned developer with at least five years of experience, ideally in a Tech Lead role. If you have a strong interest in translating complex requirements into valuable solutions for our customers, excellent analytical abilities, and a coaching mindset, we’d love to meet you.


Experience with Java SE, AWS, Spring Boot, and backend systems is crucial, as is familiarity with microservices architecture and high-transaction systems.


If you’re proficient in both Swedish and English, and passionate about tech, we encourage you to apply - even if you don’t have experience with every single technology listed.

### **Technical Skills:**

* Java SE
* DevSecOps
* AWS
* Spring Boot
* Backend systems with microservices architecture
* High-transaction systems
* Relational databases and NoSQL (e.g., DynamoDB)
* Message queues and streaming
* REST APIs
* Proficiency in both Swedish and English, spoken and written


Please note that we do not use Azure.

**A cover letter is required.**

**We offer you**
----------------

* To work with our modern tech stack and you are given great opportunities to influence the choice of technology
* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office
* We encourage you to develop and learn. For example, we sponsor you for AWS certification.
* Good insurance and occupational pension conditions.
* Wellness allowance and access to office gym and swimming pool.
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord's own personnel foundation.
* Employment according to a collective agreement.

**About us**
------------


PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at group.postnord.com

**Apply**
---------


What are you waiting for? Welcome with your application! If you have any questions about the position, you are welcome to contact recruiting manager robert.svensson-eshraghi@postnord.com.
  

Note that we do not accept applications via email. We look forward to hearing from you!


For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

title: Car Event Technician
description:
This isn't a conventional car company. We're a new global brand that focuses on the need of the connected generation, sustainability, and a hassle-free customer experience.  

Car Event Technician
As a Car Event Technician in our Concept Workshop team, you will be part of our creative and global Uptime department. The Uptime department manages everything that a typical car manufacturer would classify as aftermarket services, focusing on proactive solutions to ensure car uptime. When downtime occurs, we create solutions to troubleshoot and get the car operational again as soon as possible. Your daily workspace will be our Uptime Concept Workshop, a dynamic environment combining both office and automotive workshop elements, where the entire Uptime team operates.
As a Car Event Technician, you will work alongside our experienced team of technicians, coordinators, and other skilled Uptime professionals to support both pre-production and serial produced vehicles. Your responsibilities will include maintaining vehicle health and appearance, and collaborating with various internal stakeholders, such as Marketing, Logistics, and the Vehicle Project team, to ensure seamless vehicle support.
This role is based at our Concept Workshop in Lindholmen, but you will also travel to events in different countries and visit other Lynk & Co locations. You will report directly to the Head of Concept Workshop.
**What you'll do**  


Monitor performance to ensure all pre-production and serial cars are fully functional, in excellent condition, and up to date
  

Support all Lynk & Co car-specific activities, whether in the Uptime Concept Workshop or at events, including fault tracing, coordinating and performing repairs, detailing, software updates, and High Voltage work
  

Perform Pre-Delivery Service (PDS) on new vehicles
  

Collaborate closely with Car Event Coordinators, including traveling for on-site vehicle support
  

Plan and manage car projects from a technical perspective, coordinating with other Lynk & Co departments, partners, and suppliers as needed to meet service deliverables
  

Work proactively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment, making swift decisions and seeking out necessary information
  

Actively contribute to optimizing processes, finding synergies, and implementing best practices with your team  


**What you should have**  

General mechanical skills, with technical certification or training in automotive mechanics, engineering, or a related field
Strong attention to detail, particularly in car detailing
Proven experience in fault tracing and diagnostics
Proficiency with diagnostic and other communication tools
Ability to read and follow operation instructions
High voltage training and experience with electrical systems
Skilled in tire replacement, wheel balancing and alignment
Valid driver's license is required; BE-license is a plus
Experience in creating new installations and repairing wiring harnesses is an advantage
Knowledge of AC and ventilation systems is a plus
Familiarity with Microsoft Office; DevOps experience is a bonus
**Working for Lynk & Co**  

Want to learn more about working for Lynk & Co and what we offer? Read more via this link:**Our recruitment process**
We work with a competence based framework. You apply by submitting your LinkedIn-profile or **CV written in English** and answering a few questions.
Our selection will primarily look at acquired competencies and skills.
To help us place the right people in the right role, we believe in science-based and fair assessment methods. Therefore, as part of our recruitment process, we use psychometric assessments from **Alva Labs** to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role.
We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, but latest 17th September 2024. We will do ongoing selection of candidates during the application period, so don't hesitate to submit your application if you're interested.
If you have any questions about the recruitment process, please reach out to bijal.bakhda@lynkco.com
To learn more about us, check out our **website** and follow us on **LinkedIn** and **Facebook**.

title: Junior teknisk testare/testautomatiserare – Stockholm heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryterings- och bemanningsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
För en kunds räkning söker vi nu en junior teknisk testare/testautomatiserare. Vår kund levererar lösningar som gör att deras kunder kan öka förändringstakt och kvalitet i sina digitala tjänster. Företagets kunder finns främst bland teleoperatörer, offentlig sektor, bank och försäkring i Sverige och Norge. Företaget har funnits sedan 1999 och består idag av ett 60-tal medarbetare.
  
Du kommer att jobba i trevliga lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.
  
Du kommer att arbeta i varierande projekt och stå inför intressanta utmaningar för att effektivisera företagets kunders tekniska vardag.
  
Du kommer att erbjudas en gedigen utvecklingsresa och dina kunskaper kommer omvandlas till nytta som gör skillnad. Du är alltid uppbackad av erfarna kollegor samt den gemensamma kunskapen som utgör kärnan i företagets framgångar.
  
  

**Du har några av dessa egenskaper/erfarenheter:**  

Utbildning på kandidatnivå
  
Upp till 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet
  
Teknisk testning
  
Testautomatiseringsverktyg (Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, Test Complete, UFT)
  
Agila arbetssätt
  
CI/CD-verktyg (Azure DevOps, Gitlab, Jenkins)
  
Programmering (JavaScript, Java)
  
Enhetstestramverk (JUnit, Cucumber)
  
Versionshantering (Git)
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Kunskap inom modern infrastruktur med containers/mikrotjänster (som Kubernetes plattformar)
  
Att ta fram teststrategier
  
Att coacha andra inom testautomation
  
Sätta upp ramverk
  
ISTQB-certifiering
  
  

**Du får:**  

Arbeta i utmanande projekt med teknik i framkant
  
Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling där certifieringar är en självklarhet
  
Vara en del av en stimulerande arbetsmiljö med högt i tak
  
Åka på spännande konferensresor med roliga aktiviteter
  
Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, pensionsersättning, ett ordentligt friskvårdsbidrag och andra generösa förmåner
  
Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund. Heltid. Provanställning som övergår i en tillsvidareanställning efter sex månader. Tillträde: omgående.
  
Ansök genom att skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Skriv ”Junior teknisk testare/testautomatiserare – Stockholm heltid” i ärenderaden.

title: Operativ Teamleader Mjukvara
description:
*Är du en kommunikativ och nyfiken person med tidigare erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling som vill vara med och leda ett av våra utvecklingsteam? Då kan det här vara rollen för dig!*


Din roll


Som teamleader hos oss kommer du att arbeta med utveckling, utbildning och support av våra testlösningar för underhåll av elektronik. Din roll kommer innebära säkerställande av att våra produkter möter de förväntningar som våra kunder och samarbetspartner ställer på våra produkters förmåga.

  

Huvudsakliga ansvarsuppgifter:

* Koordinera, planera och följa upp arbetet via agila arbetssätt
* Coacha, supporta och vara ett bollplank inom teamet
* Support mot interna och externa användare
* Att på sikt utbilda personal inom aktuella system
* Att i utvecklarrollen arbeta med kravspecifikation, dokumentation och kodning


I denna roll förekommer resor. Främst inom Sverige, men i viss mån även utomlands.


Din profil


Vi söker dig som har dokumenterad erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling och erfarenhet av ledarskap. Du har antingen en ingenjörsutbildning med mjukvaruinriktning, alternativt relevant arbetslivserfarenhet inom motsvarande område.


Som person är du driven, kommunikativ, nyfiken och prestigelös. Vi ser även att du är en teknikintresserad och social person med erfarenhet av ledarskap som gillar att lösa problem, samt arbeta i team med andra kollegor


För att lyckas i rollen krävs:

* Grundläggande förståelse för instrument och mätteknik
* Du har erfarenhet av programmering i C++ och C#
* Visual Studio, Team Foundation (Azure Devops)
* Windows och Linux


Meriterande om du även har erfarenhet av:

* Systems Engineering
* Mjukvaruarkitektur
* Agila arbetssätt (Scrum)
* Arbete från verksamhet där testinstrument, mätteknik och elektronik varit delar av arbetsuppgifterna.


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.


Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och att tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.


Vad du blir en del av


Här ingår du inte bara i en organisation där vi främjar samarbete, innovation och prestigelöshet, utan du får även möjligheten att vara med och påverka. Du kommer även att vara en viktig tillgång i vårat team genom att agera bollplank i tekniska frågor och vara kreativ genom att utforska möjligheter i nya arbetssätt och strukturer.


Affärsområdet Aeronautics är en innovativ leverantör av flygplanssystem i världsklass och har ett brett utbud av supportlösningar inom civil och militär luftfart. Inom affärsområdet bedrivs forskning, utveckling och produktion av militära flygplanssystem. Vi säkrar framtiden inom flygindustrin genom forskning och studier av innovativa flygsystem och vidareutveckling av våra produkter. Läs mer om oss här


Som medarbetare på Aeronautics blir du en del av en organisation som präglas av mångfald, samarbete och inkluderande medarbetarskap, och där ständigt lärande och balans i livet värderas högt. Du får arbeta i en innovativ och kreativ arbetsmiljö där du har möjlighet att bygga en långsiktig och givande karriär. Om du är intresserad av vilka förmåner som du kan ta del av som anställd på Saab i Sverige, kan du läsa om dem här

*Saab är ett företag där människan står i centrum. Vi har en god arbetsmiljö där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra att göra vårt bästa. Kontinuerligt lärande, välmående, karriär- och talangutveckling är exempel på områden där vi alltid arbetar hårt för att säkerställa att du som medarbetare får de möjligheter som du behöver.*
company_description: Saab serves the global market with world-leading products, services and solutions from military defense to civil security.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Sweden Digital & IT Gothenburg Hybrid
Vårt kontor i Göteborg befinner sig i en spännande tillväxtfas, och vi söker nu fler talanger till vårt team inom Digitalization och Infotech!

  


About The Member Company
We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:


* Technology & Engineering
* Energy & Renewables
* Life sciences & Pharma
* Digital & IT
**About this vacancy**
----------------------


Är du en erfaren DevOps Engineer med minst 5 års erfarenhet och söker en ny utmaning? På TMC söker vi passionerade och engagerade ingenjörer med stark entusiasm för att optimera och automatisera system.


I denna roll får du en central position i att utveckla och implementera lösningar för kontinuerlig integration och leverans. Du kommer att arbeta med att optimera deployment-pipelines, säkerställa hög tillgänglighet och prestanda för våra kunders system. Ditt ansvar inkluderar även att stödja utvecklingsteam med verktyg och processer som förbättrar effektiviteten och kvaliteten i kundens Mjukvaruleverans.


Du kommer att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med nära samarbete mellan olika team, vilket ger dig möjlighet att utveckla både tekniska och kommunikativa färdigheter.


**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


Vi söker dig som är utbildad högskole- eller civilingenjör med minst 5 års erfarenhet i roller som DevOps Engineer, Release Manager, Cloud Engineer eller liknande. Du drivs av att förbättra och effektivisera system och processer och har ett stort intresse för automatisering och skalbarhet. Vi förutsätter att du behärskar både engelska och svenska flytande.


﻿


Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av:

* Verktyg och ramverk: Jenkins, Travis CI, Docker, Kubernetes
* Programmeringsspråk och skriptspråk: Python, Bash, Ruby
* Molnplattformar: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud
* Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Ansible


**What you can expect from us**
-------------------------------


I rollen som Employeneur får du både utveckla dina tekniska kunskaper och driva din egen utveckling och affär. Du blir del av en innovativ och entreprenöriell organisation där fokuset ligger på ständig utveckling och möjligheten att vara fullt ansvarig för att styra din egen karriär.

  

Vi lägger stor vikt vid ditt personliga engagemang och din vilja att driva din utveckling framåt. För att lyckas med det ges du chansen att själv påverka vilken typ av projekt du tar dig an samt vilken kompetensutveckling du vill investera i. Du styr din karriär helt enkelt.

  

Eftersom TMC är ett internationellt företag kan vi erbjuda projekt på olika platser i olika länder där vi och våra kunder finns. För närvarande finns vi representerade i Sverige, Nederländerna, Belgien, Frankrike, Luxemburg, Spanien, Portugal, Italien, Ungern, U.A.E., USA och Kanada. Du får världen som arbetsplats!


The 5 basic principles of **employeneurship**
A long-term working relationship
Enjoy the security of a long-term contract and a stable source of income while getting the opportunity to work at diverse projects.


Individual profit sharing
Full transparency. That’s it. For each of your projects, you know your hourly rate, your costs, and your individual performance-based profit sharing, all in order to stimulate your inner entrepreneur.


Business cells
Our employeneurs are grouped in business cells based on their technical expertise. They are small, focused and function as high-grade knowledge networks. And as buzzing communities of close colleagues.


YOUniversity
Every employeneur drives their own career. Together, we make a plan for personal and professional growth. Receive personal coaching and an extensive training budget to keep developing yourself and deliver outperformance at our clients.

  

The Entrepreneurial Lab
Work on your technical dreams in our lab. Collaborate with others in multidisciplinary teams to unlock out-of-the-box thinking and innovative ideas as well as entrepreneurial skills.
company_description: At TMC we believe it's people who drive technology. Our Employeneurship model creates the best conditions for technical talents to do so.

title: Engineering Manager DevOps
description:
**Software development that makes a difference**  

At Volvo Cars, we are making bold digital visions come true. We aim to lead in the automotive world by creating a digital ecosystem built around making our customers' lives less complicated. Now we are looking for curious, creative people who want to change the world through innovative thinking.

  


**About us**  

Volvo Cars is leading the transformation towards a sustainable future with a series of new, electrified vehicles across a range of platforms. By 2025, we aim to be leading in electrification and sustainability; with a goal of half of all Volvo cars sold being fully electric. To deliver upon this vision, we need to be able to integrate and deliver code fast, continuously and with high quality. You will lead a team that is responsible for deciding the future of our Software production flows with its CI/CD system to support hundreds of developers within Propulsion and Energy. This automated process will handle all the required steps for creating and delivering a binary file ready to be downloaded to our cars. Through cross-functional collaboration, we're pushing the boundaries of engineering development.

  


**You And Your Skills**  

We are looking for an experienced software engineering manager, who has previous experience from building and leading software engineering teams that deliver high quality CI/CD flows. In addition, experience or understanding of model-based design and C/C++ would be appreciated. To be successful in the role you have a university degree in Engineering Management or similar and relevant experience.


The majority of your time will be spent on managing a development team, hiring, compensation, and employee career development. In addition, you will be leading strategically necessary cross-functional work, align goals and objectives of your team across the organization and focus on delivering the outcomes.  

You have a passion for transforming and developing continuous flows, architecture, and best practices. It’s important that you love to interact with development teams to understand their needs and product missions, and with servant leadership and a strong technical foundation you strive to create a fast and fun developer experience.

  


**What you will do**  

* Grow and reshape teams with highly talented engineers.
* Mentor and coach individual engineers and teams as well as removing obstacles in their way to deliver software at scale and speed.
* Lead and develop technology strategy in your domain together with your stakeholders and partners to make sure the architecture and strategy enable the product vision.
* Drive and nurture collaboration, diversity, and engagement.
* Advocate and advance a modern software development, operation, and engineering practices.
* Always find ways to learn and continuously improve our products and practices.

Finally, you share our values and can see everyone's potential. Your personality and eagerness to collaborate will be welcomed by all of us!

  


**Location**


We operate from Volvo Cars headquarter in Gothenburg, Sweden. It is therefore the preferred location for the ideal candidate.

  


**Want to know more? We hope so**  

We’d like to receive and review your application consisting of CV and cover letter by latest September 10th.  

Please apply through the provided link. Applications submitted via email will not be retained or taken into consideration. Once you receive a confirmation email from the system, your application will be acknowledged.We are meeting people on a continuous basis so we urge you to send your application as soon as possible,as position can be filled before the deadline.  

If you want more information about the role and its responsibilities or to simply to learn a bit more about the team, please reach out to the hiring manager at STEFAN.L.NILSSON@VOLVOCARS.COM or the recruiter at simona.popencu@volvocars.com.

  


**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**  

Volvo Cars’ continued success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with over 40,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your talents and aspirations so you can reach your full potential.  

For the right person, an inspiring and creative workplace awaits. Did you know that every Volvo Cars employee worldwide has the right to our Family Bond, our new all-gender, paid parental leave policy? You’ll also enjoy a culture and benefits package that’s made us one of the world’s most awarded and progressive employers.  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, 50% of which will be electric vehicles and sold directly to customers through digital channels. Join us on the journey of a lifetime as we create the driving and electrification technologies of tomorrow.

  

  

Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more


Curious about our story? Read more

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
About Kindred
  
Kindred Group is a digital entertainment pioneer bringing together nine successful online gambling brands, forming one of the largest online gambling groups in the world. Our purpose is to transform gambling by being a trusted source of entertainment that contributes positively to society. Our goal is that 0% revenue is derived from harmful gambling.
  
Our global team of more than 2000 people represents 70+ nationalities. When you join Kindred, you'll be part of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive team that has your best interest at heart. We are a trusting company that knows the value of a healthy work-life balance. We offer a wide range of benefits, along with annual bonus, which is tied to both company and your individual performance.
  
  

The Role
  
Are you passionate about cloud technology? Do you thrive in a fast-paced and technically challenging environment? If so, here is your chance. We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team.
  
The open position is within the Platform and Application Engineering Services team, which is a vital part of the Application Managements and Operations (AMO) department. The Platform and Application Engineering Services team is responsible for overseeing the group's Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery tools, along with related automation, as part of developing our Platform as a Service (PaaS) offering for both on-premises and cloud environments.
  
The deliverables generally focus on automating DevOps processes to streamline product development and reduce time to market for our customer services. You will be joining a team that values strong working relationships, prioritizes high quality and availability, and adopts a zero-downtime approach.
  
In this role you will work with other DevOps Engineers to build and maintain the infrastructure that is critical to running Kindreds Core Data Platform, Data Analytics, and Machine Learning Platforms, as well as your own personal growth. You should be open to learning new technologies and be enthusiastic about sharing your knowledge.
  
  

**What you will do:**  

Maintain Kindred Cloud platform and driving all changes through automation.
  
Support, develop, and deliver Cloud Services to the organization.
  
Provide support to engineering teams.
  
Set up tools and required Cloud infrastructure.
  
Define and set development, test, release, update, and support processes for Cloud operation.
  
Incident management and root cause analysis.
  
Implement controls and operational best practice for cloud usage.
  
  

**Your experience:**  

Knowledge of a Programming Language, for example Python.
  
Good understanding of Cloud Infrastructure, for example EKS, EC2, EBS, Lambda, S3, MSK, and CloudWatch.
  
Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code such as Terraform.
  
Good understanding of CI/CD tools such as Jenkins or cloud-native solutions.
  
Knowledge of Kubernetes, Containers, and Helm deployment.
  
Ability to drive new technical projects & solutions with strong autonomy.
  
Experience within open source and appliance products.
  
Software developer mindset, troubleshooting techniques, and solving problems through repeatable and testable automation.
  
Verbal and written communication skills.
  
  

Our Way Of Working
  
Our world is hybrid.
  
A career is not a sprint. It's a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.
  
Application Process
  
Click on the "Apply Now" button and complete the short web form. Please add your CV and covering letter in English to let us know your motivation for applying and your salary expectation. Our Talent Acquisition team will be in touch soon. Kindred is an equal opportunities employer committed to employing a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. As such, we oppose all forms of discrimination in the workplace. We create equal opportunities for all our applicants and will treat people equally regardless of and not limited to, gender, ages, disability, race, sexual orientation. We are committed not only to our legal obligations but also to the positive promotion that equal opportunities bring to our operations as set out in our sustainability framework. Kindred has an ESG rating of AAA by MCSI.

title: DevOps Ingenjör
description:
Devops-ingenjör sökes till teknikbolag!
  
Är du redo att kliva in i en dynamisk värld av banbrytande teknologi och innovation? Vår kund söker nu erfarna Devops-ingenjörer som är redo att bidra till spännande projekt inom fordons-, telekom- och försvarsindustrin.
  
Kund är ett teknikkonsultbolag vars uppdrag spänner över hela utvecklingscykeln från systemering, arkitektur och design till implementation och verifiering. Som konsult hos kund kommer du verka inom industri, försvarsindustri, medtech, fordon samt telekom och vara en del i ett team som gillar mixen av häftig teknik och att ha kul på jobbet.
  
Tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Futuria People men du kommer anställas direkt hos kund.
  
  

Varför ansluta dig?
  
**Mångsidiga Projekt:** En attraktiv kombination av bransch- och teknikbredd, där uppdragen varierar och i projekt som sträcker sig över hela utvecklingscykeln med fokus på hållbara och säkra lösningar för det framtida samhället.
  
**Valmöjligheter:** I och med sin stora kundbas kan företaget skräddarsy rollen efter dina förutsättningar, önskemål och intressen.
  
**Karriärmöjligheter:** Känner du dig redo för nästa kliv som t.ex. Teamledare finns det stora möjligheter till det.
  
**Work-life balance:** En arbetsmiljö som jobbar för att skapa de bästa förutsättningarna för långsiktig balans samt en hållbar utveckling och karriär.
  
  

**Din Roll som Devops-ingenjör:**  

Samarbeta med ett dynamiskt team, antingen på kontoret i Göteborg eller på plats hos kunder runt regionen, med viss flexibilitet för distansarbete.
  
Du kommer att arbeta med att strategiskt införa containers i utvecklingsmiljö.
  
Arbeta med applikationsmigrering från enskilda VMs via GitOps flöden till kubernetes.
  
Arbeta med fokus på blueprint-tänk, där ni samarbetar med flera datacenter, siter, länder för att skapa effektiva och stabila plattformar för utvecklingsteam.
  
  

Vem är du?
  
Vi söker dig som är civil- eller högskoleingenjör och som har erfarenhet av ovanstående område, som containers i utvecklingsmiljö och applikationsmigrering. Exempelvis har du erfarenhet av GitOps, Kubernetes, GitLab, Flux, Helm med mera.
  
I denna tjänst krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
  
  

Övrig information
  
**Start:** Enligt överenskommelse
  
**Omfattning:** Heltid
  
**Placering:** Göteborg
  
**Eventuella frågor besvaras av rekryterare Ebba Strömberg:** 076-883 80 05 / ebba.stromberg@futuriapeople.se
  
  

Passar det här in på dig eller känner du någon som skulle passa bättre för jobbet? - Tipsa gärna!
  
Intervjuer sker löpande, välkommen med din ansökan idag!
  
  

Futuria Peopleär rekryteringsföretaget som hjälper individer att ta nästa steg i sin karriär och företag att attrahera nya medarbetare. Genom uppsökande rekrytering och kvalitativ annonsering har vi hjälpt hundratals kandidater till ett nytt jobb och en mer stimulerande vardag.

title: Scrummaster/Projektledare
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
Bakgrund
  
  

Vår kund står inför en ökad digitalisering. Ett fokusområde är hur information om våra fysiska anläggningar hålls digitalt. Inom anläggnings- och affärssystemet IFS kommer en förflyttning ske och vi har behov av att stärka upp teamet med en praktisk, kommunikativ och driven Scrum master eller motsvarande.
  
  

Uppdragsbeskrivning
  
  

Uppdraget innebär att som Scrum master/agil projektledare driva och strukturera arbetet som dels sker inom ramarna för ett projekt kopplat till framtagande av en ny anläggningsstruktur samt dels inom förvaltningsteamet mellan vilka ett nära samarbete finns.
  
  

Konsulten kommer att vara drivande och stötta teamet som jobbar iterativt och består av både representanter från verksamheten på IT. Konsulten är en del av ett team där behovsinsamling, strukturering av information, genomgång av arbetsflöden och utbildning ingår. Vår kund genomför en förändringsresa inom digitalisering, där alla i sina respektive roller bidrar för att göra den upplevelsen så bra som möjligt för slutanvändarna.
  
  

Konsulten anpassar sitt arbetssätt och ambitionsnivå utifrån uppdragets specifika förutsättningar och jobbar i nära samarbete med andra roller i IT-förvaltningen samt i linjeorganisationen.
  
Arbetsuppgifter
  
  

Vi söker en Scrum master eller motsvarande som ska vara bryggan mellan två olika team, ett projektteam och ett förvaltningsteam
  
  

Vår kund arbetar i verktyget DevOps så kunskap om det verktyget är en förutsättning.
  
  

Arbetsbeskrivning rollen som Scrum master/Agil projektledare
  
  

Sätta upp en struktur för hur man jobbar i Azure DevOps, anpassa Kanbantavlan så att det avspeglar hur vi arbetar
  
  

Säkra att korrekta kort finns på Kanbantavlan för respektive sprint nedbrutna på lagom nivå (Definition of Done, hur man ska testa funktioner/resultat, etc.), och med hjälp av teamen bryta ned så att det går att utföra på 3 veckor
  
  

Följa upp och vid behov stötta i användandet av Azure DevOps
  
  

Hålla i Stand-up och följa upp alla kort på Kanbantavlan
  
  

Planera och leda kommande sprintar genom backlog refinenment
  
  

Förbereda, genomföra demo/ säkerställa att ansvariga finns för de funktioner som ska visas
  
  

Leda demo och tillsammans med PL/förvaltningsteamet genomföra retrospecitive
  
  

Facilitera och delta i andra möten efter behov
  
  

Placering
  
  

Stockholm.
  
  

Obligatoriska krav
  
  

**Utbildning :**  

Högskole-/universitetsexamen minst 120p/180 hp inom systemvetenskap, alternativt motsvarande kompetens (med motsvarande kompetens menas erfarenhet av arbetsuppgifter enligt uppdragsbeskrivningen) förvärvad genom minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet
  
  

Certifierad som Scrum Master
  
  

Utbildning Azure DevOps
  
  

**Kompetens och Erfarenhet:**  

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet att leda, planera och följa upp projekt/arbete inom IT-system eller digitala tjänster med hjälp av agila arbetssätt och metoder som Kanban, Scrum eller SAFe
  
  

Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från Azure DevOps
  
  

Mervärdeskrav
  
  

Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från arbete kopplat till affärssystem/ERP/asset management motsvarande IFS
  
  

Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet arbete med anläggningsförvaltning, till exempel hos leverantör, entreprenör eller projektstöd
  
  

Annat
  
  

Nedanstående personliga egenskaper säkerställs via referenser och vid eventuell intervju.
  
  

God samarbetsförmåga och initiativförmåga
  
  

Flexibel och anpassningsbar efter arbetsbelastning
  
  

Utåtriktad och tydlig i sin kommunikation
  
  

Ödmjuk och ha lätt för att skapa förtroende
  
  

Arbetar självständigt och målinriktat
  
  

Fallenhet för administrativa arbetsuppgifter
  
  

Förmåga att arbeta i grupp
  
  

Konsulten ska tala och skriva svenska och engelska obehindrat

title: Agil projektledare/Scrum Master
description:
**Vi söker en Agil projektledare/Scrum Master**
-----------------------------------------------


Vi söker nya kollegor som skall agera senior konsult hos vår kund som Agil-projektledare/Scrum Master. Uppdraget hos kund förväntas pågå mellan 1-2 år förhoppningsvis med start i november. Efter uppdraget ser vi gärna att man fortsätter hos ten10 och våra andra kunder. Det kommer även finnas möjlighet att på sikt arbeta parallellt med andra spännande projekt.

**Beskrivning**


Uppdraget innebär att som Scrum master/agil projektledare driva och strukturera arbetet som dels sker inom ramarna för ett projekt kopplat till framtagande av en ny anläggningsstruktur samt dels inom förvaltningsteamet mellan vilka ett nära samarbete finns.


Du kommer att vara drivande och stötta teamet som jobbar iterativt och består av både representanter från verksamheten och IT. Du är en del av ett team där behovsinsamling, strukturering av information, genomgång av arbetsflöden och utbildning ingår. Kunden genomför en förändringsresa inom digitalisering, där alla i sina respektive roller bidrar för att göra den upplevelsen så bra som möjligt för slutanvändarna.


Du anpassar sitt arbetssätt och ambitionsnivå utifrån uppdragets specifika förutsättningar och jobbar i nära samarbete med andra roller i IT-förvaltningen samt i linjeorganisationen.  

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**

  

Kunden söker en Scrum master eller motsvarande som ska vara bryggan mellan två olika team, ett projektteam och ett förvaltningsteam


Kunden arbetar i verktyget DevOps så kunskap om det verktyget är en förutsättning.


Några saker du kommer göra:

* Sätta upp en struktur för hur man jobbar i Azure DevOps, anpassa Kanbantavlan så att det avspeglar hur vi arbetar
* Säkra att korrekta kort finns på Kanbantavlan för respektive sprint nedbrutna på lagom nivå (Definition of Done, hur man ska testa funktioner/resultat, etc.), och med hjälp av teamen bryta ned så att det går att utföra på 3 veckor
* Följa upp och vid behov stötta i användandet av Azure DevOps
* Hålla i Stand-up och följa upp alla kort på Kanbantavlan
* Planera och leda kommande sprintar genom backlog refinenment
* Förbereda, genomföra demo/ säkerställa att ansvariga finns för de funktioner som ska visas
* Leda demo och tillsammans med PL/förvaltningsteamet genomföra retrospecitive
* Facilitera och delta i andra möten efter behov

**Placering**


Hybrid ute hos kund, hemma samt i våra lokaler.

**För att lyckas i rollen som** **teamlead** **måste du ha:**

* Högskole-/universitetsexamen minst 120p/180 hp inom systemvetenskap, alternativt motsvarande kompetens (med motsvarande kompetens menas erfarenhet av arbetsuppgifter enligt uppdragsbeskrivningen) förvärvad genom minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet
* Certifierad som Scrum Master
* Utbildning Azure DevOps
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet att leda, planera och följa upp projekt/arbete inom IT-system eller digitala tjänster med hjälp av agila arbetssätt och metoder som Kanban, Scrum eller SAFe
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet från Azure DevOps

**Det är extra meriterande om du har:**

* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet från arbete kopplat till affärssystem/ERP/asset management motsvarande IFS
* Minst 2 års arbetslivserfarenhet arbete med anläggningsförvaltning, till exempel hos leverantör, entreprenör eller projektstöd

**Vad får man ut av att vara en ten10are**

  

Hos ten10 är det viktigt att finna en sund balans mellan privat- och arbetsliv. Vi arbetar därför alltid tillsammans för att finna vad som kan kan vara bra för din vardag. Vi erbjuder inte bara valmöjligheter hur du vill påverka din arbetsdag utan även i ersättningsmodeller. Vi erbjuder en av marknadens mest attraktiva lönemodeller och där du får kompensation för det värde du skapar.


När du är en del av ten10 är det viktigt att du även känner det och kan dela med dig av dina erfarenheter, tankar och ideér. Detta kan du göra när vi alla ses gemensamt och umgås på AWs, utlandsresor, julbord eller när vi gör något annat kul ihop.


Vi pratar inte bara om att vi faktiskt bryr oss om våra medarbetare utan hela vår verksamhet utgörs av våra medarbetare. Vår ambition är att skapa dem rätta förutsättningarna för just dig!

title: Embedded Engineer
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



We are looking for talented **Senior** **Embedded Engineers** to join our company. **Sigma Industry Evolution**is expanding rapidly and we welcome you to join our amazing team! The position is located in **Copenhagen!**



**The swedish citizenship or permanent residence permit is required!**



Our customer provides hospital efficiency solutions to optimize workflows in healthcare. Your role as an Embedded Software Developer will make you an integral part of our fast-growing organization. You'll have a significant impact from specification to implementation and maintenance, contributing to the success of our market-leading solutions. Our team is responsible for integrating devices into our IoT platform, based on PTC's ThingWorx solution.



**Your Responsibilities**



Developing embedded software solutions, including:


* Design and development of new features
* Maintenance and enhancement of current solutions
* Cooperation and orchestration across different teams/expertise areas
* Last-line support of solutions
* Tools used include Git, Buildroot, CMake, and Azure DevOps
### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



**Who You Are:**



We seek individuals who are sincere, agile, and accountable, always prioritizing quality and customer satisfaction. Your qualifications include:



* Minimum bachelor's degree in Computer Science
* Good knowledge of Linux operating systems and software
* Good knowledge of embedded programming in C/C++ and the complete development process. (+3 years)
* Knowledge of web applications and protocols is an advantage
* Knowledge of OPC UA is an advantage
* Fluent in both written and spoken English is a requirement


You have a structured and analytical approach, work well independently, and collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders. This position offers personal responsibility, freedom, and ample growth opportunities within a global organization with efficient decision-making processes.


### **MORE INFORMATION**



For more information please contact



Ivan Kertan,  

+46 761287807  

Ivan.Kertan@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Embedded Engineer
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Evolution
* #### **LOCATION**


Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Software development embedded systems
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2024-08-20
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2024-09-08
* #### **CONTACT**


Ivan Kertan, Ivan.Kertan@sigma.se, +46761287807
