title: AWS Developer
description:
**Job Title:** 
 AWS Developer
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



**On-site** 
 : 2-3 days on-site preferably
 



**Employment type:** 
 Freelance/Contract
 



**Start date:** 
 ASAP
 



**Duration:** 
 6-18 months
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 We are seeking an AWS Developer who will work closely with our team to ensure the successful execution of our roadmap milestones and contribute to our Cloud strategy. This role involves serving as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on Amazon Web Services (AWS), staying current with the latest AWS cloud services, features, and capabilities, and evaluating their relevance to our business needs. Daily responsibilities include automating processes related to cloud operations, security configurations, account management, and cost optimization. The AWS Developer will also promote our Public Cloud offerings to internal stakeholders and collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand requirements, prioritize projects, and align cloud strategies with business goals. Additionally, this role includes providing technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior team members, fostering a culture of innovation, continuous learning, and improvement.
 



  





**Core Competency:** 



* Digital expertise in Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud Computing



  





**Key Skills:** 



* In-depth knowledge of AWS, including a strong understanding of its platform services, features, and best practices.
* Ability to design scalable, resilient, and cost-effective cloud solutions that meet business requirements while ensuring security and compliance.
* Experience with enterprise-level Cloud Foundation constructs such as AWS Control Tower and Cloud Adoption Framework.
* Proficiency in containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes.
* Expertise in using infrastructure automation tools like Terraform and AWS CloudFormation for programmatically managing cloud resources.
* Familiarity with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) practices, with a focus on implementing scalable and efficient pipelines.
* Strong coding skills in Go and Python, as these languages are widely used within our team for building serverless integrations and APIs.
* Passion for software development best practices, with a strong emphasis on automation.



  





 If this role matches your expectation and interest, please share your tailored CV in this job advertisement. Feel free to also reach out to me directly on Tomasz@gazellegc.com

title: AWS Developer
description:
**About the Company:** 




 We are looking for the person that, together with the team, will secure execution towards roadmap milestones and our Cloud strategy, daily this might include, Serve as a subject matter expert (SME) on Amazon Web Services(AWS) cloud platform, Stay updated with the latest cloud services, features, and capabilities offered by AWS and evaluate their applicability to business needs. Help the team automate processes related, but not limited to cloud operations, security configuration, account management and cost optimization. Promote the Public Cloud offering internally to our stakeholders. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and business units to understand requirements, prioritize initiatives, and align cloud strategies with business objectives. Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior architects, engineers, and developers to foster a culture of innovation, learning, and continuous improvement.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 Competencies: Digital : Amazon Web Service(AWS) Cloud Computing
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Deep knowledge of AWS. This includes a deep understanding of platform services, features, and best practices.
* Ability to build scalable, resilient, and cost-effective cloud platform solutions based on business requirements and industry best practices. This involves adhering to security and compliance standards.
* Experience with Cloud Foundations constructs for Enterprises, such as AWS control Tower, Cloud Adoption Framework etc
* Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and container orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes.
* Experience with infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform, AWS CloudFormation templates to provision and manage cloud resources programmatically.
* Use of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery. The tool is less important - experiences and a mindset to try/execute CI/CD pipelines at scale is key.
* Comfortable with Go (and Python) since we use these languages extensively on our team to build serverless integrations and API's.
* Fluent with best practices for software development with a passion for automation



  





***Please Note: Looking for only EU and NATO citizens***

title: Senior AWS Cloud Architect
description:
**Job Description:** 




**Role:** 
 Senior AWS Cloud Architect
 



**Experience:** 
 8-10 years
 



**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





**Role Description:** 




 We are seeking an AWS Cloud Architect who will play a crucial role in executing our Cloud strategy and achieving roadmap milestones in collaboration with our team. As an AWS Cloud expert, you will provide technical leadership, support cross-functional initiatives, and drive automation in cloud operations.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the AWS cloud platform, providing guidance on best practices, security, and compliance standards.
* Stay updated with the latest AWS cloud services, features, and capabilities; evaluate their applicability to meet evolving business needs.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and business units to gather requirements, prioritize initiatives, and align cloud strategies with business objectives.
* Lead efforts to automate processes related to cloud operations, security configurations, account management, and cost optimization.
* Promote the Public Cloud offering internally, acting as an ambassador and point of contact for AWS cloud solutions.
* Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior architects, engineers, and developers, fostering a culture of innovation, learning, and continuous improvement.



  





**Competencies Required:** 



* **Digital Expertise:** 
 Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud Computing



  





**Experience:** 



* 8-10 years of experience in AWS Cloud Computing, with deep knowledge of platform services, features, and best practices.



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Proven ability to build scalable, resilient, and cost-effective cloud platform solutions based on business requirements and industry standards.
* Experience with AWS Cloud Foundations constructs for Enterprises, such as AWS Control Tower and the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
* Expertise in infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform and AWS CloudFormation for provisioning and managing cloud resources programmatically.
* Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipelines at scale, with a passion for automation.
* Proficient in programming languages, particularly Go and Python, used extensively for serverless integrations and APIs.
* Strong understanding of practical security, networking, and cloud economics, including cost optimization and visualization (FinOps).
* Other cloud knowledge (e.g., GCP/Azure) is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to articulate complex cloud strategies to stakeholders.
* Ability to translate strategic plans into technical deliverables, ensuring operational readiness and stability.



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation and continuous learning. If you are passionate about leveraging AWS to drive business outcomes and thrive in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply!.



**We would love to hear from you if you are interested in joining our team and contributing to our mission of innovation and excellence. Please send your resume and cover letter for consideration to anu@beyondtech.se.**

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**About Froda** 




 Froda was founded in 2015 with a clear vision – to revolutionize the banking experience for entrepreneurs by making it easy and affordable to invest in their ideas. Today, we are one of Sweden's fastest-growing fintech companies with large international growth plans. We are a creative tech company with the ambition to turn a historically expensive and unfair industry into something ethical and sustainable by promoting entrepreneurship.
 



  





 Our mission to revolutionize the banking experience for entrepreneurs is not only reflected in our products but also in our workplace. By fostering a culture of respect, collaboration, and continuous learning, we provide opportunities for personal growth and professional development. Join us in transforming the banking industry and be a part of our journey to empower entrepreneurs.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As we continue our growth journey and strive to elevate our tech platform, we’re looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer to join our Platform team. This team is at the heart of Froda’s technology, responsible for creating and managing the infrastructure that supports our cutting-edge fintech solutions. In this role, you will focus on automating infrastructure and cloud setups, optimizing performance, and ensuring the stability and security of our platform.
 



  





 Your role will be important for establishing and managing our CI/CD pipelines, automating routine operations, and driving efficiency in the development process. You will collaborate closely with other development teams to support broader architectural decisions and contribute to the overall strategy of our tech platform.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 We’re looking for someone who is technically skilled, proactive, and communicative. You should be a team player who enjoys taking initiative and ownership of tasks, and you should be comfortable working independently in a fast-paced environment. While we don’t require you to be a senior DevOps expert, you should have enough experience to drive initiatives independently and contribute effectively to our team.
 



  





**Key Qualifications:** 



* **Experience:** 
 2-5 years in a DevOps or similar role, with hands-on experience in cloud infrastructure and automation.
* **Background:** 
 Preferably from an Operations background with some development experience. Understanding the development process is important, even though your primary focus will be on operations.
* **Mindset:** 
 Eager to learn, grow, and contribute to a collaborative team. Strong problem-solving skills and a “get-stuff-done” attitude are essential.



  





**Skills:** 




  




* **Infrastructure as Code:** 
 Proficiency in Terraform and other IaC tools.
* **CI/CD Pipelines:** 
 Experience in setting up and optimizing continuous integration and deployment pipelines.
* **Cloud Infrastructure:** 
 Experience with Azure or AWS.
* **Containerization:** 
 Hands-on experience with Docker and Kubernetes in production environments.
* **Security:** 
 Solid understanding of cloud security best practices.



  





**What’s in it for you?** 




 At Froda, you will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where your work truly makes a difference. We offer a collaborative atmosphere with ambitious co-workers who value work-life balance.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 



* A developing & exciting work environment in a fast-growing and profitable scale-up.
* Insurance and pension plan.
* We value in-person collaboration and the dynamic energy it brings to our team, while also honoring the need for personal flexibility and work-life balance.
* A centrally located office at Slussen (Katarinahuset) with a fabulous view of Gamla stan and Skeppsholmen.
* Friendly culture that values work/life balance.
* Enjoyable team events and gatherings.



  





 If you’re excited about the opportunity to lead and innovate within a dynamic team, we would love to hear from you. Should you have any questions about the role or the application process, please don't hesitate to get in touch. We look forward to receiving your application and exploring the possibilities together.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 Are you ready to elevate your career and become a part of a team that is transforming the way TRATON delivers exceptional software solutions to our customers? We are on the lookout for a Senior DevOps Engineer who is expert in automating infrastructure and enhancing software release strategies to join our dynamic team. You will be working in a hybrid work-setting with exciting and complex software development!
   

  

 Who We Are
   

  

 We are dedicated to an inclusive and diverse workplace. You will join a diverse and competent team with a friendly, helpful and inclusive atmosphere. The team has a common vision of the goals and values, allowing us to take our jobs seriously while having fun at the same time. We care for each other’s personal development to learn, grow and evolve, in order to make our deliveries the best we can produce. Be yourself and reveal your talents!
   

  

 Your Role
   

  

 In your role as a Senior DevOps Engineer, you are an essential contributor to our mission of establishing a world-class developer experience. You will scope, design, and implement developer experience focused on pipeline efficiency and infrastructure for a connected development loop inspired by Platform Engineering. The aim is to enable our engineers to validate and deploy their ideas within 24 hours of conception. Seize this opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact on the industry!
   

  

 You will have the chance to contribute to our “developer platform” and “developer portal” initiatives. These elements are integral to any modern tech organization. You will collaborate with a skilled team to develop and sustain these vital components. You will also contribute to creating pipelines and supporting infrastructure to enable self-service workflows across these capabilities.
   

  

**Qualifications**
* Programming experience in Typescript or Python and scripting experience.
* Experience with containerization, Cloud Computing (AWS or Azure preferred), Kubernetes, or Docker.
* Automation and orchestration experience including Terraform, Helm, GitLab CI, ArgoCD.
* Experience in setting up monitoring for infrastructure and applications with tools such as Prometheus, Datadog, OpenTelemetry.
* Experience in configuring and troubleshooting container environments.
* Experience in software release strategies in production environment.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.


 Application
   

  

 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

 Further information
   

  

 If you would like to learn more about the position please contact Mariette Annergren (Group Manager, EEDCD) at +46855353145.

title: Junior Smart Cloud Engineer till Nordomatic!
description:
Hos Nordomatic är ingen dag den andra lik. Speciellt för dig som gillar förena din fallenhet för människor med ditt intresse för teknik. Du är med och bidrar till säkra och smarta lösningar och arbetet görs primärt från kontoret.
 


  


 Vi söker dig som har god teknisk förståelse, samtidigt som du tycker om att jobba projektbaserat och med människor. Som en bonus får du vara med på tåget att skapa en mer grön och hållbar fastighetsdrift!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Nordomatic Aktiebolag
 



  

**Plats :**
 Johanneshov, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Teknik
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, långsiktigt
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Hösten 2024
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Junior Smart Cloud Engineer på Nordomatic är du med och utvecklar den tekniska infrastrukturen på en av samhällets absoluta byggstenar. Här får du chansen att driva affären framåt genom att se över kretsscheman, placera ut symboler inom VVS, samt avlasta teamet. I den här rollen kommer du se över det som levereras till kund och säkerställa att leveransen alltid håller högsta kvalitet.
 


  


 Det finns många utvecklingsmöjligheter för dig som vill växa på en arbetsplats som präglas av öppenhet och högt i tak. Bland annat finns det möjligheter framåt att arbeta med budgethantering, granska och ta emot inkommande handlingar och delta i alla projektfaser.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En långsiktig anställning som anpassar sig efter dina intressen och förmågor
  
* En möjlighet att arbeta nytta för både samhälle och miljö
  
* En konsultchef som är mån om dina intressen och din professionella utveckling
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Följ driftskortsmallar och instruktioner från kund
  
* Rita driftbilder och placera ut symboler
  
* Utföra egenavprovning enligt protokoll
  
* Arbeta i databaser och i projekt
  
* Utföra samordnade avprovning med styrentreprenörer
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Innehar en gymnasieexamen gärna inom datateknik, IT eller fastighetsdrift
  
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska i både tal och skrift
  
* Har en god teknisk förståelse
  
* Innehar B-körkort
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Erfarenhet av att serva och underhålla teknisk utrustning
  
* Kunskap om nätverk och IP-adresser
  
* Erfarenhet från fastighetsbranschen, industriarbete eller som drifttekniker
  


  


 Kunskap kan erhållas genom utbildning, erfarenhet eller att vara självlärd.
 


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* **Social och lättlärd**
 - Du tycker om att jobba med människor och är nyfiken på att lära dig nya saker
  
* **Samarbetsvillig**
 - Trivs med att arbeta i team och ta del av andras arbete
  
* **Strukturerad**
 - Höga krav på noggrannhet och att följa protokoll
  
* **Flexibel och initiativtagande**
 - Att hjälpa till hos andra team i perioder med mindre jobb och alltid vara redo för nya uppgifter
  


  


  

**OBS:**
 Ett utdrag ur belastningsregistret kommer göras på den kandidat som får erbjudande om jobbet.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Nordomatic Aktiebolag**

 Nordomatic är en specialiserad tillväxtkoncern med fokus på 'smart buildings' och energieffektivisering i större fastigheter. Verksamheten startade 1967 och är idag den ledande, oberoende partnern inom fastighetsautomation. Koncernen är verksam i Sverige, Danmark och Norge. I Sverige finns kontor på 11 platser i landet. Nordomatics huvudkontor ligger i Stockholm/Globen. Sedan 2017 är Nordomatic ett certifierat Karriärföretag. Lär mer om dem på www.nordomatic.se
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Erik Gund eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth4@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106591

title: Säkerhetsintresserad DevOpsare
description:
**Vill** 
**du ha det bästa av konsult- och produktbranschen** 
 och samtidigt tycker DevOps och säkerhet är spännande –
 *då* 
 är detta något för dig ! Just nu söker vi på Knowit Secure Solutions en ny medarbetare som vill utvecklas och växa tillsammans med oss. Vi levererar digitala lösningar och bidrar till en hållbar framtid.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 På Knowit Secure Solutions utvecklar vi produkter inom säkerhet med våra egna framgångsrika lösningar; SignPort, CDA (Directory Services) samt Governance Platform. Vi växer, får hela tiden nya kunder och därför behöver nu stärka upp teamet med en resurs som ska jobba med främst DevOps men på sikt även backend. Du arbetar på något av våra centralt belägna kontor i Linköping eller Stockholm (med möjlighet till hybridarbete).
   

  

 Som DevOpsare hos oss kommer du att arbeta med och orkestrera containrar (Docker och Kubernetes) samt arbeta med CI/CD pipelinedesign. Andra saker du kan förvänta dig att göra är att scripta i t.ex. Python eller Bash samt att deploya i public cloud. Våra produkter levereras antingen som containers eller håller på att migreras till en sådan miljö vilket gör att du får arbeta med flera spännande aspekter i den processen. Vi är ett riktigt erfaret gäng med ett starkt kundfokus och vilja att bli och göra saker bättre.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som tidigare har tagit aktiv del i att bygga och förbättra CI/CD-system och är bekant med en del relaterade praxis såsom provisionering, leveransflöden, byggsystem, repository management, datahantering och datavisualisering. Gissningsvis har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med och orkestrera containrar, CI/CD pipelinedesign, deploya i public cloud samt scriptning. Vi uppskattar att du arbetar bra självständigt men inte heller har något emot att arbeta med kunskapsspridning. Troligen har du en kandidat- eller magisterexamen i datavetenskap eller motsvarande samt minst ett par års praktiskt arbetslivserfarenhet inom området. Extra bonus är om du har kunskaper i Terraform, Consul och/eller Nomad.
   

  

 För denna roll ser vi att du har god kommunikationsförmåga på svenska i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Lite kort om oss** 
 och vad du kan förvänta dig
   

  

 Knowit Secure Solutions levererar tre produkter med tillhörande tjänster inom områdena:
   

  

* Elektroniska underskrifter (SignPort)
* Identitets och åtkomstkontroll (IAM/CIAM/CDA)
* Riskhantering och regelefterlevnad (Governance Platform)


 I våra team stöttar, uppmuntrar och lär vi oss av varandra dagligen. Vi är ett bolag som alltid strävar efter att bli bättre, och det blir vi genom att värdesätta initiativ och ge varje medarbetare chans till att växa hos oss. Något som är lika viktigt för oss är att du som medarbetare har möjlighet till balans i livet genom att kombinera fritid med arbete.
   

  

 Hos oss värderar vi en fri kultur med nära kontakt med chef och kollegor. Vi erbjuder dig en snabbrörlig, rolig och inspirerande arbetsplats där vi löser svåra problem tillsammans genom att vara ett oslagbart team. Hos oss erbjuds du en trygg anställning med generösa hälso- och friskvårdsbidrag samt pensions- och försäkringsförmåner. Vi jobbar hårt med jämställdhet, miljö och hållbarhet och vi är stolta och glada över att både vara klimatneutrala och det mest jämställda börsnoterade bolaget. Vi vill därmed uppmuntra dig som kvinna eller icke-binär att söka tjänsten för att få bli en del av gemenskapen!
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Vi vet att det kan vara svårt att få in känslan i en annons, men tycker du att några av kompetenserna ovan passar in på dig – sök tjänsten idag så berättar vi gärna mer! Kontakta då Mikael Monié på mikael.monie@knowit.se eller +4670 825 96 17.
   

  

 Vi hoppas höra ifrån dig snart!

title: Identity & Access Management Consultant
description:
**We Are**
 Accenture Security helps organizations prepare, protect, detect, respond, and recover along with all points of the security lifecycle. Cybersecurity challenges are different for every business in every industry. Leveraging our global resources and advanced technologies, we create integrated, turnkey solutions tailored to our client's needs across their entire value chain. Whether we’re defending against known cyberattacks, detecting and responding to the unknown, or running an entire security operations center, we will help companies build cyber resilience to grow with confidence. Our team of the security sector’s brightest people uses the coolest tech to out-hack the hackers and help clients build resilience from within. We blend risk strategy, digital identity, cyber defense, application security, and managed service solutions to rethink the entire security lifecycle.
   

  

 Do you have the deep functional and technical experience to help implement security solutions that align with our clients’ business objectives? Do you have the expertise to design and deliver solutions for establishing system user's credentials, and processes for applying those credentials to access enterprise systems and applications? If so, read on and apply. Accenture’s more than 2,000 security professionals deliver holistic and proactive security solutions in 47 countries, and we’d love to discuss our open Identity and Access Management (I&AM) Security role with you.
   

  

**You Are**
 A cyber security savant. You’ve got the skills and experience to keep data safe from black hat hackers or other threats, whether by coding a threat intrusion module or sharing your latest ideas with the team. Day-to-day, you’re all about solving security problems for clients and using your people skills to make sure everyone on your team is working well and happily.
   

  

 You are passionate about security, love what you do and have a genuine desire to outsmart the bad guys. You have the experience to analyze a clients’ security posture, anticipate security requirements and help find right-sized solutions based on industry leading practices. You have a proven track record working successfully in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment. You’re a creative, analytical problem solver with above average documentation skills who can speak to both technical and non-technical audiences. You are eager to put your skills to use by helping us help our clients inject security at every level of their organization.
   

  

**The Work**
 The Identity and Access Management Security Specialist has the primary responsibility for the management and day-to-day operation of Fortune 500 Customer’s Identity Management systems and tools. This position will provide a successful level of service to business partners and end customers while adhering to web security and risk policies and standards throughout the enterprise.
   

  

  

- Install, integrate, configure, and deploy IAM solutions and systems to facilitate User Life-Cycle Management, Identity and Access Governance, Automated Provisioning, Single Sign-On, Federation, Privileged Account Management.

- Manage the complex PAM infrastructure and operations for the premier customer. Infrastructure includes multiple Servers for Enterprise password Vaults, DR Vault, Central policy Managers, Load balanced PVWAs, Application access Manager, Windows and Unix and On-demand Session managers, Privileged Threat Analytics, End Point Manager, SCIM servers, Enterprise backup solutions, for Safes and recordings backups

- Ensure an uninterrupted password change and reconciliation and session monitoring services for the windows, Unix and other Privileged administrators and business users’ activities

- Hands on experience in trouble shooting issues related to password rotation, account onboarding, monitoring, integrations with AD/ LDAP, SIEM Solutions and other integrations

- Develop and execute test cases and test plans for IAM solutions

- Responsible for Privileged User account administration of various Windows and UNIX accounts, Database and Network devices, Service accounts, DevOps and Scanning and Scripting Accounts

- Deep experience with Windows Operating Systems, UNIX/Linux and environments, IIS, SSO, Database and Application Servers, Authentication Products and ITSMs

- Integrating various platforms such as different LDAP providers, Windows Servers, UNIX Servers, Databases and networking Devices

- Creating and Managing Safes, Platforms and Owners, Managing Safes, recording backups

- Experience in installing or upgrading PAM solutions and connectors

- Perform health check monitoring on all severs to ensure consistent availability of system to end user

- Manage and evaluate the effectiveness of the enterprise's PAM Solutions and Services to ensure they provide the intended level of availability.

 Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.
   

  

**Here’s What You Need**
- Bachelor's degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience. (If Associate’s Degree, must have minimum 6 years work experience)

- Minimum of 2 years of experience with managing cloud privileged Identities on various cloud platforms

- Experience in AD, lDAP, JDBC, SNOW connectors and end to end life cycle management

- Minimum 3 years of experience in at least one of the following IAM Vendor technologies or skills

- Saviynt: Saviynt Enterprise Identity Cloud (EIC), Saviynt Third Party Access Governance, Saviynt Cloud Privileged Access Management, Saviynt Application Access Governance

- SailPoint: SailPoint IdentityIQ, SailPoint IdentityNow, SailPoint SecurityIQ

- CyberArk: CyberArk Alero for Vendor Access Management, PSM for Cloud, Conjur / DevOps Secrets management

- Ping: PingAccess ,PingID, PingFederate, PingDirectory, PingOne, PingAuthorize, PingIntellegence

**Bonus points if you have:**
- Exposure to I&AM practitioners and experts

- Prior work experience serving C-Level clients as a security consultant

- Industry-adopted security certifications (e.g. CISSP), as well as I&AM vendor or industry certification such as:

- Certified Identity and Access Manager (CIAM)

- SailPoint Certified Identity Professional Program Certifications

- ForgeRock Certified Access Management Specialist

- ForgeRock Certified Identity Management Specialist

- Prior experience in the deployment and implementation of custom applications

- Experience with any of the following security areas:

- Information risk, privacy, and strategy (i.e. security and privacy policies, or risk assessments, or security and privacy compliance);

- Application security (i.e. application security testing or security integrations with Systems Development Lifecycle (SDL)

- Infrastructure security; (i.e.- securing networks and servers or security monitoring)

- Data security or encryption

- Prior experience with any of the following:

- Provisioning Onboarding

- RBAC Authorization models

- SSO WAC technologies Enterprise SSO

- Federation

- Privilege User Management

- Directory Services Meta-Directory Virtual Directory

- Authentication Methods

- Entitlement Management

- OAUTH, OpenID Connect

- XACML

- JSON, REST, SOAP

- HTML5, IQuery, Node.js Location: Stockholm

**We look forward to learning more about you!** 
 Apply online, attach your CV and letter of application in English. If you have any questions, please contact responsible recruiter: karl.kego@accenture.com

title: Senior Java Consultant
description:
Requirements
 



 Primary
 


* **Consulting Assignments** 
 : Provide expert consulting services for Java development, platform engineering, DevOps, and cloud engineering projects.
* You have a willingness to learn and become an expert in Kubernetes



 Secondary
 



 When not on consulting assignments you will be engaged in:
 


* **Internal Product Development** 
 : Contribute to the development of Stakater's internal products, ensuring high-quality code and innovative solutions.
* **Open Source Contributions** 
 : Engage in open-source projects, enhancing and maintaining Stakater’s open-source tools and frameworks
 
 https://github.com/stakater
 
 .
* **Kubernetes Managed Services** 
 : Support and improve Stakater’s managed Kubernetes services, ensuring reliability and scalability.



 Qualifications
 



 Must Have (Required)
 


* Minimum of 5-6 years of experience in Java web application development (considering candidates with less than 7 years if skills and experience are strong)
* Proficiency with Spring Framework and RESTful APIs.
* Experience in consulting and client-facing roles.
* Fluent Swedish in both speech and writing
* Proficient in English (both spoken and written).



 Nice to Have
 


* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fields.
* Experience with microservices architecture.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
* Knowledge of front-end technologies such as Angular or React.
* Experience with Kubernetes and containerization technologies.
* Experience with middleware technologies like Kafka.
* Experience with automation technologies like Terraform, Ansible or Crossplane.
* Experience with CI/CD and GitOps.



 Compensation
 


* Salary level: up to 72.000 SEK gross per month (flexibility in offering higher compensation based on experience and skillset).
* Benefits:
* Work Toys: Macbook, iPhone, Headphones (Sony/Bose), Smartwatch (if required)
* Learning: Books and online courses, Conferences
* Health and training grant
* Insurance: Pension, Health Insurance, Occupational Group Life Insurance, Sickness Insurance, Accidental Insurance.

title: Senior Data Engineer to Data Integration team, Saving Investment tribe at SEB in Stockholm
description:
*SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From Java to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone.*
**What You Will Be Doing**
 The Data and Integrations team within Savings Offering is looking for a Senior Data Engineer with strong technical skills to join us on our exciting transformation journey to develop a new modern savings investment platform. You will be joining a team with a primary focus on building scalable and secured middle layer serving data to the front services.
   

  

 Together with the team, you will be leading the exciting mission to build pipelines to onboard data from different data sources ranging from relational databases, mainframe systems, and other wider means of exchanging data including APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) and message queues, and then develop scalable and secured services harvesting the integrated data. As a good metaphor, you will have feet on the ground (on-prem) but head in the cloud. In that matter, you will find Google Cloud Platform as a targeted working environment.
   

  

 In this role, you will be highly involved in decision-making and our technical road map paving the way forward for the Savings Investments tribe to serve Savings-related data to other value streams. Your work contributes to meeting data compliance and data governance requirements.
   

  

 Together with others, you are shaping our ways of working, and sharing knowledge and coaching junior developers.
   

  

**Your primary responsibilities will include:**
* Building scalable and secured services to serve data within and outside Savings Investment area.
* Working on and implementing the technical roadmap to realize SEB’s journey to Google Cloud Platform.
* Collaborating with architects, developers, and stakeholders.
* Participating in code reviews, mob programming, and general knowledge sharing.


**Who We Are Looking For**
* You are an experienced data engineer with a strong tech background working with data integration, data pipelines, and data management.
* To succeed in this role, we believe you are a team player with excellent communication skills and a positive, and open mindset. You would like to collaborate and motivate other team members in a multicultural environment.


**In general, we are looking for a person who has:**
* Several years of experience in software development and experience working with GCP.
* You should be able to navigate through GCP services without any map, discuss them in great detail, and quickly make a prototype to support your design.
* Understanding of system design, data structures, and being able to apply them.
* A forward-thinker mindset to drive change and continuous improvement across teams, tools, and processes.
* An analytical mindset that enables you to approach complex both business and technical challenges, and proactively tackle them with the help of the team.


**We use a wide range of technologies, and the followings serve only as an example:**
* Container-based technology: Docker, Kubernetes, OpenShift, and others.
* Google Cloud Platform(GCP).
* Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, GCP Pulumi.
* API development: GraphQL, REST APIs, Swagger.
* Programming languages: Python and bash scripts.
* Databases: BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Redis, or any relational, non-relational, in-memory databases that are suitable for the work.
* DevSecOps tools.


**What we offer:**
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits
* Innovative company in the forefront of technology
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Interesting, innovative work
* Top-class client network and projects
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Opportunities to help transform an industry


**Learn More About Working At SEB At Www.sebgroup.com/career**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity are crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe in, or where they come from.
   

  

**Ready to join?**
 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than the 30th of June. If you have questions about the position, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner , by mail at rasmus.hallberg@seb.se

title: Digital Analyst with Technical Focus to ICA Banken
description:
We are on an exciting journey to develop the area within Digital Analytics to work more data-driven, and we are currently looking for a curious and motivated Technical Implementation Specialist with experience in digital analytics, CRO & digital platforms. Are you who we are looking for?
   

  

**This is your future job!**
 It's the perfect time to join our Analytics & Customer Value competence area. The competence area is built up of highly skilled Digital Analysts, Data Analysts, Business Analysts, Customer Value Specialists and Data Scientists who, together with the business, drive our digital and agile transformation forward. You will be a key part of this exciting journey and will proactively work in the Digital Analytics & CRO team supporting with developing our digital channels.
   

  

 More specifically, you will:
   

  

* Take responsibility for the set up and maintenance of the measurability strategy across multiple digital channels, such as implementation, tag management and tracking.
* Create easily digestible dashboards to support self-serve data for stakeholders to inform decision-making.
* Provide actionable insights and develop recommendations based on measurement reporting and deep dive analysis, utilising online and offline data.
* Work hands on with Google Big Query to do deep dive analyses with behavioural data.
* Collaborate with the wider Analytics team across BI, CRM and Data Science on cross channel personalisation projects, throughout the customer lifecycle.
* Develop a strong working relationship with the key stakeholders to ensure deliveries that are in line with expectations and the overall company strategy.


 In this role, there will be a lot of development potential and you will create a large network within ICA Bank & ICA Insurance, as you will be expected to collaborate with different teams such as Marketing, Product, IT, Business to Consumer and Insurance. The position is located in our light and airy headquarters in Solna, and you report to the Chief Analytics Officer (CAO).
   

  

**Who are you?**
 In terms of experience, we are looking for:
   

  

* 2+ years of experience as a Digital Analyst/Implementation Specialist.
* Experience using web based and analytical tools such as Google Analytics, Big Query and SQL.
* Experience working with tracking and tag management.
* Demonstrated understanding of measurability and experience of implementation, with the ability to easily communicate with web / app developers.
* Experience collaboration with other analytics teams and developers.
* Willingness to learn and educate others within the field.
* Passionate about working in a highly collaborative and agile environment.


 It is advantageous if you have worked within a Bank or Insurance company, and if you have previous experience with Jira and/or MS DevOps. Experience of working in an agile organisation and understanding of the agile way of working is also a merit.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who has sharp analytical and technical skills and likes to make things happen. It is easy for you to look up and see the big picture and you work in a structured way. You are confident in yourself and your skills and are happy to share your knowledge. Furthermore, you have a genuine interest and follow trends regarding Digital Analytics & CRO and you are passionate about working in a cooperative and agile environment.
   

  

 The role requires that you speak and write fluently in English and understand spoken and written Swedish.
   

  

**Contact Information**
 Questions about the position can be answered by the Recruiting Manager, Sylvia Ndikumasabo 0706 04 11 09. Questions about the recruitment process can be answered by the Recruiter, Bojana Mijocevic, 010-422 22 52.
   

  

**Last day to apply**
 Apply as soon as possible, as we recruit on an ongoing basis. Alternatively, closing date 2024/09/06
   

  

 We are supposed to mirror our customers as well as the society and require employees with different competences. We strive at recruiting people with different backgrounds and value knowledge and experience that brings in. We value good conditions for a sustainable work life by have a good working environment and possibilities to constant evolution. If roles require it, you will need to undergo tests, background checks and drug testing before employment.
   

  

 Are you curious about us and want to become one of our new colleagues? Of course, you are! Welcome with your application!

title: Salesforce Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
Välkommen till Redpill Linpros Salesforce Marketing Automation team!
   

  

 Vårt mål är att etablera det vassaste konsulthuset inom Salesforce i Norden, och genom detta letar vi efter nya personer som vill följa med oss på denna fantastiska resa! Redpill Linpros starka partnerskap med Salesforce som en redan väletablerad Top-Partner inom Mulesoft skapar grunden för vår möjlighet att skala upp snabbt från starten och bredda våra leveransmöjligheter med utveckling, arkitektur och rådgivning inom Salesforce.
   

  

**Rollbeskrivning**
 Som en Salesforce Marketing Automation konsult hos Redpill Linpro kommer du få ta del av utmanande och givande projekt där du tillsammans med vårt projektteam ansvarar för att leda och leverera end-to-end lösningar inom Salesforce Marketing Automation och CRM för våra kunder.
   

  

**Varför Redpill Linpro?**
* Vi har fantastiska team som arbetar med tex. Mulesoft och DevOps som lägger en utmärkt grund för samarbete och kunskapsdelning.
* Du kommer arbeta i ett företag med en ”start-up”-känsla samtidigt som du har alla de fördelar som en väletablerad konsultfirma för med sig.
* Vi arbetar med den senaste teknologi-stacken från Salesforce och vi drivs av att testa ut nya saker och se hur vi kan ta in dessa i våra leveranser


**Vem är du?**
 Först och främst, vi tror du är en driven person som söker nya utmaningar och älskar tanken på att vara med och forma något från starten med oss!
   

  

 Du brinner för att utmana, identifiera och lösa kunders affärsproblem med hjälp av Salesforce Marketing Automation produkterna. Du arbetar samt är nyfiken på att vilja fortsätta utvecklas inom att självständigt eller i team konfigurera Marketing Cloud/Account Engagement (Pardot), datahantering med hjälp av SQL, HTML, JavaScript och API:er.
   

  

* Du har 3+ års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Salesforce och deras Marketing Automation produkter.
* Du är intresserad av och/eller har erfarenhet av följande arbetsområden:
+ Dataanalys
+ Datadriven/personalisera marknadsföring
+ Projektledning
+ Omnikanalstrategier
+ Konfigurering eller utveckling inom Marketing Cloud eller Account Engagement
+ Datahantering med hjälp av SQL, JavaScript och HTML

* Du är flytande i Svenska och Engelska i både tal och skrift


 Utöver detta är det meriterande om du har erfarenhet från något/några av följande områden:
   

  

* UX-Design med hjälp av t.ex. HTML/CSS
* Certifierad i Salesforce Marketing Cloud eller Account Engagement (Pardot)
* CRM kunskap inom Salesforce Sales/Service Cloud eller liknande


 Redpill Linpro is the leading provider of Open Source services and products in the Nordics. We are located in Oslo, Stockholm, Gothenburg, Karlstad Linköping, Copenhagen, Aarhus, and Trondheim with a mission to share knowledge and best practices for a more open society.
   

  

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Kvalitetsmedveten teknisk Systemägare
description:
Vi är på en spännande resa, vill du hänga på? Vi söker dig som vill vara med och utveckla vår e-handel, i rollen som Teknisk Systemägare. Tjänsten innebär att du kommer arbeta med utveckling och förvaltning av Brothers tekniska e-handelsplattform, CRM-verktyg och systemintegrationer. Målet med rollen är att säkra en sömlös och effektiv drift av Brothers E-handel.

  

Dina arbetsuppgifter i urval:

* Utveckling och förvaltning av Brothers e-handelsplattform Adobe Commerce Cloud/Magento så att plattformen kontinuerligt möter marknadskrav och affärsbehov.
* Teknisk utveckling av CRM-verktyget Voyado i syfte att skapa och underhålla starka kundrelationer.
* Hantera och förbättra integrationer mellan olika system för att säkerställa effektiva dataflöden och processer.
* Lösa tekniska utmaningar och optimera integrationerna.
* Implementera och optimera Omni Channel-funktionalitet med målsättningen att skapa en enhetlig och sömlös köpupplevelse i både fysiska butiker och e-handel.


Du kommer ingå i IT-teamet men har också nära samarbete med kollegerna, framför allt inom e-handel och försäljning.


Vi söker dig som har jobbat några år i en liknande roll och nu vill ha utveckling i karriären. För att ha framgång i rollen behöver du vara kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad. Att arbeta inom retail är föränderligt vilket ständigt präglar vår vardag. Det gör att du behöver vara pragmatisk, framåtsträvande och ha lätt för att ställa om när förutsättningarna förändras.


Vi hoppas du har:

* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av digitala plattformar.
* Erfarenhet av Adobe Commerce Cloud (Magento 2) eller likvärdig e-handelsplattform.
* Erfarenhet av Voyado.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera och optimera systemintegrationer (API, Cloud connector).
* Förmåga att förstå och översätta affärsbehov till tekniska krav och lösningar.
* Teknisk bakgrund inom webbutveckling är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning är meriterande.


Rollen är ett vikariat på 7 månader med goda möjligheter till förlängning.


Om Brothers:


Brothers är en svensk herrmodekedja med 40 butiker i Sverige. Tillsammans är vi närmare 300 medarbetare som alla har drivet och ambitionen att erbjuda mode i kombination med enastående service, oavsett tjänst eller ort.


Med 30 års erfarenhet på den svenska marknaden hjälper vi på Brothers våra kunder att vara sitt absolut bästa jag, varje dag oavsett tillfälle. Vi tror på jämställdhet, på tolerans, på att mångfald berikar och på vikten av att agera på ett hållbart sätt.


Kontoret ligger centralt på Kungsholms Strand och hos oss jobbar också våra fyrfota ”kolleger” så har du allergier ber vi dig tänka dig för om du kan vistas på kontor med pälsdjur innan du skickar in din ansökan.


Vänta inte med att söka, vi kommer tillsätta tjänsten då vi har hittat varandra.


Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior AWS Cloud Architect
description:
**Job Description:**

**Role:** Senior AWS Cloud Architect

**Experience:** 8-10 years

**Location:** Stockholm, Sweden

**Role Description:**


We are seeking an AWS Cloud Architect who will play a crucial role in executing our Cloud strategy and achieving roadmap milestones in collaboration with our team. As an AWS Cloud expert, you will provide technical leadership, support cross-functional initiatives, and drive automation in cloud operations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the AWS cloud platform, providing guidance on best practices, security, and compliance standards.
* Stay updated with the latest AWS cloud services, features, and capabilities; evaluate their applicability to meet evolving business needs.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and business units to gather requirements, prioritize initiatives, and align cloud strategies with business objectives.
* Lead efforts to automate processes related to cloud operations, security configurations, account management, and cost optimization.
* Promote the Public Cloud offering internally, acting as an ambassador and point of contact for AWS cloud solutions.
* Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior architects, engineers, and developers, fostering a culture of innovation, learning, and continuous improvement.

**Competencies Required:**

* **Digital Expertise:** Amazon Web Services (AWS) Cloud Computing

**Experience:**

* 8-10 years of experience in AWS Cloud Computing, with deep knowledge of platform services, features, and best practices.

**Essential Skills:**

* Proven ability to build scalable, resilient, and cost-effective cloud platform solutions based on business requirements and industry standards.
* Experience with AWS Cloud Foundations constructs for Enterprises, such as AWS Control Tower and the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration platforms like Kubernetes.
* Expertise in infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform and AWS CloudFormation for provisioning and managing cloud resources programmatically.
* Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipelines at scale, with a passion for automation.
* Proficient in programming languages, particularly Go and Python, used extensively for serverless integrations and APIs.
* Strong understanding of practical security, networking, and cloud economics, including cost optimization and visualization (FinOps).
* Other cloud knowledge (e.g., GCP/Azure) is a plus.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to articulate complex cloud strategies to stakeholders.
* Ability to translate strategic plans into technical deliverables, ensuring operational readiness and stability.

**Why Join Us?**

* Be part of a forward-thinking team that values innovation and continuous learning. If you are passionate about leveraging AWS to drive business outcomes and thrive in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply!

**We would love to hear from you if you are interested in joining our team and contributing to our mission of innovation and excellence. Please send your resume and cover letter for consideration to** **anu@beyondtech.se****.**

title: Content Marketing Manager (Interim)
description:
Want to be part of transforming road freight – for good? Einride is showing the world a new way to move, based on the latest digital, electric and autonomous technologies. Through freight capacity as a service, we enable businesses around the world to accelerate towards their sustainability goals.  

Founded in 2016, Einride became the first company in the world to deploy a cab-less autonomous electric vehicle on a public road (Sweden, 2019). In 2022, we were the first to successfully operate such a vehicle on a US public road. Today our award-winning technology has been launched across 8 countries (and counting). Our clients are some of the world’s biggest shippers, including Fortune 500 companies.  

We are looking for an experienced Content Marketing Manager (Interim) to join our team and lead our B2B content initiatives. The ideal candidate will be skilled in both content strategy and hands-on content creation, with the ability to craft compelling content that resonates with our target audience.  

  

This role offers an exciting opportunity to drive our content marketing efforts, manage key projects, and contribute to our overall business growth during a critical phase of our scale-up journey. As a Content Marketing Manager (Interim) within the Marketing team at Einride, you'll be joining a top talent team of ambitious, creative, kind-hearted people who challenge conventional thinking, dare to be bold, and are passionate about making the world a better place.
### **What you'll do:**

* Content Strategy: Collaborate with internal stakeholders to refine and execute a content strategy aligned with business goals.
* Content Creation: Write, edit, and produce high-quality content including webinars, whitepapers, case studies, newsletters, articles and email campaigns.
* Project Management: Manage the content calendar, and collaborate with design & production to ensure timely delivery and deployment of assets across multiple channels.
* SEO & Analytics: Optimize content for search engines and track performance metrics to inform ongoing strategy.
* Lead Nurturing: Create and manage comprehensive lead nurturing campaigns across various channels such as email, and content marketing.
* Collaboration: Work closely with the marketing, sales, and product teams to ensure content supports broader marketing campaigns, business goals and product launches.

### **What we're looking for:**

* 4+ years proven experience in content marketing, ideally within a B2B environment.
* Strong writing and editing skills with an eye for detail.
* Experience in content strategy development and execution.
* Familiarity with SEO best practices and content performance analysis.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet tight deadlines.
* Experience with HubSpot Marketing Cloud (or other marketing automation tools) and Livestorm is a plus.
* Proven experience in lead nurturing, email marketing, or marketing automation, preferably in a B2B environment.
* Strong project management skills with experience leading both people and projects.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Swedish.
* Proactive by nature, thrive in a fast paced work environment and comfortable with ambiguity.


This position is a 12 month fixed-term contract (start November 2024) and based in Stockholm. We recommend you submit your application as soon as possible as selection and interviews are held continually.  

At Einride, we are innovators, building solutions the world has never seen before – but urgently needs. That’s why we take action, and it’s why we are always eager to be challenged. We know that our best innovations come from having a diverse mix of people, including those of different experiences, career paths, and walks of life. By coming together and sharing our perspectives openly – by disagreeing, discussing, and committing – we deliver greater impact.

title: Kommunikatör, vikariat
description:
**Generell information**
------------------------


Sista ansökningsdag
2024-09-15
Arbetsplats
Västra Götalands län
Kommun
Lerum
Yrkeskategori
Ospecificerat yrke
Anställningsform
Tidsbegränsad anställning
Omfattning
Heltid
Antal tjänster
1
**Kontaktperson**Åsa Thulin
Kommunikationschef 0302522079 asa.thulin@lerum.se
  
**Om arbetsplatsen**
--------------------

Lerums kommun, med centralorten Lerum, har cirka 3 200 medarbetare och ligger cirka 20 minuters resväg från Göteborg. Lerum är en kommun i framkant, som vill mer. Vi blickar framåt med respekt för vår historia. Här finns rum att utvecklas och att växa. En plats för en hållbar framtid. Tillsammans arbetar vi för att erbjuda god service och skapa välfärd för kommunens drygt 43 000 invånare. En levande kommun med rum för dygnets alla timmar, för alla skeenden i livet.  



**Arbetsuppgifter**
-------------------

Som vikarierande kommunikatör, kommer du under ett år, arbeta både strategiskt och operativt med löpande kommunikationsfrågor för kommunens olika verksamheter och utvecklar kommunens kommunikation med ett invånarperspektiv. Du ingår i kommunikationsenheten. Tillsammans arbetar ni proaktivt med kommunikation för att stötta förvaltningens alla verksamheter och den politiska organisationen. Som kommunikatör ingår du i Lerums kommuns krisorganisation. Kvälls- och helgarbete kan förekomma.  

I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår, utifrån den kommunikation som behövs, att skriva texter, layouta, producera foto och film, och publicera innehåll på intranät, kommunens officiella webbplats lerum.se och i sociala medier. I arbetet ingår också att utbilda chefer och medarbetare inom områden som rör kommunikation, ha kunskap om och hålla dig uppdaterad kring lagstiftning kopplat till kommunikationsområdet, att ha presskontakter och mediabevakning i frågor som rör kommunens verksamheter.


**Kvalifikationer**
-------------------

Du har högskoleutbildning inom medie- och kommunikationsvetenskap, journalistik eller motsvarande utbildning som vi bedömer är relevant, och gärna erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter. Eftersom du kommer att arbeta i ett team lägger vi stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.  

  

I övrigt vill vi att du:  

* har minst tre års erfarenhet som kommunikatör, journalist eller annan erfarenhet som bedöms relevant.
* är en god skribent, kan uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift och kan anpassa ditt kommunikativa budskap till olika kanaler och målgrupper.
* är van vid att kommunicera i sociala medier.
* är förtroendeingivande, serviceinriktad och kreativ. Du skapar och behåller goda relationer och gillar att arbeta tillsammans med andra.
* tar ansvar och har förmåga att strukturera ditt arbete. Du klarar av att arbeta med olika frågor samtidigt, tar egna initiativ och är effektiv i ditt arbetssätt.
* har förmåga att samarbeta, är flexibel, prestigelös och väljer att se möjligheter.
* har förmåga att snabbt skapa överblick av och prioritera mellan dina arbetsuppgifter, analysera och värdera information.

  

Vana att använda programmen i Adobe Creative Cloud och webbpubliceringsverktyget SiteVision är meriterande.
**Anställningens omfattning**
-----------------------------

Tillträde: 2025-01-15
Tidsbegränsad till: 2026-01-30
**Ansökan**
-----------


Referensnummer: C206577

  



**Anställning**
---------------


Arbetstid: Dagtid.


**Övrigt**
----------

Intervjuer kommer ske löpande under ansökningstiden. Så se till att skicka in din ansökan!  

  

Utvecklingen i Lerums kommun ska vara hållbar och vår styrning utgår från de globala målen i Agenda 2030.  

  

Vi tror att våra olikheter berikar och utvecklar individen, verksamheten och samhället positivt. Som arbetsgivare arbetar Lerums kommun aktivt för jämställdhet och mångfald och mot all form av diskriminering och kränkande särbehandling.  

  

Vi vill främja en god arbetsmiljö där det går att kombinera arbete, föräldraskap och fritid. Vi erbjuder förmåner som friskvård och personalvårdprogram.  

  

Som anställd i Lerums kommun kan det förekomma krav på att använda personligt Bank-ID i tjänsten för legitimering i till exempel systeminloggning eller annan verifiering.  

  

För att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsprocessen ber vi dig skicka in din ansökan via den här länken, och inte via e-post eller pappersformat.  

Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Regulatory Liaison Counsel - ISVs and Embedded Partners
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**



If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.



At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.



Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!



Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.

  


**The Work You'll Do:**



The Regulatory Liaison Counsel - ISVs and Embedded Partners will play a critical role in supporting and growing Sovos’ global ISV ecosystem and revenue stream by engaging with the Sovos partner ecosystem and supporting their needs as they look to Sovos for ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements in their solution portfolios and customer implementations. This position combines the expertise of a Regulatory Counsel, requiring deep knowledge and ongoing involvement in the processes of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, with the role of a liaison officer dedicated to facilitating partners’ access to the broader regulatory function within Sovos. This role reports to the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design.


*More specifically you will:*



* The Regulatory Liaison Counsel is responsible for bridging the gap between Sovos' regulatory expertise and its strategic ISV partners, ensuring seamless integration of relevant compliance aspects of Sovos solutions in various markets.
* Partner closely with Sovos functions managing the business and technical aspects of relationships with ISV partners to ensure satisfaction of partners’ compliance needs within the scope of Sovos software solutions.
* Maintain accountability for a ‘regulatory helpdesk SLA’ that allows Sovos partners to act with confidence, ensuring timely and appropriate Sovos regulatory input towards their customers.
* Ensure a deep understanding of Sovos Regulatory Affairs and broader interaction with public authorities on an ongoing basis.
* Work continuously with Sovos Alliances, Sales Engineering, Product Management, and other relevant functions to develop and maintain a robust understanding of Sovos’ partner ecosystem and the specific business processes and associated compliance needs that arise in that context.
* Represent the requirements of Sovos ISV and embedded partners in the evolving scope and day-to-day execution of regulatory monitoring, design, and affairs in close collaboration with colleagues in the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, as well as with Regulatory Affairs, Business Analysts, Product Managers, and other Sovos colleagues involved in designing, building, implementing, supporting, and maintaining Sovos solutions.
* Act as an integral part of the Regulatory Analysis and Design Department, internalizing contextual and factual knowledge that allows the Regulatory Liaison Counsel to act as independently as possible in their key role towards Sovos partners while also maintaining an excellent understanding of roles, responsibilities, and time allocation for partner support within the larger Regulatory Analysis and Design Department.
* Support the VP of Regulatory Analysis and Design and their teams to ensure optimization of resources in support of all relevant Sovos functions and help them with time and resource planning towards that goal.
* Explain complex tax rules in clear language for both tax and non-tax professionals, internally and externally.
* Support Partner Marketing by providing tax-centric marketing material and participating in webinars.
* In collaboration with Sovos Marketing and partner management functions, participate as a Sovos regulatory thought leader and subject matter expert in Partner events, advisory boards, and publications.
  

**What We Need From You**


* Juris Doctor (JD) degree or equivalent master’s degree in law, finance, or accounting.
* Proficiency in legislative tracking and tax research techniques.
* Experience in working within and a deep understanding of the enterprise software market, including the value-add of different categories of enterprise software to size and geographic segments in the business sector.
* Experience in working with and deep understanding of businesses’ financial, logistical, administrative, and IT processes and strategies.
* A strong affinity for and proven ability to communicate effectively with professionals in information technology, data science, and computer-assisted business processes.
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent research, analysis, and writing skills.
* Ability to read, interpret, and understand tax-related postings and documents.
* Ability to generate and interpret functional and high-level technical design content as it pertains to compliance and business processes.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize activities.
* Additional language skills are strongly preferred.
* Minimal travel required to Sovos locations and events.

  



**What Does Sovos Offer You?**


The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!


* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits

*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, colour, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*


**Company Background**


Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.


More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.
company_description: Sovos is a global SaaS company capable of meeting your regulatory compliance needs anywhere you do business.

title: Research leader for 5G Edge
description:
*Are you passionate about contributing to sustainable digital solutions? Does the idea of researching and innovating green, reliable, and trustworthy software solutions that bolster Swedish and European digital sovereignty excite you? If you are enthusiastic and curious by nature and enjoy working at the forefront of technology with colleagues and partners, then we might be the perfect fit for each other!*

**About us**  

RISE Computer Science department is the leading Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence lab in Sweden. You will be joining a unit with a focus on distributed computing in the Edge to Cloud continuum working with Space, Quantum- and High Perfomance Computing. Together with partners and customers from industry and academia we develop sustainable and energy-efficient systems at the frontier of applied science.

**About the role**  

You will lead the work with and develop RISEs 5G edge testbeds together with our partners and stakeholders. The role will require that you work with outreach and build a community of interested users and stakeholders to maximize the benefits made in the testbed infrastructure. You will develop RISEs position within the edge to cloud compute continuum. In this role, you will help strengthen Swedish and European sovereignty in digital and AI solutions. You will have the opportunity to work at a leading and rapidly growing research institute with excellent development opportunities. With a combination of a scientific and business-oriented mindset, you will engage in applied research, combining theory and practice for the users of the testbeds. This position is a permanent, full-time employment.

**Who are you?**


As a technological area leader with us, we believe you are a passionate and solution-oriented individual who enjoys combining a scientific approach with practical implementation. We value your personal qualities as much as your technical skills as you will work in a team. As a colleague, we think you are enthusiastic about taking on new opportunities and engaging in social contexts. With your solid skills, flexible working style, and aptitude for abstraction, you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, and high-tech environment. You are fluent in English but with the ambition to learn Swedish.


You have:

* a Master of Science in physics, mathematics, computer science or equivalent
* experience from software- or web development
* experience from working with innovation and innovation systemslong term
* extensive experience of working within the telecommunication sector
* excellent writing and communication skills


Experience from writing funding applications or working with industry is merited but not required.

**Are we right for each other?**  

At RISE, we like different, and we are convinced that diversity contributes to an innovative environment where we together challenge boundaries and develop new knowledge for the future. With us, passionate problem solvers meet to solve some of the world's most important, and perhaps fun, problems. We cannot promise you an easy job, but what we can promise you is a team of committed colleagues and exciting societal and industrial challenges to tackle. You will work in a dynamic environment that gives you development opportunities both professionally and personally. With us, you get the opportunity to make a real difference. Welcome to RISE Research Institutes of Sweden.

**Welcome with your application!**  

If this sounds interesting and you want to know more, you are welcome contact recruiting manager Tobias Edman, +46102284887. Last day of application is 12th of September, 2024.


Our trade union representatives are Linda Ikatti, Unionen, 010-516 51 61 and Ulf Nordberg, Sveriges Ingenjörer, 010-5166959. Calls from external recruitment companies and sellers were kindly excluded.

title: Senior Product Manager - ZEOS Data Platform (all genders)
description:
Location
Stockholm, Berlin
Contract
Full time
Job Category
Product Management
  
As Zalando transitions from Europe’s top e-commerce platform to the fashion industry's central hub, this presents an exciting opportunity to join our team. With a presence in 23 markets, we are connecting customers, brands, and partners across Europe. Since 2022, ZEOS (Zalando's B2B Logistics) use the infrastructure that Zalando constructed for itself as a basis to enable merchants to run, optimize, grow their business across multiple European markets and sales channels, with the vision to become Europe’s leading logistics ecosystem. We are unlocking fashion’ growth by providing flexible fulfillment capacities and full access to our European-wide logistics network.

  

As a **Senior Product Manager for Data Platform in** **ZEOS**, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our data infrastructure & data warehouse, empowering the entire organization with the data foundations, internal tools and insights needed to drive innovation and growth. Our Data team is at the heart of our business, responsible for building and maintaining a robust, scalable, compliance, and secure data platform that supports data-driven decision-making across all departments from product, analytics, BI, and operation teams.

  

You will own and drive the data and platform strategy by collaborating closely with data engineers, analysts, operation, and other product managers to define the vision and strategy for our data platform, ensuring it meets the evolving needs of our business. This includes managing the end-to-end lifecycle of data products, from ideation and development to deployment and continuous improvement.

  

Join our diverse and international team where you’ll make a significant impact on our data strategy and data foundation and shape the future of our company’s data ecosystem.

**INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN**
-----------------------


At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

  

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.


do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy
  

Our employee resource groups: https://corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)**
---------------------------------------------

* **Define and Execute Strategy:** Develop and implement a clear, actionable strategy for the data platform that aligns with our overall business objectives, drives innovation, enables self-service internal data tools, enforce data democratization and increases the time to value for the data itself.
* **Develop the Single Source of Truth:** Lead the data engineering team to develop the ZEOS data warehouse with 100% data coverage as the single source of truth for all data users in the organization.
* **Collaborate Cross-Functionally:**Work closely with data engineers, analysts, operations, and other product teams to ensure the data platform meets the needs of various stakeholders across the organization.
* **Enhance Data Capabilities:**Identify opportunities to integrate advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI technologies into the platform to unlock new capabilities for data users throughout the organization.
* **Prioritize User and Business Needs:** Continuously gather business requirements and feedback from internal users and stakeholders to refine the platform’s features and data coverage and ensure it delivers maximum value with a well communicated priority.
* **Own the Data Quality and Security:** Champion best practices in data governance, quality, and security, ensuring the platform remains reliable, scalable, and compliant with relevant regulations.
* **Promote a Data-Driven Culture:** Advocate for and support the adoption of data-driven decision-making across the organization, providing the tools and resources needed for success.
* **Stay Ahead of Industry Trends:** Keep up with the latest trends and advancements in data platforms, analytics, and technology to ensure our platform remains cutting-edge and competitive.

**WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF**
----------------------------

* **Product management experience****:** You have 3+ years of experience in product management and a background in Data Analytics, BI, Data Science or Data Engineering. Ideally your product management experience focuses on data platforms, analytics products, data products, or other technical platforms or internal tools.
* **Knowledgable in data area:** You have a good understanding of different concepts in data engineering, data warehousing, data infrastructure, analytics and cloud-based data technologies (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud), or yourself were a data consumer before (e.g. analyst, data scientist, data engineer). Basic skill in SQL or Python is a plus.
* **Product strategic vision:**You defined product vision, strategy and roadmap for your product, striking a balance between new feature development, technology enhancements, and operational excellence. You can translate operation and business needs into a clear product strategy, with a demonstrated ability to prioritize and execute effectively.
* **Leadership skills:**You have a track record of driving engineering teams to nail complex projects and deliver impactful data or platform products including leading their sprint prioritization.
* **Data governance & compliance advocate:** You have a solid understanding of data governance, quality, and security, and are committed to maintaining high standards in these areas.
* **Strong communication & stakeholder management:** You can effectively communicate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, fostering alignment and collaboration. You have a good hobbit of documentation for future alignment. You easily manage cross-functional discussions and establish great cooperation with stakeholders.

  

If you think you have what it takes, we encourage you to
