title: System Owner
description:
**Kvalitetsmedveten Teknisk Systemägare** 




  





 Vi är på en spännande resa, vill du hänga på? Vi söker dig som vill vara med och utveckla vår e-handel, i rollen som Teknisk Systemägare. Tjänsten innebär att du kommer arbeta med utveckling och förvaltning av Brothers tekniska e-handelsplattform, CRM-verktyg och systemintegrationer. Målet med rollen är att säkra en sömlös och effektiv drift av Brothers E-handel.
 



  





 Dina arbetsuppgifter i urval:
 


* Utveckling och förvaltning av Brothers e-handelsplattform Adobe Commerce Cloud/Magento så att plattformen kontinuerligt möter marknadskrav och affärsbehov.
* Teknisk utveckling av CRM-verktyget Voyado i syfte att skapa och underhålla starka kundrelationer.
* Hantera och förbättra integrationer mellan olika system för att säkerställa effektiva dataflöden och processer.
* Lösa tekniska utmaningar och optimera integrationerna.
* Implementera och optimera Omni Channel-funktionalitet med målsättningen att skapa en enhetlig och sömlös köpupplevelse i både fysiska butiker och e-handel.



  





 Du kommer ingå i IT-teamet men har också nära samarbete med kollegerna, framför allt inom e-handel och försäljning.
 



 Vi söker dig som har jobbat några år i en liknande roll och nu vill ha utveckling i karriären. För att ha framgång i rollen behöver du vara kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad. Att arbeta inom retail är föränderligt vilket ständigt präglar vår vardag. Det gör att du behöver vara pragmatisk, framåtsträvande och ha lätt för att ställa om när förutsättningarna förändras.
 



  





 Vi hoppas du har:
 


* Erfarenhet av förvaltning av digitala plattformar.
* Erfarenhet av Adobe Commerce Cloud (Magento 2) eller likvärdig e-handelsplattform.
* Erfarenhet av Voyado.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera och optimera systemintegrationer (API, Cloud connector).
* Förmåga att förstå och översätta affärsbehov till tekniska krav och lösningar.
* Teknisk bakgrund inom webbutveckling är meriterande.
* Erfarenhet av projektledning är meriterande.



  





 Rollen är ett vikariat på 7 månader med goda möjligheter till förlängning.
 



  





 Om Brothers:
 



 Brothers är en svensk herrmodekedja med 40 butiker i Sverige. Tillsammans är vi närmare 300 medarbetare som alla har drivet och ambitionen att erbjuda mode i kombination med enastående service, oavsett tjänst eller ort.
 



  





 Med 30 års erfarenhet på den svenska marknaden hjälper vi på Brothers våra kunder att vara sitt absolut bästa jag, varje dag oavsett tillfälle. Vi tror på jämställdhet, på tolerans, på att mångfald berikar och på vikten av att agera på ett hållbart sätt.
 



 Kontoret ligger centralt på Kungsholms Strand och hos oss jobbar också våra fyrfota ”kolleger” så har du allergier ber vi dig tänka dig för om du kan vistas på kontor med pälsdjur innan du skickar in din ansökan.
 



  





 Vänta inte med att söka, vi kommer tillsätta tjänsten då vi har hittat varandra.
 



 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: (Associate) Payment Software Specialist – based in Luxembourg
description:
The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate - Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Business Solutions Department (BSD), Finance Division (FD), Back Office Debt & Payment Unit (BODP), at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) Payment Software Specialist\*.** 
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

**This is a full-time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark (Associate) Officer IT Applications


***Panel interviews are anticipated for September 2024.***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will contribute to transform the way we manage critical IT software solutions, including ION D&C, SWIFT messaging and more. Your expertise will be key in analyzing business requirements, designing technical solutions, and configuring software to meet our digitalization, technology, security, and regulatory needs.
   

  

 If you're passionate about shaping the future of finance through cutting-edge technology and innovation, apply now and let's make impact together!
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Back Office Debt & Payment Unit and collaborate closely with IT colleagues and wider user community.
   

  

 The scope of the post includes the domain of payment & settlement. The activities could range from implementing new software, digitalize business processes, and strengthen payment and settlement solutions for cyber resilience.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Carry out the technical configuration and maintenance of ION D&C, SWIFT products and associated interfaces
* Conduct analysis with business representatives to formulate technical solution design/specifications, identify and prioritise new business requirements
* Take project management responsibilities for assigned IT projects, coordinating the implementation of new or enhanced software solutions with business users and other IT technical teams in order to ensure the completion of project within set time, budget and quality objectives.
* Provide 1st level user support, channel and prioritise enquiries from end-users; including the analysis of technical incidents, identification of temporary workaround, follow-up of resolutions in co-operation with other IT teams and the external software vendor
* Ensure that IT policies and initiatives in the domain of SWIFT messaging are implemented and key operational processes are run in the most effective and efficient way
* Streamline the communications with the software vendor and internal business counterparts for problem resolution
* Under the responsibility of the Head of Unit, coordinate consultants involved in maintenance and project activities so as to ensure the delivery of expected solutions to internal business customers


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related fields
* At least 3 years’ professional experience involving requirements analysis, software design, development or 1st or 2nd level support ideally in a mixed IT / Finance environment, with experience in back-office payment software
* Experience in payment and reconciliation software like ION/Wallstreet D&C, SWIFT Alliance Access, AWP installation, ESMIG, Alliance Cloud, SWIFT API, Accurate NXG, MT/MX Standards would be an advantage
* Solid technical background in programming and scripting languages (such as Unix shell, SQL, Python, Java) and DBMS Systems
* Knowledge of a financial back-office software (ION Wallstreet TRM - CLM or similar) would be an advantage
* Good knowledge of project management principles, methods and practices
* SWIFT certifications would be an advantage
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

*To find out more about our eligibility criteria click* 
*here* 
*.*
 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.”
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

**This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.**

title: Informationssäkerhetschef
description:
**vid IT-avdelningen. Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-09-16.**
 Vi söker nu en informationssäkerhetschef till IT-avdelningen inom Stockholms universitet. Vill du vara en del av vårt framgångsrika team? Brinner du för riskhanteringsfrågor, säkerhetsarbete och lagefterlevnad? - Ja, då kommer du säkert trivas hos oss!
   

  

 IT-avdelningens uppdrag är att stödja universitetet genom att tillhandahålla ett attraktivt och säkert utbud av tjänster som används av universitetets lärare, forskare, studenter och administrativa personal.
   

  

 I rollen som informationssäkerhetschef leder du arbetet med att vidareutveckla lärosätets hantering av informations- och IT-säkerhet och dess funktion.
   

  

 Som informationssäkerhetschef har du en central roll och samverkar med universitetets ledning, flertalet nyckelpersoner och drygt 70 grupperingar inom verksamheten; du kommer att sitta i IT-avdelningens ledningsgrupp, samarbeta med Universitetsdirektören samt sitta med i universitetets IT-styrgrupp. Informationssäkerhetschefen är medlem i Stockholms universitets samordningsråd för säkerhetsfrågor som leds av Säkerhetschefen. På IT-avdelningen finns en gruppering med specialister inom informations- och IT-säkerhet som medverkar i att uppfylla målen inom arbetet.
   

  

 I rollen ligger stor vikt i att kommunicera, samverka och driva utvecklingen av domänen i samklang med verksamhetens övriga utveckling.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som informationssäkerhetschef är du ansvarig för att Stockholms universitet arbetar strukturerat med informations- och IT-säkerhet, hanterar informationssäkerhetsrisker och -incidenter samt efterlever relevanta lagar och riktlinjer. I ansvarsområdet ingår bland annat följande uppdrag:
   

  

* Skapa/definiera informationssäkerhetsmål som stödjer beslutade verksamhetsmål.
* Skapa underlag för budget och resurskrav för att möta beslutad strategi för att nå informationssäkerhetsmål.
* Skapa och implementera strategier, styrande dokument och stödjande dokument och/eller processer för att uppnå informationssäkerhetsmålen och stödja verksamheten.
* Kommunicera informationssäkerhetsmål och -strategier för att etablera en förståelse för informationssäkerhet och etablera en informationssäkerhetskultur.
* Utveckla och underhålla universitets ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet enligt relevanta direktiv, lagar och författningssamlingar.
* Utveckla och underhålla ett riskramverk för informationssäkerhetsrisker och tillse att ramverket integreras med övrig riskhantering på universitetet.
* Utbilda och informera medarbetare och studenter om informationssäkerhet, informationssäkerhetsrisker, hot och möjliga konsekvenser för organisationen för att skapa en grund för en sund informationssäkerhetskultur inom universitetet.
* Tillse att relevant stöd finns för verksamheten för att implementera informations- och IT-säkerhetsåtgärder.
* Tillse att underhålla kommunikation och nätverk med nyckelpersoner, ledningsgrupper och andra specialister inom och utanför universitet inom informations- och IT-säkerhet.
* Utveckla och underhålla en strukturerad och relevant rapportering av informations- och IT-säkerhet för att stödja beslutsfattande iuniversitetets ledningsgrupper och mäta exponeringen gentemot informationssäkerhetsrisker och efterlevnad av ledningssystemet för informationssäkerhet.
* Identifiera en strategi för att skapa en motståndskraftig organisation och IT-system för att motverka informationssäkerhetsincidenter och/eller återhämta sig från dessa på effektiva sätt.


**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Akademisk utbildning inom relevant område alternativt likvärdig kunskap förvärvat på annat sätt.
* Flera års erfarenhet av systematiskt arbete inom informationssäkerhet.
* Flera års ledarerfarenhet inom t ex ledning av större incidenter, arbete med riskhantering och kontinuitetsplanering.
* Mycket god förmåga att driva förändringar mot uppställda mål.
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig väl på svenska och engelska i tal och i skrift.


*Meriterande:*
* Kunskap om informationssäkerhet enligt ISO 27000-serien eller motsvarande och MSB:s riktlinjer och metodstöd inom informationssäkerhet.
* Erfarenhet om informationssäkerhetsarbete från offentliga organisationer, gärna lärosäten.
* Erfarenhet från IT-revisioner och/eller nära samarbete med IT-revisorer.
* Erfarenhet och vana från att arbete med utbildning och kunskapsspridning inom informations- och IT-säkerhet.
* Erfarenhet från deltagande i arbete med informationskartläggning och klassning av informationstillgångar.
* Erfarenhet från internationella ramverk och standarder för informationssäkerhet, incidenthantering, kontinuitetshantering och hantering av informationssäkerhetsrisker.
* Kunskaper om personuppgiftshantering i enlighet dataskyddsförordningen och erfarenhet av nära samarbete med dataskyddsansvariga i offentliga verksamheter.
* Certifieringar såsom CISSP, CISM, CISA, Dataföreningen Operativ/strategisk informationssäkerhet eller liknande.


*Personliga egenskaper*
 Vi söker dig som drivs av ansvarstagande, arbetar strukturerat och har en förmåga att prioritera aktiviteter för dig själv och andra. Du räds inte att arbeta i en föränderlig organisation och är flexibel och anpassningsbar men samtidigt med integritet och långsiktighet som medför att uppsatta mål nås och strategier efterlevs. Du är social, kommunikativ och har en väl utvecklad förmåga att presentera i tal och skrift, både i mindre och större grupper. Du behöver vara en ledare, både formellt och informellt i olika grupperingar och sammanhang med en förmåga att coacha personer i din omgivning; att kommunicera och samverka med ledningsgrupper, forskare och andra nyckelpersoner kommer att vara en vanligt förekommande del av dina arbetsdagar.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Om oss** 
 IT-avdelningen har ett övergripande ansvar att erbjuda användarvänliga, ändamålsenliga och stabila IT-tjänster till universitetets olika verksamhetsdelar. Vi är ca 110 medarbetare som sitter i öppna lokaler centralt på campus i Frescati med goda kommunikationer. Vi erbjuder en härlig arbetsmiljö, spännande teknik och personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet har över 5 700 anställda med 30 500 studenter och är rankat som ett av världens 200 främsta lärosäten. Ledande inom forskning och utbildning inom humanvetenskap och naturvetenskap, med en bred samverkan nationellt och internationellt. Universitetet har de senaste åren infört en portfölj- och produktstyrningsmodell där produktteamen har en central roll. Vi är i en lärande process och IT-avdelningen arbetar fokuserat för att följa modellen. Det innebär att vi testar, lär och utvärderar, hjälper varandra till framgång, levererar värde kontinuerligt och hjälps åt att skapa trygga förutsättningar. För att trivas hos oss är det viktigt att även du håller med om att det är rätt väg att gå.
   

  

 Hos oss finns ett stort engagemang, alla som arbetar här vill göra en insats. Du kan läsa mer om vår organisation och vårt uppdrag på vår hemsida.
   

  

**Anställningsvillkor**
 Anställningen avser heltid och gäller tills vidare med sex månaders provanställning. Stockholms universitet tillämpar individuell lönesättning, ange därför gärna löneanspråk. Tillträde snarast.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig en hybridlösning för distansarbete, friskvårdstid, friskvårdsbidrag, träningslokaler på arbetsplatsen, personlig utveckling och ett generöst semesteravtal.
   

  

 Stockholms universitet strävar efter att vara en arbetsplats som är fri från diskriminering och ger lika möjligheter för alla.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Närmare information om anställningen lämnas av, Anders Fristedt, t.f sektionschef, anders.fristedt@su.se.
   

  

**Fackliga företrädare**
 Ingrid Lander (Saco-S), tfn 0708-16 26 64, saco@saco.su.se, Alejandra Pizarro Carrasco (Fackförbundet ST/OFR), tfn 08-16 34 89, alejandra@st.su.se, samt seko@seko.su.se (SEKO).
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du söker anställningen via Stockholms universitets rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande ansvarar för att ansökan är komplett i enlighet med annonsen och att den är universitetet tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Bifoga endast personligt brev och CV. Kopior på betyg och intyg tar du med vid en eventuell intervju.
   

  

 Anvisningar för sökande finns på webbsidan: att söka en anställning.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Stockholms universitet bidrar till det hållbara demokratiska samhällets utveckling genom kunskap, upplysning och sanningssökande.

title: SAP Accelerate
emails: nina.b.broman@cgi.com, carl.nordin@cgi.com, madelene.svensson@cgi.com, carina.lamberger@cgi.com, anna-karin.lofgren@cgi.com, chris.arnflo-nordin@cgi.com, frida.eriksson@cgi.com
description:
**Ta chansen att få en kickstart i din karriär inom SAP!** 




  





 Har du några års erfarenhet inom SAP? Eller har du kanske varit med vid en implementation av SAP? Då kan du vara en av dem som vi söker till vårt ettåriga Accelerateprogram inom SAP. Här kommer du att få en grym start i en utvecklande karriär inom SAP, där du under vägens gång kommer få delta i riktigt spännande konsultuppdrag parallellt med utbildningar och certifieringar, samtidigt som du vässar din konsultmässighet! Och såklart även massa annat roligt!
 



  





 Planerad start för detta karriärutvecklingsprogram inom SAP är 13 januari 2025. Sista dag att ansöka är den 31 oktober.
 



  





 Du kan läsa mer om vår SAP Practice och SAP Accelerate.
 



  





**Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter** 




 Nu öppnar vi äntligen åter upp ansökan till vårt framgångsrika och populära Accelerate-program på CGI för dig som intresserar dig för affärssystem och SAP.
 



  





 Här får du möjligheten till en specialiserad inriktning mot just SAP och även möjlighet att certifiera dig inom ett visst område. Tack vare utbildningarnas kvalitet och spetsinriktning ges mycket goda möjligheter att göra kometkarriär inom just SAP på CGI. Du kommer vara med på en spännande resa in i konsultlivet som kommer främja både din professionella och personliga utveckling.
 



  





 Vi har ett nära samarbete med SAP och inom vårt internationella SAP Practice har vi ett nätverk som sträcker sig över flera orter där vi utbyter kunskap och erfarenhet med varandra. Vårt erbjudande sträcker sig över områden som bland annat S/4Hana, S/4 Hana Cloud, SuccessFactors, User Experience, Ariba, och Concur.
 



  





 I rollen som SAP Accelerate-konsult väntar massor med spännande möjligheter och du kommer få jobba med stora förändringsprojekt hos intressanta företag där du kommer vara med och bidra till att bolagen effektiviserar sina processer. Du kommer få chansen att jobba hos välkända varumärken som gör sin resa mot den digitala marknaden där du får vara med och göra skillnad.
 



 Du kommer även få en egen mentor som du får stöd av under resans gång. Några av uppgifterna du i rollen som applikationskonsult kommer att utföra och få lära dig är t.ex. krav- och testledning, konfigurering, workshopledning och processkartläggning.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll** 




 Till vårt program ser vi gärna sökanden med bakgrund inom produktion, logistik, finans, HR eller systemutveckling.
 



  





 Förutom ovanstående så söker vi dig som har:
 


* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med SAP i gränslandet IT/Verksamhet
* Högskoleutbildning inom relevant område
* Flytande kunskaper inom svenska och engelska
* Ett brinnande engagemang för lärande och personlig utveckling
* Ett intresse för relationsskapande och samarbete



  





**Vill du veta mer?** 




 SAP Accelerate kommer att vara på följande orter: Stockholm, Göteborg, Örebro, Västerås, Malmö, Borlänge, Gävle, Sundsvall, Härnösand, Örnsköldsvik, Skellefteå, Luleå & Kiruna.
 



  





 Välkommen att kontakta någon av våra rekryterande chefer:
 



**Stockholm** 
 : Nina Broman, nina.b.broman@cgi.com
 



**Malmö** 
 : Carl Nordin, carl.nordin@cgi.com
 



**Örebro** 
 : Madelene Svensson, madelene.svensson@cgi.com
 



**Västerås** 
 : Carina Lamberger carina.lamberger@cgi.com
 



**Göteborg** 
 : Anna-Karin Löfgren anna-karin.lofgren@cgi.com
 



 SuccessFactors, Chris Arnflo-Nordin chris.arnflo-nordin@cgi.com
 



**Borlänge-Kiruna** 
 : Frida Eriksson frida.eriksson@cgi.com
 



  





 Välkommen in med din ansökan! Vi går igenom ansökningar löpande.
 



  





**Vad kan vi på CGI erbjuda dig?** 




 CGIs kombination av global och lokal närvaro, med kontor på 30 orter i Sverige, ger nöjda kunder men innebär även att du som anställd alltid har ett kontor nära dig. Detta i kombination med flexibla arbetstider ger dig möjlighet till balans mellan privatliv och arbete, oavsett var i livet just du befinner dig.
 



  





 På CGI finns även stora möjligheter till interna karriärvägar där du kan välja att bli specialist inom ditt område, bredda dig inom nya områden eller ta en ledande befattning. Via våra interna nätverk, projekt och åtaganden i globala och nationella industrier, erbjuder vi dig kompetensutveckling och engagerade ledare som stöttar just dig i din utveckling.
 



  





 Mer information om våra förmåner:
 


* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar minst 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.
* Lön: Fast lönemodell



  





 CGI leder digitaliseringen av Sverige och är världsledande på att omvandla innovation, information och teknologi. Genom djup branschkunskap och en förståelse för kundens utmaningar, bidrar vi med insikter för att skapa hållbara resultat. Vi finns i 40 länder med 90 000 medarbetare. I Sverige är vi ca 4000 anställda på 30 orter med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Läs mer om CGI på vår hemsida: www.cgi.se.

title: Uppskilla dig i systemintegration!
description:
Gillar du att jobba med API:er och integrationer, och känner dig redo att utmanas i projekt som behöver expertis inom de senaste plattforms- och integrationslösningarna? Vi erbjuder nu möjligheten till upskilling genom en strukturerad onboarding och skräddarsytt utbildningsupplägg.
   

  

**Vad gör vi?**
 Hos oss får du möjligheten att jobba teamorienterat i meningsfulla och kundnära projekt. Vårt Cloud & Connectivity-team ansvarar för att designa, utveckla och implementera integrations- och plattformslösningar, ofta i en skalbar miljö. Vi har en cloud-first strategi och är ett av de ledande företagen i Norden gällande offentliga molnlösningar och -tjänster – i samarbete med viktiga aktörer som Azure, GCP och AWS.
   

  

 Våra integrationskonsulter är experter på att smidigt koppla samman affärskritiska system, migrera integrationer mellan plattformar, samt designa API:er och uppbyggnaden av dessa. Vi strävar till att vara tech-agnostiska med fokus på hållbara och långsiktiga lösningar som stöttar kundens verksamhet och väg framåt.
   

  

**Vårt upplägg**
 Vårt skräddarsydda upplägg hjälper dig växa som integrationskonsult och förbättra dina kunskaper inom exempelvis iPaaS, API design & utveckling, kravställning, och testning av lösningar. Målet är att växa dina färdigheter inom systemintegration för att ta del av ett större utbud av utmanande och spännande projekt där du får agera expert kring de bäst lämpade lösningarna.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder en strukturerad onboarding följt av ett anpassat upplägg där du, parallellt med kunduppdrag, har chansen att avsätta upp till 10% av din arbetstid specifikt på kompetensutveckling och certifiering inom de integrationstekniker som du önskar, såsom exempelvis Boomi och Azure. Du får därmed möjlighet att påverka din utveckling och inriktning på Solita från dag 1.
   

  

 Som en lärande organisation erbjuder vi även möjligheter att växa genom;
   

  

* Mentorskap och intern coaching
* Kompetensnätverk och föreläsningar
* Externa och interna lärplattformar
* Roll-specifika learning paths, såsom vår Architect path
* Varierande och roterande kunduppdrag


**Vem är du?**
 Vi ser helst att du jobbat med integrationsutveckling eller -arkitektur i några år, exempelvis med tekniker såsom BizTalk, Snaplogic, TIBCO, IBM Websphere eller Oracle, och vill nu fördjupa dig inom nya tekniker och plattformslösningar.
   

  

 Vi hoppas att du har med dig;
   

  

* God erfarenhet av integrationslösningar oberoende av plattform;
* Erfarenhet inom ett eller flera av följande språk: Java, C#, Python, Golang, Node;
* God kommunikationsförmåga på svenska och engelska.


**Vad får du?**
 Som anställd hos oss kan du vänta dig;
   

  

* Projekt som skapar avtryck, både hos kunder och i samhället;
* Variation; i branscher, i team, i nya teknologier och system, i angreppsätt;
* Flexibilitet och autonomi för att utforma ditt arbete – läs mer från vår blogg;
* En trygg och human arbetsmiljö för att främja innovation, motivation och välmående;
* Konkurrenskraftig, fast lön i kombination med ett komplett förmånspaket bestående av exempelvis 30 semesterdagar, maxat friskvårdsbidrag, bike leasing, intern coach och ett omfattande försäkringsskydd samt pensionsavsättningar även under din föräldraledighet.


*Lyssna inte bara på oss – läs mer på* 
*Glassdoor* 
*!*
**Låter det spännande?**
 Berätta om dina färdigheter och önskemål, så tar vi tillsammans reda på om det kan bli en bra match. Detta är en löpande rekrytering.
   

  

 Om du har frågor får du gärna nå ut till oss på LinkedIn eller via mail: Head of People & Culture Patrik Rafstedt (patrik.rafstedt(at)solita.se); People Lead Sam Odeh (sam.odeh(at)solita.se) eller Talent Acquisition Specialist Kajsa Törnroos (kajsa.tornroos(at)solita.se).
   

  

 Vi rekryterar i
 **Stockholm, Göteborg** 
 och
 **Malmö!**

title: (Associate) Banking Software Specialist for Collateral Management solutions - based in Luxembourg
description:
The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate – Groupe Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Business Solution Department (BSD), Finance Division (FD), Collateral & Market Data Management Unit (C&M) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, an
 **(Associate) Banking Software Specialist for Collateral Management solutions\*.** 
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.
   

  

**This is a full time position at grade 4/5 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internally referred as (Associate) Officer IT Applications


***Panel interviews are anticipated for September 2024***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will work on critical IT software solutions in the area of Collateral Management solutions providing expertise on business requirements analysis, technical solution design in close collaboration with business counterparts. Join our team and contribute to reach the EIB objectives through innovation and digitalisation.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 You will report to the Head of Unit and work in close cooperation with all other divisions of the Group Digital Office and the user community. You will be responsible for a series of critical financial applications in which errors or delays (e.g. in payments or missed reconciliations) could have a big impact.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Conduct analysis with business representatives to formulate technical solution design/specifications, identify and prioritise new business requirements and cloud related activities
* Take project management responsibilities for assigned IT projects, coordinating the planning and implementation of new or enhanced software solution
* Coordinate, participate-in and improve the full lifecycle of a development project. Active development participation is expected
* Manage and provide 2nd level user support, channel and prioritise enquiries from end-users; including the analysis of technical incidents, identification of temporary workaround, follow-up of resolutions in co-operation with other IT teams and the external software vendor
* Ensure that IT policies and initiatives in the domain of Collateral Management are implemented and key operational processes are run in the most effective and efficient way
* Maximize the utilisation of standard functionalities offered by our core software packages and gradually supplement functionalities with new modules (both IT- and user-built) in an Agile way
* Collaborate with consultants involved in maintenance and project activities to ensure the delivery of expected solutions to internal business customers


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or related field
* At least 3 years’ professional experience involving requirements analysis, software design, development, 2nd level support, implementation and maintenance of enterprise information management systems, preferably in a banking environment, ideally in a mixed IT / Finance environment (Preference will be given to candidates with more senior exposure)
* In-depth technical knowledge of banking packages and interfacing techniques
* Experience with one or more banking packages such as ION WallStreet, FIS, Calypso, or market data management system like Golden Source, Alveo, Neoxam, Apex FIS or Markit would be an advantage
* Good technical background in Object oriented design programming (C#, Java) and scripting languages (Unix shell, Python, PL-SQL) and DBMS Systems (Oracle and/or Sybase SQL, DB Schema)
* Good knowledge of cloud and managed services principles. AWS architecture and functioning would be an asset
* Good knowledge of Financial IT applications architecture and IT infrastructure
* Knowledge of Collateral Management or Treasury is an advantage
* Ideally, good knowledge of financial instruments (such as bonds, derivatives, repos) and business processes (such as post-trade processing)
* Good knowledge of project management principles, methods and practices
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core competencies* 
 here
   

  

*(\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

*To find out more about our eligibility criteria click* 
*here* 
*.*
 Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.”
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

**This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.**

title: Senior Application Engineer
description:
Bentley Systems
   

  

**Senior Application Engineer, Solution Engineering**
**Location:** 
 Sweden or Denmark - Hybrid, Home Office, or Office based
   

  

****Position Summary:****
 Bentley Systems seeks a Senior Application Engineer to work in a customer-facing role alongside a team of sales and technical colleagues, they will provide the technical expertise required to win new business and increase usage in existing user organisations. The Senior AE is a trusted advisor and will be responsible for assessing prospect’s business and technical requirements and developing solutions that meet those needs.
   

  

****Your Day-to-Day:****
* Maintain expert level of product knowledge
* Articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users
* Perform value and benefit oriented technical presentations of Bentley products and solutions.
* Prepare and deliver both overarching solution demonstrations and bespoke tailored demonstrations for individual prospects or during marketing events.
* Work with the wider sales team to identify and analyse business issues and opportunities
* Assist Business Development and Sales personnel in technical proposal development for prospects and existing customers
* Provide your experience and knowledge of user requirements to help product management to design and develop new products and services
* Develop standard demonstration sets and content for selected products
* Knowledge transfer to partners and strengthen Bentley ecosystem
* This is a full-time role, based at home, in a Bentley office or a hybrid to suit your preference
* Travel within Nordics and EU up to 25% of the time on average


****What You Bring To The Team:****
* Full professional proficiency in Swedish and English language is required, Danish also desirable
* 5+ years of experience in managing ProjectWise, BCDE, iTwins or similar system is required
* Presentation skills and public speaking experience is desirable
* Comprehensive understanding of electronic document management with strong emphasis on engineering design
* Familiarity with relational databases, including administration, operation and maintenance with Microsoft SQL Server
* Excellent writing skills are a must, as s/he will be responsible for writing white papers and communicating product details and applications to the public
* Ability to communicate value and benefit propositions to audiences of all levels of knowledge and seniority
* BIM digital workflow experience


****What We Offer:****
* A great Team and culture – please see our Recruitment Video.
* An exciting career as an integral part of a world-leading software company providing solutions for architecture, engineering, and construction.
* Competitive Salary and benefits.
* The opportunity to work within a global and diverse international team.
* A supportive and collaborative environment.
* Colleague Recognition Awards.


****Who We Are:****
 Bentley Systems (Nasdaq: BSY) is the infrastructure engineering software company. We provide innovative software to advance the world’s infrastructure – sustaining both the global economy and environment. Our industry-leading software solutions are used by professionals, and organizations of every size, for the design, construction, and operations of roads and bridges, rail and transit, water and wastewater, public works and utilities, buildings and campuses, mining, and industrial facilities. Our offerings, powered by the iTwin Platform for infrastructure digital twins, include MicroStation and Bentley Open applications for modeling and simulation, Seequent’s software for geoprofessionals, and Bentley Infrastructure Cloud encompassing ProjectWise for project delivery, SYNCHRO for construction management, and AssetWise for asset operations. Bentley Systems’ 5,200 colleagues generate annual revenues of more than $1 billion in 194 countries.
   

  

****Equal Opportunity Employer:****
 Bentley is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers for employment all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, religion/belief, national origin, caste, age, or any other characteristic protected by local law or unrelated to job qualifications.
   

  

****About Bentley Systems:****
 Bentley Systems (Nasdaq: BSY) is the infrastructure engineering software company. We provide innovative software to advance the world’s infrastructure – sustaining both the global economy and environment. Our industry-leading software solutions are used by professionals, and organizations of every size, for the design, construction, and operations of roads and bridges, rail and transit, water and wastewater, public works and utilities, buildings and campuses, mining, and industrial facilities. Our offerings, powered by the iTwin Platform for infrastructure digital twins, include MicroStation and Bentley Open applications for modeling and simulation, Seequent’s software for geoprofessionals, and Bentley Infrastructure Cloud encompassing ProjectWise for project delivery, SYNCHRO for construction management, and AssetWise for asset operations. Bentley Systems’ 5,200 colleagues generate annual revenues of more than $1 billion in 194 countries.
   

  

 www.bentley.com
   

  

****Equal Opportunity Employer:****
 Bentley is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and considers for employment all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, gender/gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, marital status, religion/belief, national origin, caste, age, or any other characteristic protected by local law or unrelated to job qualifications.

title: Tysktalande supporttekniker till centrala Stockholm
description:
Till ett uppdrag hos en av våra kunder söker vi en tysktalande supporttekniker som är redo att arbeta i deras teknikvärld. Kunden hjälper företag och organisationer att skydda sina verksamheter mot brand och olycka. Tillsammans med deras kunder tar de fram lösningar som minimerar risken för brand och olycka - genom rådgivning, marknadens bredaste utbud av utbildningar, hållbara säkerhetsprodukter och service i världsklass. Företaget sitter i helt nya lokaler i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 Som supporttekniker spelar du en central roll i att säkerställa en smidig drift och användarvänlighet för IT-system och teknisk utrustning inom organisationen. Ditt huvudsakliga ansvar är att tillhandahålla teknisk support och lösa användares IT-relaterade problem. Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans i ett team där ni tar emot ärenden och här kommer du att spela en viktig roll genom att effektivt hantera och lösa IT-relaterade problem för användare från Tyskland.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 Du som söker tjänsten ska vara en person som tar initiativ och ansvar för din egen professionella utveckling och trivs med att självständigt driva arbetsuppgifter framåt. Din förmåga att kommunicera, både på svenska och tyska, är stark. Du är tydlig och koncis i din kommunikation och kan anpassa ditt språkbruk efter mottagarens behov.
   

  

 Med en positiv inställning tar du dig an och löser tekniska problem och utmaningar. Du är snabb att identifiera lösningar och arbetar metodiskt för att uppnå resultat. Du trivs med att samarbeta i ett team och är beredd att dela med dig av din kunskap samtidigt som du är öppen för att lära dig av andra.
   

  

**Krav**
* Tyska - flytande i tal och skrift
* Print Server
* Nätverk (Patchning, konfiguration, DHCP/TCP/IP, Cisco)
* Microsoft 365
* Active Directory
* Säkerhetslistor, distributionslistor och GPO:er
* Windows Server 2012
* Svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
   

  

*Mer om oss*
 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Linköping och Örebro. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Senior Frontend Engineer (ReactJS, Typescript)
description:
**Company Description** 




 Avy is a platform that enables housing companies to offer residents a simpler and more modern service, while also reducing operating costs and generating additional income. Through a user-friendly interface, residents can manage all aspects of their home and access carefully selected services for an improved living experience.
 



  





**Role Description** 




 We're looking for an experienced Senior Engineer to join our growing B2B2C prop-tech scale-up. In this hands-on role, you'll lead technical initiatives, architect solutions, and contribute to our codebase while mentoring other developers.
 



 Here you’ll get the chance to work with a young code base, engaged team members, new technology and be involved in decision making.
 



 You would be a part of regular problem solving sessions and solution workshops in which you would play the key role when it comes to giving input to the Product Manager on the complexity or possibility of a specific solution.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead the development of our React-based frontend application, utilizing modern technologies such as TypeScript, MobX, and Material-UI
* Architect and implement scalable solutions for our multi-tenant SaaS platform
* Drive best practices in code quality, testing, and performance optimization
* Collaborate with product managers and designers to translate business requirements into technical specifications
* Mentor junior developers and provide technical guidance to the team
* Implement and maintain integrations with third-party services and APIs
* Participate in code reviews and ensure adherence to coding standards
* Optimize application performance and implement effective state management strategies
* Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends



  





**Qualifications:** 



* 5+ years of experience in frontend development, with a strong focus on React and TypeScript
* Deep understanding of state management solutions (e.g., MobX, Redux)
* Experience with component libraries and design systems (e.g., Material-UI)
* Proficiency in building responsive and accessible web applications
* Strong knowledge of RESTful API design and implementation
* Familiarity with internationalization and localization concepts
* Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git) and CI/CD pipelines
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Strong communication skills and ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP) is a plus
* Understanding of prop-tech industry challenges and opportunities is beneficial
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field is a plus



  





**What We Offer:** 



* Opportunity to shape the technical direction of a fast-growing prop-tech scale-up
* Collaborative and innovative work environment
* Competitive salary and benefits package
* Professional development opportunities
* Chance to work on cutting-edge technologies and solve complex problems



  





**Location:** 




 Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





 If you are interested, apply directly on LinkedIn or contact career@avy.se in case of any additional questions.
 



 We are continuously processing applications and are looking forward hearing from you.

title: D365 F&O Technical Solution Architect, Europe.
description:
Are you a talent looking to build business skills, gain experience, and take on exciting challenges? Grow your career with Trelleborg and start shaping the industry from the inside!
 



  





**This role offers flexibility, and can be based anywhere in Europe, either from one of our global sites or remotely, and requires the ability to travel as needed to support our projects.** 




  





**Who are we?** 




 Trelleborg Industrial Solutions (TIS) is a global leader in innovative polymer-based solutions for key industries and critical infrastructure. We are one of two Business Areas within the Trelleborg Group, with a total of about 6 200 employees around the world. The Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations Competence Center is a part of Digital Solutions - the global IT organization of the business area TIS.
 



  





*”Being a part of a Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations team is being at the forefront of digital evolution, where your expertise molds cutting-edge solutions, and your daily work propels businesses into a new era of efficiency and growth.” - Hans Ahlberg, D365 Finance and Operations Competence Center Manager.* 




  





**About the Job** 




 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **D365 F&O Technical Solution Architect** 
 to join our team at TIS. In this essential role, you will lead and architect solutions for D365 F&O opportunities, working closely with project management to deliver robust solutions, manage project scope, and provide leadership in application functionality. You will be responsible to lead the technical team in accordance with the design that you want to implement.
 



  





**Your New Role** 




 As the D365 F&O Technical Solution Architect, you will be key in designing and implementing comprehensive solutions that align with our business needs. You will oversee the integration of D365 F&O with other systems, manage technical requirements, and ensure that our solutions are scalable, reliable, and secure. Additionally, you will provide technical guidance to development teams, optimize system performance, and uphold high standards of quality and documentation.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities** 



* Develop and implement solutions that meet business requirements.
* Lead team of technical individuals.
* Oversee the integration of D365 F&O with other systems and applications.
* Gather and analyze both functional and technical requirements.
* Create and maintain solution architecture, data models, and configurations.
* Lead efforts to standardize and configure solutions while minimizing customizations.
* Provide leadership and best practice guidance to development teams.
* Ensure systems are optimized for performance, scalability, and reliability.
* Implement and maintain robust security models and access controls.
* Develop and enforce testing and quality assurance processes.
* Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation.
* Plan and ensure 'Ever-Green' update of D365F&O environments.



  





**Who You Are** 




 You hold a Bachelor's Degree in Technical IT, Business IT, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, and bring over 7 years of experience in implementing D365 F&O, with a strong background in X++ coding. Your expertise in core logistical and manufacturing business processes—including procurement, sales, distribution, warehouse management—and your knowledge of accounting processes and their integration with operations will be crucial in this role.
 



  





 Your technical proficiency in D365 F&O and related Microsoft technologies sets you apart. You excel in communication and presentation, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Your strong problem-solving skills, critical thinking abilities, and collaborative mindset make you a valuable asset to any team.
 



  





 This role can be based anywhere in Europe, either from one of our global sites or remotely, and requires the ability to travel as needed to support our projects. If you are driven, focused, and ready to lead in a dynamic environment, we would love to hear from you.
 



  





**Why Work With Us?** 




 At Trelleborg Industrial Solutions, your career progression and personal development are of utmost importance to us. In our vibrant and dynamic work setting, every contribution you make is recognized and your professional aspirations are actively fostered. Committed to innovation, excellence, and ecological sustainability, we ensure that your efforts contribute not just to our organizational achievements but also to global technological and data management advancements. Seize this chance to make a meaningful difference at Trelleborg, where you will face stimulating challenges, where your growth is certain, and where your career can flourish.
 



  





**Application Process** 




 Trelleborg is an equal opportunity employer! We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.
 



  





**At Trelleborg our people are #shapingindustryfromtheinside**

title: Oracle HCM Lead for the Nordic Region
description:
Do you have an eye on Human Resources and a heart that beats for technology?
   

  

 Are you ready to take your career to the next level and lead our Oracle HCM practice in the vibrant Nordic region?
   

  

 We are seeking a dynamic and motivated professional to join our team as the Oracle HCM Lead. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in shaping and driving the Oracle HCM practice, bringing innovative solutions to our clients, and contributing to the growth of our organization. If you are passionate about Oracle HCM, possess strong leadership skills, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Accenture is Oracle's largest global partner, and the team you'll be part of is made up of both early-stage professionals and global experts who have spent their entire careers on Oracle.
   

  

 As the Oracle HCM Lead for the Nordic region, you will:
   

  

  

- Provide strategic direction for the Oracle HCM practice, aligning with organizational goals and client needs.

- Lead client interactions, understanding their business requirements, and delivering tailored Oracle HCM solutions.

- Oversee end-to-end project delivery, ensuring timelines, budgets, and quality standards are met.

- Foster a collaborative team environment, mentoring and guiding team members to achieve excellence.

- Stay abreast of industry trends, bring fresh ideas, and champion innovative approaches to Oracle HCM implementation.

 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

  

- Minimum of 7 years of hands-on experience leading Oracle HCM projects.

- In-depth knowledge of Oracle HCM Cloud modules and a successful track record of implementation.

- Demonstrated ability to lead and inspire a team, driving successful project outcomes.

- Strong client management skills with the ability to understand and address client needs effectively.

- Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal.

- Relevant Oracle HCM certifications will be a strong advantage.

- Proven ability to analyze complex problems and provide innovative solutions.

- Understanding of the business landscape and cultural nuances in the Nordic region is a plus.

 We offer you:
   

  

  

- Work with varied and interesting customers. One of Accenture's strengths is our broad client portfolio, which includes many of our leading companies in a wide range of industries.

- We put a lot of focus on both building knowledge within Oracle, but also general knowledge that is required to be able to help our customers and deliver successful projects.

- Our employee wellbeing is highly valued topic for us,we find solutions to get the puzzle of life together with family & work.

 If you are ready to make a significant impact, lead with passion, and contribute to the success of our Oracle HCM practice in the Nordic region, we invite you to apply and submit your CV and cover letter. Join us in creating transformative experiences for our clients and unlocking the full potential of Oracle HCM solutions!

title: Wiring Harness Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Wiring Harness Engineer with over 3 years of experience and background in using SABER for electrical design and simulation. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and optimizing wiring harnesses for various projects, ensuring that all designs meet quality and safety standards.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Design and develop wiring harnesses for automotive.
* Utilize SABER for electrical design, simulation, and analysis of wiring harness systems.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate wiring harness designs with mechanical and electronic systems.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards, safety regulations, and project requirements.
* Troubleshoot and resolve design issues during the prototype and production phases.

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in wiring harness design and development.
* Driver's license (valid in Sweden).
* Experience with CAD software (such as AutoCAD, SolidWorks, or similar) is a plus.
* Good problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

 **Who are we?**

Conmore is a consulting company that highly prioritizes its employees. We provide exciting and challenging assignments and do our utmost in every situation in order to meet your desire for a matching position. To enhance and strengthen you as an individual all employees have their own development plan for individual growth. In order for everyone to develop further and thrive in their role as consultants, the group manager dedicates time for regular one-on-one meetings to listen and follow up on the work plan, and need for training, provide feedback, and more to make sure you are satisfied and in the right place.


We are proud of our company’s unique community feeling and we highly value competence and a secure work environment which we believe contributes to a pleasant and motivating workplace. Besides professional activities such as training et cetera, we offer regular social activities which bring us together to have a good time and share knowledge and experiences in the group. Despite our constant willingness to grow as a company we still emphasize preserving our warm family feeling.


We encourage all engineers to apply regarding gender, background or life situation.

 **Would you also like to be a part of our team?**


We are recruiting continuously, please don’t hesitate with your application and feel free to contact us if you have questions.


Technical Recruiter: Daniella Hernandez


Mail: daniella.hernandez@conmore.se


Phone: +46 70-624 0344


Please note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.


We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Test Engineer
description:

Design and execute detailed test plans. - Perform regression testing, acceptance testing, and continuous verification of bug fixes. - Work closely with the development team to highlight improvement areas. - Conduct WIFI, Radar, and GPS tests on advanced robotic mowers. You will be part of a dynamic team in Huskvarna, contributing to the future of residential lawn care. Expect travel up to 3 weeks per year for on-site testing.

**Essential requirements:**  

- Proficiency in testing physical products, preferably with software or embedded systems. - Familiarity with Jira and structured testing processes.
  

* ISTQB certification or similar is a plus.
* Relevant educational background in testing, software development, electrical, or mechatronic engineering.
* Fluent in English, with excellent reading and writing skills.

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Husqvarna  

**Period**: 16-09-2024-16-09-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 06-09-2024  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Vehicle Dynamics Simulation Engineer
description:
Applications are considered on a rolling basis Ängelholm On-site  



**Job Summary**



Technical point person for virtual vehicle simulation models. Accountable for the development and validation of new vehicle models and ensuring that the vehicle dynamics characteristics match test vehicle data. Employee will work closely with the Track test team and the Product lines to ensure the vehicle systems are properly specified, meeting key deliverables, and achieving industry leading standards. In addition, responsibilities includes optimizing megacar designs and setup configurations for on-track vehicle performance gains, using predictive simulation technologies. Analyze data, and report findings to the track team and clients, from HIL, DIL, vehicle simulator, and real-world testing.


**Tasks**


* Creation and execution of numerous tests and test methodologies for accurate results
* Communicate and coordinate with people from multiple divisions such as design engineers, CFD engineers, and FEA engineers to comply with all the requirements and provide inputs for improvement
* Provide inputs and suggestions for design and performance improvements
* Analysis of on-vehicle racing car data (logged data, telemetry, etc.).
* Offline lap simulation
* Dynamic parametric models
* Multi-body models
* Work with the Engineering and Quality team for root cause analysis activities and document lessons learned
* Design world-class guidelines and test procedures

  
Skills & Requirements


**Skill Requirements**



Requirements includes Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering and 3 years of configuration, operation, and validation of vehicle dynamics simulation software. Familiar with systematic design of experiments. Technical knowledge of vehicle dynamics principles and chassis systems: aerodynamics, suspension, tires, etc. Expert understanding of limit-handling vehicle dynamics principles, and their practical application. Practical Experience with racing car set-up problems and methodologies is appreciated.


* B.S. in Mechanical Engineering, Vehicle dynamics, or equivalent required
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills required
* High level of people skills, able to work in a team environment required
* Experience in product engineering preferred
* Knowledge of Suspension, Steering, and Tires preferred
* Experience with MBD software such as Canopy/Adams
* Data acquisition experience preferred
* Microsoft software including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint required
Great Place to Work


Opportunity to impact a growing company


Work alongside world-class talent


Flexible work schedules + Culture of collaboration


Long track record of success and profitability


Engaging and sharing work environment


Quick decision making, flat hierarchy


About the company


Koenigsegg is most known for building some of the fastest cars in the world; with almost all of our megacar technologies that are patented and made in-house by our almost 500 world-class technicians, engineers, sourcing experts, production craftsmen, and communicators.


What we’ve created is a unique proving ground of engineering creativity that makes use of our breakthrough megacar development and legacy to push the boundaries of sustainable mobility technology.



So, what’s next?


We are on a universe-denting mission to develop the next generation of breakthrough tech and products. We are looking for outstanding, impactful, and authentic individuals to grow with us. Our ambitions are inspiring but will push the limits of what is possible – requiring one to work efficiently amid our cross-functional teams to execute at high-quality levels.


**The goal is clear: innovate and transform.**

title: HIL Engineer
description:
Welcome to Danda – Your Partner for Strategic Consulting and Innovation
  
At Danda, we are dedicated to helping businesses navigate and thrive in a rapidly changing business world. We are a leading consulting firm with expertise in strategy, IT, digital transformation, and business development. Our team consists of experienced consultants who combine deep industry knowledge with an innovative approach to deliver customized solutions that drive growth and efficiency.
  
At Danda, we believe in the power of close collaboration. By working side by side with our clients, we ensure that every project not only meets their current needs but also positions them for long-term success. Whether it's optimizing processes, implementing new technologies, or developing sustainable business strategies, Danda is the partner you can rely on.
  
**Our philosophy is simple:** we deliver results that make a difference. We put our clients' goals at the center and tailor our services to meet the unique challenges that each business faces. With Danda by your side, you have a partner who is just as committed to your success as you are.
  
Now we are looking for our next star!
  
  

**Your Role:**  

Develop various simulation environments for Hardware-in-the-Loop (HIL).
  
Write test specifications, perform testing.
  
Create test cases to validate hardware functionality and performance.
  
Analyze test results to assess hardware performance.
  
Work in a multicultural environment and collaborate with other team members and function developers.
  
Stay updated on the development of standards and regulatory requirements to ensure that HIL simulation environments and test methods remain aligned with industry best practices.
  
  

**We Hope You Have:**  

A Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Electronics, Mechatronics, Mechanics, or Physics).
  
Experience in the development of embedded control systems within the automotive industry.
  
Practical experience in programming with Python.
  
Experience with model-based development and verification processes.
  
Knowledge of software integration and basic knowledge of HIL simulator hardware.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

A fast-paced and dynamic work environment with a focus on technology.
  
Opportunities for professional growth and career development.
  
Competitive compensation and benefits package.
  
The chance to be part of a team shaping the products of the future.
  
A supportive and inclusive corporate culture that values creativity and innovation.

title: QA Engineer
description:
At **Dise**, we offer market-leading software for Digital In-store experiences. Dise works with forward-thinking brands, such as Volvo, M&S, J.Lindeberg and Uniqlo. From our offices in Sweden and the UK we enable our partners and their customers to design and implement unique Digital In-store solutions. We call it Dise – Digital In-store experience.

**We are now looking for a talented QA Engineer to join our dynamic team in Lund or Karlstad, someone that is as hungry for new challenges as us and that is ready to climb in the next role.**
  

As our new QA Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the impeccable quality of our cutting-edge products and services whilst driving continuous improvement within the development teams.

**Key responsibilities**

* Design and execute testing methodologies, audits, inspections, and tests to evaluate product/service performance and identify areas for improvement.
* Collaborate with development teams to identify process inefficiencies and implement improvements to enhance productivity and quality.
* Investigate and resolve quality issues, determining root causes and implementing corrective and preventive actions.
* Generate reports and present findings to management, highlighting areas of success, improvement, and potential risks.
* Stay up-to-date with industry best practices, emerging technologies, and QA trends, and recommend innovative approaches to enhance QA practices within the organization.

**About you**

* You possess knowledge of Linux, Windows and IoT systems
* You have worked within QA teams and successfully delivered high-quality software products. We value your hands-on expertise!
* You know software testing methodologies, tools, and processes and indulge in developing test plans, test cases, and test scripts.
* You excel at problem-solving and have the ability to troubleshoot complex issues.
* Detail-oriented and highly organized are not just buzz words for you, and you understand the need to manage multiple projects and priorities.

**What’s in it for you**

* Be part of a global, growth-oriented company that thrives on innovation and a dynamic work style, with short decision-making paths.
* Embrace team-building activities and a vibrant, inclusive company culture that values work-life balance and internal learning opportunities and career progression
* Boost your well-being with health initiatives and a wellness allowance, because we care about your vitality and balance.
* Option to be part of our stock option program and share in the success of our company as we grow together.

**We believe in people.**  

Our company culture is our most important asset and is based on our core values - think like a customer, make it simple, dare to challenge and trust in diversity. They guide us in everything we do - from the decisions we make to how we interact with each other and our customers.

**Next steps**


Ready to take the next step in your career? If that’s a yes, we’re over the moon! Take the chance to explore what you can do – one thing is for sure: it will never be boring.


️ Any questions? Innar Järva, Development Manager, Innar.Jarva@dise.com, line manager for this role, or Sandra Malmberg, sandra.malmberg@vertiseit.com, Global Head of HR, are here to help.

title: Design Engineer
description:
We’re looking for people who put their innovation to work to advance our success – and their own. Join an organization that ensures a more secure world through connecting and protecting our customers with inventive electrical solutions.


What YOU WILL EXPERIENCE IN THIS POSITION:


In this position of Proposal / Design Engineer you will serve various industries like the Renewables, Chemicals, Pharmaceutical, Power, Oil & Gas and Datacenters. The role will involve the estimating and the creation of MRO proposals as well as the preparing of design documents for electrical heat tracing projects.  



  

RESPONSIBILITIES IN THIS POSITION:


In this position, you will be responsible for:


* Assessment of RFQ’s:
	+ Review and analyze received requests for quotation both technically and commercially;
	+ Develop bid strategy and subsequent implementation in conjunction with our sales teams;
	+ Understand what the competition will offer to meet the same client requirements and how they will meet these requirements;
* Support:
	+ Attend bid clarification and project meetings where required.
	+ Provide technical support and follow up on proposals;
* Prepare:
	+ Estimates including cost-models;
	+ Put the proposal together including the writing of various sections based on “prepare to win” practices applied within our company;
	+ Prepare Engineering and Design documentation.

You have:


* Academic background in Electrical/ Mechanical Engineering
* Minimum of 3 years of previous experience in a proposal/ engineering role (preferably within the Process industry)
* Skills:
	+ Quick learner.
	+ High level of accuracy and proficiency in processing data
	+ Computer literate – proficient in a wide variety of MS Office programs (Word – Intermediate User, Excel – Advanced User , Outlook – Intermediate User)
	+ Languages:
		- English and Swedish language skills, both written and verbal.
	+ Some knowledge of power distribution and/ or Heat Tracing Applications.
	+ Previous experience of preparing the commercial bid analysis, working closely with engineering department nVent Thermal in the competition of the bid analyst summary.
	+ Full clean driving license.
	+ Be a self-starter / self-motivated, detail orientated and a good communicator (both written and oral)
	+ Understand technically in-depth Industrial Heat Solutions (IHS) product lines and relevant (Special) Applications for which they can be used.
	+ Analyze customer provided data and develop technical solutions that exceed client expectations whilst enhancing nVent Thermal Management chances of securing best Project Margin
	+ Interpret P&ID, line lists, plot plans, piping isometrics, piping plan drawings, piping/electrical/insulation specifications, and bill of materials.
	+ Produce calculations and Heat tracing Designs using in-house design software.

* Abilities to meet the physical and environmental demands:
	+ Working under pressure.
	+ The work will be in a typical office environment.
	+ Some assignments may require occasional travelling for customer visits (<10% of time).

#LI- CP1


#LI-Hybrid


**WE HAVE:**

* A dynamic global reach with diverse operations around the world that will stretch your abilities, provide plentiful career opportunities, and allow you to make an impact every day
	+ At nVent, we believe safer systems ensure a more secure world. We connect and protect our customers with inventive electrical solutions. We design, manufacture, market, install and service high-performance products and solutions for mission-critical equipment, buildings and essential processes. Our solutions are helping build a more sustainable and electrified world.
	+ We are a $3.3B company with a dedicated team of more than 11,000 employees around the globe. Our comprehensive portfolio of enclosures, electrical and fastening, and thermal management solutions dates back more than 100 years and includes nVent CADDY, ERICO, HOFFMAN, ILSCO, RAYCHEM and SCHROFF.

* Commitment to strengthen communities where our employees live and work
	+ We encourage and support the philanthropic activities of our employees worldwide
	+ Through our nVent in Action matching program, we provide funds to nonprofit and educational organizations where our employees volunteer or donate money

* Core values that shape our culture and drive us to deliver the best for our employees and our customers. We’re known for being:
	+ Innovative & adaptable
	+ Dedicated to absolute integrity
	+ Focused on the customer first
	+ Respectful and team oriented
	+ Optimistic and energizing
	+ Accountable for performance

* Benefits to support the lives of our employees

At nVent, we connect and protect our customers with inventive electrical solutions. People are our most valuable asset. Inclusion and diversity means that we celebrate and encourage each other’s authenticity because we understand that uniqueness sparks growth.

title: Electrical Project Manager
description:
Micvac is a leading innovator in food processing and packaging technology, revolutionizing ready meal production and preservation with a strong commitment to sustainability and cutting-edge technology. With a stable foundation and a bright future, Micvac is embarking on an ambitious growth journey to scale its business and operations tenfold, accelerating the transformation of the food industry. To support this growth, Micvac is expanding its team and are now seeking an Electrical Project Manager with experience in electrical engineering to drive innovation in food packaging solutions.
  
  

Role and responsibilities
  
As an Electrical Project Manager at Micvac, you'll play a pivotal role in driving our innovative initiatives forward. Your primary responsibilities will include managing new equipment projects, ensuring they meet customer requirements from the initial order through delivery, testing, installation, and start-up at customer sites. Additionally, you will oversee internal and customer-specific development projects.
  
  

In this role, strategic thinking is essential as you'll utilize our intellectual property to propel projects forward and provide technical support to customers, including preparing detailed customer quotes. Collaboration with cross-functional teams, such as customer acquisition, customer care, and strategic partners, will be crucial to fostering effective partnerships and ensuring technological advancement.
  
  

Continuous improvement is a core focus, and you will contribute to refining our technology and raw materials. Staying updated on industry trends and advancements will be vital to maintaining Micvac's position at the forefront of the industry.
  
  

This position will involve travel to our customers and partners worldwide.
  
  

Who are you?
  
We are looking for our next colleague who would like to lead the software and electrical systems development. To be successful in this position we see that you have a technical education, preferably bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering. You come from a background as an automation- or process engineer with a passion for electrical engineering/software and you enjoy working with machines, demonstrating a strong foundation in electrical systems/software. We also see that you have experience in PLC-/HMI programming and design. Several years of project management skills are a requirement as you will be engaged in product and tech development, as well as customer projects.
  
  

As Electrical Project Manager, you bring experience within the mass manufacturing environment, with the capability to navigate its unique challenges. You also have proficiency in diverse technology sectors, capable of adapting and contributing to different technical areas. Further we believe that you have proven track record of collaborating with external technology suppliers, ensuring a seamless and fruitful partnership.
  
  

Why join Micvac?
  
This is a unique opportunity to play a key role in a cutting-edge technology company shaping the future of food processing and packaging. The role offers the chance to be part of a major growth initiative in a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment focused on innovation and continuous improvement. Micvac’s sustainable solutions also enable you to make a significant positive impact on global food waste reduction and resource usage. If you are excited about this opportunity, apply today to join the innovative and growing team at Micvac.
  
  

As a team member, you'll find a workplace dedicated to nurturing diversity and an international work environment. In terms of future opportunities, there are numerous paths for career growth, as the organization is actively advancing key projects into industrialization. Moreover, the company is in a scale-up phase, indicating significant growth prospects. Additionally, there's a specialized Customer Acquisition organization within the company, emphasizing the company's dedication to expanding its customer base and market presence.
  
  

Your application
  
Does this sound like the opportunity you’ve been waiting for? Please go ahead and apply! In this recruitment process Micvac collaborates with Mpya Sci & Tech. For questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Talent Advisor Marcus Hultberg on 072-366 49 43 or marcus.hultberg@mpyascitech.com. We work with ongoing selection so don’t hesitate to apply via www.mpyascitech.com. Curious about Micvac and want to know more about the position? Welcome to contact us!
  
  

About Micvac
  
Micvac offers continuous in-pack cooking and pasteurisation solutions that are unique in the food industry. Our patented technology and packaging allow customers to produce a pasteurised, safe product with a shelf life of 40-60 days. The short in-pack cooking process is designed to treat the ingredients gently, preserving color, taste, texture, and nutrition. Chilled ready meals, components, vegetables, baby food and pet food are examples of products that are suitable for the Micvac method. With customers all over the world, Micvac develops and supplies packaging, equipment and training for both ready meal producers and foodservice market.
  
  

Read more on www.micvac.com
