title: Fellow Software Development Engineer - Game Engineering
description:
Overview:
**WHAT YOU DO AT AMD CHANGES EVERYTHING**

We care deeply about transforming lives with AMD technology to enrich our industry, our communities, and the world. Our mission is to build great products that accelerate next-generation computing experiences – the building blocks for the data center, artificial intelligence, PCs, gaming and embedded. Underpinning our mission is the AMD culture. We push the limits of innovation to solve the world’s most important challenges. We strive for execution excellence while being direct, humble, collaborative, and inclusive of diverse perspectives.

AMD together we advance\_
Responsibilities:
**THE TEAM:**  

The Developer Engineering team consists of enthusiastic programmers, many with game industry experience, who develop tools and technologies that can be used to ease the programming of GPUs for graphics rendering tasks. Members of this team are passionate Software Developers that are driven to the goal of releasing compelling products that will be adopted by game and graphical application developers. These individuals share a belief that technologies that they produce should be open and available to be used on any platform. This is the Open Source tenet of GPUOpen.com where their work is available to download.

 **THE ROLE:**  

As a Fellow in the Core Technology Group (CTG), you will be responsible for setting the technical direction for the group, deciding on product architecture in collaboration with other senior team members, and to enable the team to deliver their best work. You will also be responsible for representing game developers internally with other teams at AMD, ensuring that their feedback and requests are well-represented in many facets of AMD’s business. **THE PERSON:**  

As a senior technical leader, you will draw on your broad engineering expertise and your deep understanding of graphics and software development to help set the technical direction for Game Engineering. You will use your broad technical depth to collaborate and innovate with technical staff across the various functions to create innovative solutions to game development problems, specifically in graphics. You are action-oriented and embrace the opportunity to step into a technically challenging, highly dynamic environment where your personal measure of success is highly connected to the outstanding products you help to create. **KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:** **You will partner with stakeholders throughout AMD with the following overall responsibilities:*** Define the technical direction of Game Engineering.
* Support and advise key decision makers in exploring trade-offs, providing data and technical expertise.
* Provide input to other parts of AMD’s business as required.
* Lead research activity into cutting edge areas of real-time graphics technology with a focus on game development.
* Collaborate with other engineering groups who are undertaking applied research into ML-assisted rendering technologies within AMD.
* Use feedback from internal and external stakeholders to guide research direction.
* Lead and mentor engineers working on FidelityFX technology, as well as other key deliverables released on GPUOpen.
* Engage with customers of CTG’s technology as required.

 **PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:*** 15+ years of software development experience.
* 5+ years working as a technical leader.
* Excellent team management, product management, and organizational skills.
* Understands that requirements are rarely perfect and are willing to extract the spirit of the requirement to make the system or software better.
* Has excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Is willing to travel domestically and internationally on an occasional basis.

 **The following experiences are optional but highly desired:*** GCN / RDNA graphics architecture experience.
* Experience with DirectX 12 and/or Vulkan graphics APIs.
* Game engine or game rendering framework experience.
* Knowledge and hands-on experience in Machine Learning, with the ability to successfully create and optimize machine learning models for various applications especially around ML Model Architectures such as CNN, UNet, and so on.

  

**ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:*** Has a degree in computer science or a related technical discipline, or equivalent.

 **LOCATION:**
Anywhere

  

#LI-DB1


#LI-REMOTE


Qualifications:
*Benefits offered are described:* AMD benefits at a glance*.* *AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies, or fee-based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity, inclusive employers and will consider all applicants without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, national origin, race, religion, political and/or third-party affiliation, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates and will accommodate applicants’ needs under the respective laws throughout all stages of the recruitment and selection process.*

title: Senior Fullstack Developer for AI Enablement
description:
Are you ready to elevate your career and become a part of a team that is transforming the way TRATON delivers exceptional software solutions to our customers? We are on the lookout for several Senior Fullstack Developers dedicated to AI Enablement to join our dynamic team. You will be working in a hybrid work-setting with exciting and complex software development!
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We are dedicated to an inclusive and diverse workplace. You will join a diverse and competent team with a friendly, helpful and inclusive atmosphere. The team has a common vision of the goals and values, allowing us to take our jobs seriously while having fun at the same time. We care for each other’s personal development to learn, grow and evolve, in order to make our deliveries the best we can produce. Be yourself and reveal your talents!
   

  

**Your Role**
 In your role as a Senior Fullstack Developer, you are an essential contributor to our mission of establishing a world-class developer experience. You will help scope, design, and implement AI enablement applications including user interfaces and backend logic for a connected development loop inspired by Platform Engineering. AI enablement encompasses all software which aids the software development process by the use of AI tools such as large language models and other machine learning algorithms. The aim is to enable our engineers to validate and deploy their ideas within 24 hours of conception. Seize this opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology and make a significant impact on the industry.
   

  

 You will have the chance to contribute to our “developer platform” and “developer portal” initiatives. These elements are integral to any modern tech organization. You will collaborate with a skilled team to develop and sustain these vital components.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* You will create cloud-based full-stack solutions using modern approaches and best practices to cater business needs of TRATON .
* You will work with peers to develop AI enablement applications in the developer portal.
* Work with Large language models to create applications that create the most benefit to the TRATON software development process.
* You will encourage and improve knowledge sharing by working with peers from across the organization, sharing your experience, learning from others and contributing to our shared knowledge base.
* You will evaluate the performance and quality of our solutions and seek ways to improve them.


**Qualifications**
* Senior-level of competence within fullstack development.
* Interest in the latest AI technologies and trends
* Having deployed applications with Typescript, React Node.js and AWS or other frontend/backend technologies.
* Strong understanding of software development processes, tools, and methodologies.
* Working collaboratively in an Agile/Scrum environment.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills.


**Experience with the following is meritorious:**
* Large language models in development and/or production including prompt engineering
* Langchain, express and Rest API:s, kubernetes, CI/CD, playwright, Figma and Gitlab
* Methodologies Test driven development and Behavior driven development and Scaled agile framework (SaFe)
* The full software delivery lifecycle and git based workflows such as trunk based development


**Application**
 Your application should include a CV, personal letter, and grade copies. Ongoing selection and interviews will take place during the application period, the position may be filled before the end of the application period.
   

  

 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.
   

  

 Welcome to apply!
   

  

**Further information**
 If you would like to learn more about the position please contact Mariette Annergren (Group Manager, EEDCD) at +46855353145.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this role.

title: Senior C++ Developer
description:
**What We Are Looking For**
 We are seeking passionate and skilled Senior C++ Software Engineers to join our team and drive our strategic vision to transform trading for our clients globally. As part of our dynamic team, you will embrace change and excel in a fast-paced, global environment.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Participate in the design, development, and testing of financial markets software products.
* Develop and integrate various methods of information visualization.
* Evolve technically while working on data-intensive and latency-sensitive products.
* Engage in code-review practices to provide and receive constant technical feedback.
* Ensure internal quality standards are met through automated testing, including unit, integration, performance, and throughput tests.
* Continuously learn and enhance expertise in financial assets, investment banking, and financial technology.
* Contribute and promote best practices during development cycles using continuous integration.


**Mandatory**
**Profile Needed:**
* Bachelor’s degree in STEM fields such as math, physics, computer science, engineering, etc.
* Over 5 years of experience in C++ development.
* Solid knowledge of C++ features and programming techniques.
* Comprehensive knowledge of basic algorithms and data structures.
* Good understanding of modern C++ standards (C++ 17/20).
* Proficiency in debugging and troubleshooting.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a global team.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
* Familiarity with applying OOP concepts in performance-demanding environments.
* Good communication skills with proficient English proficiency.


**Beneficial**
* Knowledge of financial markets and financial technologies.
* Linux/Unix experience at an advanced user or admin level.
* Experience in multi-threaded programming.
* Experience in low-latency software design, performance profiling, and optimization.
* Knowledge of the Internet protocol suite and network programming.
* Familiarity with the LLVM toolchain.
* Understanding of functional programming concepts.
* Experience in other programming languages (Java, Python, Shell scripting, Rust, Haskell, etc.).


**Hybrid Flexible at Broadridge**
 We are made up of high-performing teams that meet in person to learn and collaborate as needed. This role is considered hybrid, which means you’ll be assigned to a Broadridge office and given the flexibility to work remote
   

  

 Broadridge Financial Solutions (NYSE: BR), a global Fintech leader with $5 billion in revenues, provides the critical infrastructure that powers investing, corporate governance, and communications to enable better financial lives.
   

  

 Itiviti was acquired by Broadridge in May 2021 and is now Broadridge Trading and Connectivity Solutions. Our combined offering enables simplification and streamlining of all front office, middle office, and post-trade functions — powering connectivity and multi-asset trading across global markets.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Stockholm Exergi är stockholmarnas energibolag och vi är ca 750 medarbetare som varje dag arbetar för att minska stockholmarnas klimatpåverkan. Vi värmer över 800 000 stockholmare och vårt 300 mil långa fjärrvärmenät är navet för de samhällsnyttor som vi skapar. Vi planerar att bygga en anläggning för koldioxidinfångning vid vårt biokraftvärmeverk i Värtan med potential att fånga in 800 000 ton koldioxid per år, vilket är mer än Stockholms vägtrafik släpper ut under samma period.
   

  

 Vi behöver fler duktiga medarbetare och hoppas att du vill vara med oss på vår Exergiresa.
   

  

**Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?**
 Som Data Engineer i vårt team hanterar du tillsammans med dina kollegor helheten runt Data & Analytics på Stockholm Exergi. Vi letar efter dig som lockas av idén att jobba med modern teknologi och att skapa bestående värden för våra intressenter. Vi söker dig som vill ha en nyckelroll i att skapa automatiserade arbetsflöden och pipelines för att hämta, organisera och transformera data från olika källor. Vi är idagsläget i ett stadie där vi utvecklar och etablerar en ny dataplattform på MS Azure och Databricks.Som en del av teamet inom Data & Analytics skapar du förutsättningar för dataanalytiker och maskininlärningsingenjörer att bygga stabila analyslösningar- genom att se till att data finns på rätt plats, i rätt format och i rätt tid, korrekt modellerad och tillgängligt i bland annat Power BI. För den här rollen ser vi att du har god teknisk erfarenhet i dataplattformar, liksom en vana att hantera affärskrav och kommunicera med användare.
   

  

 Rollen är en tillsvidareanställning och har sin utgångspunkt i Hjorthagen, Stockholm. Möjlighet till viss distansarbete finns.
   

  

**Varför jobba med mig?**
 Jag tycker om att arbeta på Stockholm Exergi och vill vara med i arbetet mot en hållbar stad. Min prioritet är att det ska kännas schysst att gå till jobbet och att alla får möjlighet att vara den bästa versionen av sig själva. Som person är jag engagerad, transparent och brinner för att få saker gjorda. Jag tror på att arbeta tillsammans, vara prestigelös och se till allas bästa. Tillsammans strävar vi efter att inte bara uppnå höga prestationer utan också att säkerställa ett hållbart arbetsliv för alla.
   

  

 Jag uppskattar att arbeta med personer som är lösningsorienterade, organiserade, kommunikativa och positiva.
   

  

 Annika Wallgren, Head of Business Solutions
   

  

**Vem är du som person?**
 Alla som jobbar hos oss måste vara nyfikna, ta initiativ och ansvar. För just den här rollen bör du vara en social person med en positiv inställning. Du kan jobba självständigt men trivs också med att arbete i grupp och har goda presentations- och kommunikationsfärdigheter. Vi ser gärna att du har ett stort leveransfokus och alltid strävar efter hög kvalitet. Vi värdesätter både tekniskt kunnande och god samarbetsförmåga. Ett intresse för att effektivisera och digitalisera verksamheter är något vi uppskattar.
   

  

**Krav**
* Akademisk utbildning eller motsvarande utbildning i komination med för rollen relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av arbete som Data Engineer eller motsvarande
* Du ska kunna flytande svenska i både tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper inom Databricks
* Goda kunskaper inom Power BI
* Goda kunskaper inom datamodellering
* Goda kunskaper inom Python
* Goda kunskaper inom Microsoft Azure, inkl. Azure Data Factory


**Nyfiken på oss eller våra anläggningar?**
 – Det är en blandning av strategiskt och operativt arbete, där jag får tala både med kunder om vad som är bra och vad som kan bli bättre och med utvecklare om hur vi kan lösa det. Det allra roligaste är att få höra av mig tillbaka till kunder som har hjälpt till med feedback i utvecklingen och berätta om att vi har löst det de önskat sig säger Camilla, systemägare
   

  

 Vi är fler kollegor som gärna vill ge en inblick i vårt arbete. Läs våra berättelser här.
   

  

 Två av våra anläggningar kan du dessutom besöka virtuellt. Gå in på stockholmexergi.se/virtuell-vartaverket eller stockholmexergi.se/virtuell-bristaverket. Det fungerar i både dator och mobil.
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen**
* Mer nyfiken på hur rekryteringsprocessen går till? Läs mer här.
* Vi behandlar dina personuppgifter för att kunna genomföra rekryteringsprocessen korrekt och effektivt. Läs mer här .
* Inför anställning till Stockholm Exergi genomför vi alltid bakgrundskontroll. Läs mer här .
* Vi arbetar för att främja mångfald och inkludering, inte minst när vi rekryterar. Läs mer här .
* Vill du läsa mer om fackklubbar vid Stockholm Exergi? Läs mer här.
* För frågor om tjänsten, se kontaktuppgift till rekryterande chef nedan. Frågor om rekryteringsprocessen får du gärna mejla till rekrytering@stockholmexergi.se.


 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 31 juli. Urval och intervjuer sker med hänsyn till sommarledighet.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Loyalty
description:
As a Senior Fullstack Developer, with a large focus on the backend, you will be a part of our Loyalty team, within our product Engage.
   

  

 Currently, the team is focusing on building a new system for bonuses and loyalty points where you will play an integral part. Besides that, we are always on the lookout for new ways for our customers, such as XXL, Samsøe Samsøe and Plantagen, to use our platform to build loyalty and community among their customers.
   

  

 Some examples of your daily work will be:
   

  

* Being part of the discovery, coding, testing, and deploying.
* Handling support issues, such as bugs, and helping navigation in the code base
* Create promotions, points, and other loyalty aspects such as gamification campaigns.


 Who you are
   

  

 To thrive in this role, you are a problem solver, who sees a challenge as an experience. Apart from being a skilled coder, we are looking for an individual who can be a kickstarter. We're not looking for someone to reinvent the wheel, but to analyze our current product, identify efficiency possibilities, and implement improvements.
   

  

 You have some of the following skills and experiences:
   

  

* A couple of years of experience as a developer in different teams and cloud environments
* Solid experience in C# and SQL server
* Experience in architecture
* Understanding of performance or optimization and understanding of high-scale systems.
* Fullstack, having experience in the frontend is meritorious.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits on a regular basis where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunities for personal growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment.
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked.


 Some of our benefits:
   

  

* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* Your choice of phone and gadget package
* 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour a week


**About Voyado**
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
   

  

 We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech - keep reading!
   

  

 Ready to join the team?
   

  

 Lovely!
   

  

 Applying is super easy. Use your LinkedIn profile (or upload a resume) and answer a few click-in questions (no data entry, we promise). We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what would be an exciting challenge for you going forward. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let that shine through in your application!
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct a background check on the final candidate. We use background checks from Scandinavian Recruitment Intelligence. Here you can read more about how a background check is done.
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Operational Risk
description:
**About Us**
 With over 150 million global active users and 2 million transactions per day, Klarna is on the way to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop. To help us get there, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent team—accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We’re looking for people ready to achieve the extraordinary and embrace our bold ambitions as we shape the future of payments and fintech. Will you join us?
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 As an Engineer in the Operational Risk team, you will be integral to independent control testing, and data maintenance within our internal governance, risk & compliance systems. Your work will enhance the data-led oversight of third party risks, fraud risks, and financial reporting risks. This position is crucial in ensuring comprehensive and efficient operational risk oversight and control within Klarna. You will work with Python and SQL, LLM Prompt Engineering, and OpenAI to achieve your objectives.
   

  

* Design and build of automated solutions that collates and analyzes operational risk data from both internal systems, and external data sources
* Design and implement solutions to automate control testing across operational risk areas.
* Maintain Klarna’s Governance Risk and Compliance system, whilst aiming to continuously improve the system for both first and second line of defense users.
* Perform independent control testing and process reviews to ensure the first line of defense in the company operates within risk appetite.
* Conduct in-depth analysis of structured and unstructured data to monitor operational risk performance. Identify trends and patterns to provide actionable insights and recommendations to first line of defense.
* Assist in preparing risk reports, ensuring compliance with reporting requirements in EU, US and UK.


**Who You Are**
* At least 3 years of experience in a financial services company or a bank with an understanding of risk management frameworks and practices.
* Proficient in Python and SQL, with experience in operational automation.
* Skilled in LLM Prompt Engineering and adept in integrating OpenAI technologies.
* Ability to transform business requirements into technical solutions.
* Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to managing risks .
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex information.
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.


**Awesome to Have**
* Experience working with internal systems and data platforms.
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance standards on risk management.
* Prior experience in performing independent reviews and testing of internal business processes.


****Closing****
 Please include a CV in English.
   

  

 Since 2005 Klarna has been on a mission to revolutionize the retail banking industry. With over 150 million global active users and 2 million transactions per day, Klarna is meeting the changing demands of consumers by saving them time and money while helping them be informed and in control.
   

  

 Over 450,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store. Klarna has over 3,500 employees and is active in 45 markets.

title: Senior Quantitative Developer
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For:**
 We are seeking a knowledgeable and experienced Senior Quantitative Developer to join our team in Stockholm. This role necessitates extensive expertise in fixed income instruments pricing and risk management. You will play a pivotal role in shaping our solutions and ensuring we remain at the forefront of the financial technology landscape.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Analyze existing and potential functional gaps to ensure continuous theoretical pricing of fixed income instruments.
* Design, develop, and maintain theoretical models and any additional tools required for pricing and risk management of fixed income instruments and derivatives.
* Communicate clearly the chosen design and underlying rationale to stakeholders.
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand business needs and deliver tailored solutions.


**Profile Needed:**
**Mandatory:**
* Proficiency in C++ (including STL, C++17) with the ability to write clean and efficient code.
* Extensive experience in theoretical pricing and risk management of fixed income instruments and their derivatives.
* At least 5 years of relevant software development experience.


**Beneficial:**
* Some knowledge of C# and/or Python.
* Fluency with git, bash, make, latex, Jupyter.
* Advanced Linux/Unix experience as a user or administrator.
* Some user experience with Atlassian Jira.
* Any experience with TBricks app development.


**Hybrid Flexible at Broadridge**
 We are made up of high-performing teams that meet in person to learn and collaborate as needed. This role is considered hybrid, which means you’ll be assigned to a Broadridge office and given the flexibility to work remotely.
   

  

 Broadridge associates helped us envision our Connected Workplace - a work model that allows associates around the globe, dependent upon their role responsibilities, take advantage of the benefits of both on-site and off-site work to support our clients, one another, and the communities where we live and work. Our Connected Workplace is grounded in the concept of FACS: Flexible, Accountable, Connected, and Supported, which is our commitment to our associates. FACS supports our strong culture and allows us to achieve business goals while supporting meaningful work-life integration for our associates.
   

  

 We are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment and committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates can only do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates diversity in all its dimensions.
